story:
Transforming challenges into contactless digital solutions for small businesses

 

Hello, I'm Jesse! I am part of a Super Small Business Digital Solutions Team. Our courageous and fierce leader has a super contactless digital solution to save small businesses from the pandemic assault.             

We need your business to stay in business!                                                                                                                                 

Here I am, the courageous and fierce leader fighting for small businesses to survive and thrive through this pandemic! I'm Margaret Jackson (MJ), I am the founder of the Small Business Concierge Communications & Digital Media (SBCCDM). I am also known as Bay Area/Silicon Valley's #1 Small Business Radio Personality on AM 1220 KDOW & iHeart Radio. We have watched small businesses suffer and lose hope for their business future because of COVID-19. We could not stand by and watch small businesses keep closing their doors.

So we did something about it. My team and I have designed contactless digital solutions to keep your products, services, videos, and more in front of your customers. We guide you on using our tools and help you develop your marketing, advertising, and branding intelligence to break through the barrier of the resistance of business growth in this pandemic.  

The world is opening back up, but safety and health have become more critical than ever. The customers are out there, and you can reach them through our digital catalog advertising and magazine business solutions. We seek to support qualified-existing-small businesses in becoming the digital bridge to keeping you in front of your prospective customers worldwide.  What does that mean? It means you can reach customers locally, nationally, and internationally.   

                                                           

 

The Situation: What is your mass-media digital advertising Situation?

The Objective: What is your digital advertising Objective facing Covid-19 and the Delta Variant?

The Strategy: Do you have a mass-media digital advertising Strategy?

The Tactics: Are you interested in digital mass-media advertising Tactics?

The Actions: Are you willing to take Action on your mass-media digital advertising?

The Controls: Do you think it is time to take Control of your digital advertising?

Situation Analysis SOSTAC Model (Small Business)

The current small business climate in a word is stressed. COVID-19 has forced a change in the economic paradigm creating shifts in business openings and closures, constant ebbs, and flows of COVID-19 cases in the United States slowing the ability to buy and sell products and services. Small businesses are not only concerned but are financially stressed due to low to no sales. A market that has been severely impacted by COVID-19. “More than half of all small business owners in the United States warn that the coronavirus crisis could make it tough to stay afloat, according to a new poll indicating that scores of small businesses are still grappling with lingering financial trouble amid an economic crisis that has already forced tens of thousands of firms to close” (Walsh, 2020).  

The SBCCDM realizes that the dependency is on small businesses surviving and thriving in the short term to successfully sell its products and services. The short-term market condition directly impacts the medium and long-term market conditions. “Using digital tools is no longer an admin task, it’s business-critical and has a direct impact on whether a business will survive” (Xero, 2020). With a digital perspective in mind, the SBCCDM B2B small business customer is identified by Who (existing small businesses pre-Covid 19), Why (fighting for a sustainable future), and How (using the SBCCDM digital tools and resources) and applying the digital online strategies to their business survival mix.

 

Situation Analysis SOSTAC Model (Intermediaries and Partnerships)

We have developed a mix of partnerships and intermediaries to increase routes to small businesses' survival. Although COVID-19 has impacted businesses globally, partnerships are more critical than ever before. A mix of partnerships can be key drivers to connect small businesses to corporations offering small business supportive products and services.

Our strategic partnerships are interested in engaging small businesses with special offers, discounts, and professional tips through the Advantage Membership Subscription.

 
Live Plan Business Plan Software (SAAS)
Praised by industry experts
(Entrepreneur, CNN Money The Wall Street, Bloomberg, and more...) 

Partnerships and Intermediaries provide an ecosystem of resources for our members such as,

  • Business Plan - Live Plan Access 
  • Accounting and Bookkeeping  
  • Staffing & Talent Acquisition 
  • Financial Planning & Education  
  • Business Consulting Recommended Resources (Nationwide)
  • Aspiring Collegiate Entrepreneurship & Higher Education
  • Small Business Insurances (Medical, Worker's Comp., Liability/BOP)
  • Short vignette business and marketing tips that help you achieve strategic and sustainable goals by partners & intermediaries, industry experts, and our SBCCDM Team.
  • Lead generation and partnership collaborations to grow and sustain your business    

Cost-Effective Digital Media Solution

Small businesses require a long-term, cost-effective product that provides various digital media channels that introduces their brand to a mass market. They can market and advertise their business steadily with a long-term digital marketing media plan. Small businesses want to drive sales and build brand awareness according to Leadpages, “Driving sales (51.3%) and building brand awareness (48.4%) are the two top digital marketing priorities for small businesses" (Leadpages, 2017).

Our Advantage Membership Subscription provides micro-businesses and small businesses digital advertising, marketing, and branding media products offering exposure and visibility of their products and services on multiple mass media platforms.

 

HOW IT WORKS! Mobile-Desktop-Tablet Access

Advantage Membership
Digital Subscription Rewards
Pandemic Pricing

NO Sells Fees and NO Platform Fees! We Are Not AMAZON! You Keep What You Earn!
On-Demand HyperLink to your product or service for immediate purchase. 

Build Your Brand Monthly Advantage Member Subscription $25.00!

I Support Small Businesses 1 Mo. Advantage Member Subscription $25.00!  

6 Mo. Market Advantage Subscription - One Time Investment $150.00!

Featured:12 Mo. Brand Builder Advantage Member Subscription $67.00! 

12 Mo.+ Digital Blockbuster - One Time Investment
 Advantage Member Subscription $800.00 the Comeback! 

Disqualified Business Types
Adult Entertainment Companies
Alcohol, Gambling, and Tobacco
Businesses Engaged in any illegal activity
Cannabis
Churches or Religious Organizations 

The Small Business Concierge Magazine

Introducing the Small Business Concierge Digital Catalog - Launching September 2021

 

Paired Together

the SBC Digital Catalog & Digital Magazine

Double Dose of Digital Advertising & Content Marketing! 

 

You can market from anywhere Nationwide. We add your local information whether your business is a restaurant or e-commerce store. You keep what you earn. 

Features that Start NOW! The SBC Digital Magazine ads are placed in the current digital magazine on Issuu.com, the business listing, and upcoming events (if any).  (Donors are responsible for their advertisement development)

Other Features Start September 2021: The Digital Catalog and Advantage Member Portal Access

The Impact: What You Should Know 

Today, one of the biggest problems key business leaders face is ensuring their organizations are effective in their efforts to target the customer segments they have chosen to succeed.  With so many different marketing mixes and approaches, online marketing and promotion are crucial to your brand as a vital way to connect with potential customers using digital communication.  Building a solid customer relationship is key to increasing sales through digital marketing.  Your path to marketing success begins the moment you work with proven and competent marketing professionals who can provide the visibility needed to facilitate sales traction. 

Growing your customer base is key to achieving growth, revenue, and profitability goals.  Creating an appropriate framework to succeed in the digital marketplace requires goal setting, identifying applicable KPIs, using an effective funnel, and strategic planning.  At the Small Business Concierge, we understand the importance of value when it comes to choosing how to spend your marketing budget.  We get it.  Plus, we know that credibility and reputation are vital when choosing a business partner.

The Seven Times Factor says as a universal rule, potential customers need to see an ad seven times or more before they buy.  In addition, research shows that, on average, you have to see an ad seven times before you even notice it.  So, digital advertising and promotion consistency are crucial to achieving the highest levels of success.  The biggest digital marketing mistake you can make is to market sporadically.  Regular and consistent marketing has an influence on how many and the duration of slow periods your business will experience.

Your business success depends on the decisions you make or do not make.  Your decision to advertise in the Small Business Concierge Digital Catalog on a consistent basis will trigger the creation of monthly data points you can track to determine your increase in website visitors, page views, sessions, and rising sales.  The Small Business Concierge Magazine has grown steadily and improved its reach month by month to become a leading small business publishing solution. We are pairing the Small Business Concierge Digital Magazine with the Small Business Concierge Digital Catalog to double your marketing, advertising, and branding impact and efforts. 

Risks & Challenges

Raising capital online with Indiegogo reduces the biggest risks our organization can face.  Why?  Because using the right platform is important to ensure data security.  We, at the Small Business Concierge, take every precaution to identify and reduce risks both for our valued customers as well as ourselves.  Nothing could be more disastrous than having to face a data breach and violating privacy promises.  Thankfully, the Indiegogo platform solves our data privacy platform concerns.

Other concerns include the risk of not reaching the goal we established.  The ultimate goal of this campaign is contemplated in the light most favorable to a mutually beneficial win-win-win opportunity.  #1 Win.  Offer the highest quality marketing and advertising service possible at a reasonable price that will enable established small businesses the best chance to consistently market to gain visibility, credibility, and great value.  #2 Win. Meet an unmet market need by opening our doors to fill a niche.  Small businesses must do more with less.  Following a pandemic, businesses are vulnerable and must get the most value possible for their dollars.  At the SBC, we provide valuable branding, advertising, marketing, and promotion assistance to our clients. We keep them abreast of the latest information that gives their organizations the ability to leverage and exceed their growth goals.  #3 Win. To deliver the highest level of service the SBC needs to expand its team.  The money raised in this campaign is to fill critical roles that give this organization the best chance for long-term sustainable success. 

Partnerships & Affiliations

The SBC is featured weekly in the 4th largest radio market
in the U.S. San Francisco/Bay Area on Money 2.0 Business on the Edge. 

 

 

 

 

We are on Satellite Radio iHeart 

 

 

 

 

 

We support the next generation of entrepreneurs!

 

 

 

 

 

The SBC is on one of the largest Global Publishing Digital Platforms in the Nation over 100M+ Unique visitors per month. Our Digital Magazine is found in the Small Business category - the Digital Catalog will be found in the Catalogs category.  

Trusted by unique and leading brands - National Geographic, Etsy, NAACP, Nasa, Hyatt, Sotheby's, and more...

 

 

 

 

October 2021 the SBC Digital Catalog & Digital Magazine will expand to two more magazine publishing platforms.

FLIPHTML5 and JOOMAG 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us get the word out! Make some noise about our campaign. We are saving small businesses by making their products and services accessible on global mass-media platforms. Small business is the engine of our economy and they need our and your help. Use our Indiegogo share link and give it to your network to support small businesses!

And that's all there is to it. Be a Super Small Business Supporter!

I'm Margaret Jackson (MJ), I am the founder of the Small Business Concierge Communications & Digital Media (SBCCDM). I am also known as Bay Area/Silicon Valley's #1 Small Business Radio Personality on AM 1220 KDOW & iHeart Radio. We have watched small businesses suffer and lose hope for their business future because of COVID-19. We could not stand by and watch small businesses keep closing their doors.

So we did something about it. My team and I have designed contactless digital solutions to keep your products, services, videos, and more in front of your customers. We guide you on using our tools and help you develop your marketing, advertising, and branding intelligence to break through the barrier of the resistance of business growth in this pandemic.  
The world is opening back up, but safety and health have become more critical than ever. The customers are out there, and you can reach them through our digital catalog advertising and magazine business solutions. We seek to support qualified-existing-small businesses in becoming the digital bridge to keeping you in front of your prospective customers worldwide.  What does that mean? It means you can reach customers locally, nationally, and internationally.   

                                                           
 
The Situation: What is your mass-media digital advertising Situation?
The Objective: What is your digital advertising Objective facing Covid-19 and the Delta Variant?
The Strategy: Do you have a mass-media digital advertising Strategy?
The Tactics: Are you interested in digital mass-media advertising Tactics?
The Actions: Are you willing to take Action on your mass-media digital advertising?
The Controls: Do you think it is time to take Control of your digital advertising?
Situation Analysis SOSTAC Model (Small Business)
The current small business climate in a word is stressed. COVID-19 has forced a change in the economic paradigm creating shifts in business openings and closures, constant ebbs, and flows of COVID-19 cases in the United States slowing the ability to buy and sell products and services. Small businesses are not only concerned but are financially stressed due to low to no sales. A market that has been severely impacted by COVID-19. “More than half of all small business owners in the United States warn that the coronavirus crisis could make it tough to stay afloat, according to a new poll indicating that scores of small businesses are still grappling with lingering financial trouble amid an economic crisis that has already forced tens of thousands of firms to close” (Walsh, 2020).  
The SBCCDM realizes that the dependency is on small businesses surviving and thriving in the short term to successfully sell its products and services. The short-term market condition directly impacts the medium and long-term market conditions. “Using digital tools is no longer an admin task, it’s business-critical and has a direct impact on whether a business will survive” (Xero, 2020). With a digital perspective in mind, the SBCCDM B2B small business customer is identified by Who (existing small businesses pre-Covid 19), Why (fighting for a sustainable future), and How (using the SBCCDM digital tools and resources) and applying the digital online strategies to their business survival mix.

 
Situation Analysis SOSTAC Model (Intermediaries and Partnerships)
We have developed a mix of partnerships and intermediaries to increase routes to small businesses' survival. Although COVID-19 has impacted businesses globally, partnerships are more critical than ever before. A mix of partnerships can be key drivers to connect small businesses to corporations offering small business supportive products and services.
Our strategic partnerships are interested in engaging small businesses with special offers, discounts, and professional tips through the Advantage Membership Subscription.
 Live Plan Business Plan Software (SAAS)Praised by industry experts(Entrepreneur, CNN Money The Wall Street, Bloomberg, and more...) 
Partnerships and Intermediaries provide an ecosystem of resources for our members such as,

Business Plan - Live Plan Access 
Accounting and Bookkeeping  
Staffing & Talent Acquisition 
Financial Planning & Education  
Business Consulting Recommended Resources (Nationwide)
Aspiring Collegiate Entrepreneurship & Higher Education
Small Business Insurances (Medical, Worker's Comp., Liability/BOP)
Short vignette business and marketing tips that help you achieve strategic and sustainable goals by partners & intermediaries, industry experts, and our SBCCDM Team.
Lead generation and partnership collaborations to grow and sustain your business    



Cost-Effective Digital Media Solution
Small businesses require a long-term, cost-effective product that provides various digital media channels that introduces their brand to a mass market. They can market and advertise their business steadily with a long-term digital marketing media plan. Small businesses want to drive sales and build brand awareness according to Leadpages, “Driving sales (51.3%) and building brand awareness (48.4%) are the two top digital marketing priorities for small businesses" (Leadpages, 2017).
Our Advantage Membership Subscription provides micro-businesses and small businesses digital advertising, marketing, and branding media products offering exposure and visibility of their products and services on multiple mass media platforms.

 
HOW IT WORKS! Mobile-Desktop-Tablet Access


Advantage MembershipDigital Subscription RewardsPandemic Pricing
NO Sells Fees and NO Platform Fees! We Are Not AMAZON! You Keep What You Earn!On-Demand HyperLink to your product or service for immediate purchase. 
Build Your Brand Monthly Advantage Member Subscription $25.00!
I Support Small Businesses 1 Mo. Advantage Member Subscription $25.00!  
6 Mo. Market Advantage Subscription - One Time Investment $150.00!

The Small Business Concierge Magazine
Introducing the Small Business Concierge Digital Catalog - Launching September 2021

 
Paired Together
the SBC Digital Catalog & Digital Magazine
Double Dose of Digital Advertising & Content Marketing! 

 
You can market from anywhere Nationwide. We add your local information whether your business is a restaurant or e-commerce store. You keep what you earn. 
Features that Start NOW! The SBC Digital Magazine ads are placed in the current digital magazine on Issuu.com, the business listing, and upcoming events (if any).  (Donors are responsible for their advertisement development)
Other Features Start September 2021: The Digital Catalog and Advantage Member Portal Access
The Impact: What You Should Know 
Today, one of the biggest problems key business leaders face is ensuring their organizations are effective in their efforts to target the customer segments they have chosen to succeed.  With so many different marketing mixes and approaches, online marketing and promotion are crucial to your brand as a vital way to connect with potential customers using digital communication.  Building a solid customer relationship is key to increasing sales through digital marketing.  Your path to marketing success begins the moment you work with proven and competent marketing professionals who can provide the visibility needed to facilitate sales traction. 
Growing your customer base is key to achieving growth, revenue, and profitability goals.  Creating an appropriate framework to succeed in the digital marketplace requires goal setting, identifying applicable KPIs, using an effective funnel, and strategic planning.  At the Small Business Concierge, we understand the importance of value when it comes to choosing how to spend your marketing budget.  We get it.  Plus, we know that credibility and reputation are vital when choosing a business partner.
The Seven Times Factor says as a universal rule, potential customers need to see an ad seven times or more before they buy.  In addition, research shows that, on average, you have to see an ad seven times before you even notice it.  So, digital advertising and promotion consistency are crucial to achieving the highest levels of success.  The biggest digital marketing mistake you can make is to market sporadically.  Regular and consistent marketing has an influence on how many and the duration of slow periods your business will experience.
Your business success depends on the decisions you make or do not make.  Your decision to advertise in the Small Business Concierge Digital Catalog on a consistent basis will trigger the creation of monthly data points you can track to determine your increase in website visitors, page views, sessions, and rising sales.  The Small Business Concierge Magazine has grown steadily and improved its reach month by month to become a leading small business publishing solution. We are pairing the Small Business Concierge Digital Magazine with the Small Business Concierge Digital Catalog to double your marketing, advertising, and branding impact and efforts. 


Risks & Challenges
Raising capital online with Indiegogo reduces the biggest risks our organization can face.  Why?  Because using the right platform is important to ensure data security.  We, at the Small Business Concierge, take every precaution to identify and reduce risks both for our valued customers as well as ourselves.  Nothing could be more disastrous than having to face a data breach and violating privacy promises.  Thankfully, the Indiegogo platform solves our data privacy platform concerns.
Other concerns include the risk of not reaching the goal we established.  The ultimate goal of this campaign is contemplated in the light most favorable to a mutually beneficial win-win-win opportunity.  #1 Win.  Offer the highest quality marketing and advertising service possible at a reasonable price that will enable established small businesses the best chance to consistently market to gain visibility, credibility, and great value.  #2 Win. Meet an unmet market need by opening our doors to fill a niche.  Small businesses must do more with less.  Following a pandemic, businesses are vulnerable and must get the most value possible for their dollars.  At the SBC, we provide valuable branding, advertising, marketing, and promotion assistance to our clients. We keep them abreast of the latest information that gives their organizations the ability to leverage and exceed their growth goals.  #3 Win. To deliver the highest level of service the SBC needs to expand its team.  The money raised in this campaign is to fill critical roles that give this organization the best chance for long-term sustainable success. 
Partnerships & Affiliations
The SBC is featured weekly in the 4th largest radio marketin the U.S. San Francisco/Bay Area on Money 2.0 Business on the Edge. 


 
 
 
 
We are on Satellite Radio iHeart 

 
 
 
 
 
We support the next generation of entrepreneurs!

 
 
 
 
 
The SBC is on one of the largest Global Publishing Digital Platforms in the Nation over 100M+ Unique visitors per month. Our Digital Magazine is found in the Small Business category - the Digital Catalog will be found in the Catalogs category.  
Trusted by unique and leading brands - National Geographic, Etsy, NAACP, Nasa, Hyatt, Sotheby's, and more...

 
 
 
 
October 2021 the SBC Digital Catalog & Digital Magazine will expand to two more magazine publishing platforms.
FLIPHTML5 and JOOMAG 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Help us get the word out! Make some noise about our campaign. We are saving small businesses by making their products and services accessible on global mass-media platforms. Small business is the engine of our economy and they need our and your help. Use our Indiegogo share link and give it to your network to support small businesses!
And that's all there is to it. Be a Super Small Business Supporter!

story:
Our Basin, Our Water, Our Future

BACKGROUND:

"OUR BASIN OF RELATIONS, The Art and Science of Living with Water" is a gem of a coffee table book, designed to educate, entertain, and inspire viewers to participate in the challenge to value and protect our natural waterways in the Lake Champlain Basin or wherever one lives.  Clean Water Advocates, Inc., a Vermont non-profit organization, is responsible for financing the publishing of OUR BASIN OF RELATIONS, and it will be ultimately be published by the esteemed, award-winning GREEN WRITER'S PRESS, out of Brattleboro, VT.  All the articles and photographs are in-kind contributions.  All donations and book profits will be used to publish the book or for non-profit organization. clean water projects. There will be no salaries to officers of Clean Water Advocates, Inc.

Featured Contributors:

Mary Abele –– Pastor Emerita, All Souls Interfaith Gathering
Ben Aleshire –– Poet For Hire
Michael Colby –– Regeneration Vermont
Abbie Corse–– Agrarian, Corse Diary Farm 
Chief Donald Stevens –– Nulhegan Band of the Coosuk Abenaki Nation
Franky Frances Cannon –– Independent author, artist, and illustraton
James Ehlers –– Lake Champlain International
Doug Facey –– Professor of Biology, Saint Michael’s College
Rich Holschuh –– Vermont Commission on Native American Affairs
Eric Howe –– Lake Champlain Basin Program
Mike Kline –– Vermont Rivers Program
Mark Krawczyk –– Keyline Vermont
Declan McCabe –– Professor of Environmental Science, Saint Michael’s Colege
Dr. Wallace J Nichols –– marine biologist and author of Blue Mind. 
Rich Redman -- The Sun Community News 
Meg Reynolds–– Burlington Poet, Writing Inside VT
Jess Ann Rubin–– MycoEvolve 
Corinna Parnapy –– WInsooki River Valley Parks District? 
Matthew Parrilla –– Hacker, Skier, Forager
Trevien Stanger –– Editor, Educator, Tree-planter
Patrick Standen –– Philosopher, Saint Michael's College
Kris Stepenuck –– Extension Assistant Professor of Watershed Science, Policy and Education, UVM

WHY WE NEED YOU:
To raise sufficient funds to publish a “long-run” (1000 to 2000 copies) we are first publishing a
“contributor's editions” (250 -500 copies) and giving it to contributors of $100 or more. 
The anticipated retail value of the 11.5-inch by 12.5-inch, high-quality book is $40. Our fund-
raising goal is $30,000. We expect major sponsors in addition to individual contributors. As of August 31st, Clean Water Advocates has already raised over $3000 for publication or OUR BASIN OF RELATIONS.
As Dr. Wallace J. Nichols, author of BLUE MIND, says in the Foreword of the OUR BASIN -
“Remember, the sense of awe produced by time near, in, on or under wild waters is known to
build the parts of our brain responsible for empathy, promote pro-social behaviors, move us
from me to we, and connect us more deeply to ourselves, each other, and the places we love.”

 

The Impact

We believe that this book will generate a valuable and altogether sobering and inspiring basis for discussion surrounding the state of the lake–– and in a way few other books on the lake have ever done. In addition to hoping for wide readership region-wide,  we also aim to have this book be taught in high school and colleges throughout the region.  We expect media coverage at its release, and we plan to leverage that coverage toward raising public awareness and increasing direct and meaningful participation.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're unable to make a financial contribution at this time, we would greatly appreciate your participation in any of the following ways: 

• sharing our campaign with friends and colleagues and over social media

• writing down your own concerns about water quality and ecological sanity and sharing those alongside your post about our campaign 

• reach out to educators who you think may want to integrate this book into their classrooms 

• reach out to us around the holidays to find out where you can purchase a copy!

story:
Summary

I‘ve been writing on and off for over twenty years. Last year, I published my first novel on Amazon, a Contemporary Romance entitled Bound to the Baron. It‘s the first in a series entitled Royal Revels. Unfortunately, with no budget for editors and advertising, the book had a very limited reach. However, the reviews from readers it did reach have been positive on Amazon and Goodreads. This year, I am taking my career to the next level. 


In January, I joined Romance Writers or America (RWA), and I have attended meetings at the Washington and Maryland chapters. I met some of the most supportive people, and I learned the importance of being in a community of other writers. Writing is solitary. It’s done alone, so writers don’t get to interact with people in their field on a daily basis. Organization meetings and conferences may be the only time we get to see each other in person. This year, RWA’s National Conference will be in New York City. It’s so close, yet so far. Attending this conference could be a game changer for my writing career. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

The chance to build a strong community with other writers and to meet with agents and editors makes this a must attend event for me. The education in the workshops offered alone would be worth the price of admission. However, there’s the price of admission. To attend this conference, I need to pay for the admission, the hotel stay in NYC, and incidentals which could be around $1500. I also need to pay for a professional edit of my manuscript, so I can submit it to any interested agents or editors in hopes of publications. Editing costs can run from $500-$1200, depending on the work that needs to be done to the manuscript. This campaign is to ask for your help to attend the conference and publish my second novel.

I greatly appreciate any contribution you can make. The perks I'm rewarding as a thank you for your support include a digital copy of Bound to the Baron or pre-release copy of the second novel. For the high rollers who donate over $150, you get to see your name in print and for $200 your name will be given to one of the characters in the second novel. You'll also receive a signed copy of the second book before its release. 

 

The Impact

Anything above the expenses to attend RWA’s Conference will go to help fund the publication of my second novel. The second novel focuses on the relationship of two characters introduced in Bound to the Baron. I'm really excited about this story, and I believe in the emotional journey of these characters. This novel deals with topics not usually addressed in Romance novels including Depression and Anxiety, abuse, body image, and grief. Despite or because of that, it‘s a story about two people falling in love… and having some steamy times while doing it (no pun intended [okay, maybe it was intended]). 

Since the Baron reviewers say they are eager to read the story of these two characters, I know there is already an audience interested in this second novel. Additional funding will help me publish the book this year and give it the chance it deserves.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help


I understand not everyone can support financially, but I hope you do whatever you can. Share this campaign on your Facebook or Twitter accounts, and link to Instagram or any other social media channels you use. Please tell your co-workers, family, friends (heck, even enemies). Anything you do to help spread the word would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support.

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for your support!

story:
Short Summary:

     This funding campaign is for the second of three books we are creating to preserve the hidden history of Coeburn, Virginia. This tiny corner of the Appalachian Mountains has in past times been a center of geological violence, a hunter's paradise, a farmer's haven, and a Wild-West boomtown. The sum of all the drama that has occurred in this tiny little spot on the globe is nearly unimaginable.

     Our first volume has already been written and delivered to our original IndieGoGo contributors, and the second volume is in the works. There were so many great stories we could not squeeze into the first book, that the second book is guaranteed to be an eye-opener.

     This campaign is designed to raise money to complete Volume 2 of a three volume work. Your support for this project will help us create a special set of local history books which can be enjoyed by you and younger generations to come. We really hope to see these books being read in local schools and libraries, and also become an important part of your home library. We are depending on you to help us make this happen!
 

About The Authors:

     Dee Ratliff Kenady grew up in the forests of the Cumberland Plateau, living the rare life of a free mountain child. As an adult she has worked hard to share her journey in print, publishing many poems, stories, and books that are well-rooted in her Appalachian life experiences. Dee's knowledge and insight about "the old ways" has been invaluable in framing this project in a meaningful context.

     Wade Kenady is originally from Caney Ridge, just inside Dickenson County. He began his education there in the two-room Rugby School, and later attended schools at Clintwood and Coeburn. As an amateur historian, he has studied local stories and Appalachian culture for more than a decade. Wade still has kinfolk in the Coeburn area, and considers it to be his hometown.
 

What We Need:

     To make this project work, we will need the support of the many others who also feel a special connection to Coeburn, Virginia. We not only need your financial support, but also your participation and encouragement.

     Plus, we will need your best gossip. So please tell anyone who will listen, "Those people over there are up to something, and you need to see what it is!"
 

What You Get:

     The minimum dollar goal for this campaign is $600. The funds raised will go toward research and travel expenses, publishing costs, shipping supplies, and postage to get your perks to you.
 

Book Design:

     Instead of making one large, pricey hard-cover book of about 500 pages, we are spreading the same material out over three smaller, soft-cover volumes. That way each book will be more economical to produce, quicker to deliver, and more fulfilling to create. Plus, the fans of Coeburn, Virginia will have the option to support either one, two, or all three book projects.

     This particular funding campaign is ONLY for the second volume, but below are descriptions for all three.

Hidden Appalachia
Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 1

     This project was fully funded, and Volume 1 has already been published. Thank you so much for your support and encouragement! It was initially expected to take about six months to complete, but actually clocked in at nearly twelve. Some of the delays were due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, which has affected us all, but others were due to an insufficient knowledge of the devil who lives in the details of book publishing!

     There were the technical issues, such as: initially choosing a primary font which was hard to read, misunderstanding the cover art specifications, allowing insufficient time to receive book proofs, software quirks with an evil mind of their own, etc.

     There were also project management issues, such as: spreadsheet overload, typos in mailing lists, running out of shipping supplies, forgetting to always provide timely updates to contributors, etc.

     And personal quirks also came into play: excessive optimism about the production timeline, perfectionism causing endless revisions, trying to squeeze a 42" waist into 36" pants a.k.a. knowing which material must be cut but still not crying about it.

     But we have certainly learned from all our trials and errors with Volume 1, and the second book should go much smoother. At least now we have met some of the enemies and recognize them by their first names.

Hidden Appalachia
Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 2

     This funding campaign is for Volume 2, which is a continuation from the first book. This will have a similar design to Volume 1, being a 6" x 9" soft-cover of 128 pages, with about 15-20% of pages having images (i.e. photos, drawings, maps, etc.) and approximately 30,000 words. There will be self-contained articles of varying lengths, so you will not need to read it from cover-to-cover to enjoy it.

     We expect the second volume to take 6-9 months to deliver.

Hidden Appalachia
Coeburn, Virginia, Volume 3

     Volume 3 will be somewhat different than the first two. Though still a soft-cover 6" x 9", this book will be larger, with 200-500 pages, and a collection of biographical sketches, family stories, and photos of folks with connections to Coeburn communities. Unlike the first two, materials for this book will be provided by individuals and families who choose to participate. We will provide guidance for submitting the materials, editing of the photos and text for publication, and designing and assembling the book for the printer.

     There will be a separate funding campaign for the third volume.
 

Other Ways You Can Help:

     People who can't contribute to the fundraiser can still help with this project:

     Please share this campaign on Facebook with your family members, friends, co-workers, and anyone else who might be interested in a book about Coeburn. You can easily do this by clicking on the Facebook icon at the top of the page.

     Thanks so much to you all for your tremendous encouragement and support!

Wade & Dee Kenady

About The Authors:
     Dee Ratliff Kenady grew up in the forests of the Cumberland Plateau, living the rare life of a free mountain child. As an adult she has worked hard to share her journey in print, publishing many poems, stories, and books that are well-rooted in her Appalachian life experiences. Dee's knowledge and insight about "the old ways" has been invaluable in framing this project in a meaningful context.
     Wade Kenady is originally from Caney Ridge, just inside Dickenson County. He began his education there in the two-room Rugby School, and later attended schools at Clintwood and Coeburn. As an amateur historian, he has studied local stories and Appalachian culture for more than a decade. Wade still has kinfolk in the Coeburn area, and considers it to be his hometown. 
What We Need:
     To make this project work, we will need the support of the many others who also feel a special connection to Coeburn, Virginia. We not only need your financial support, but also your participation and encouragement.     Plus, we will need your best gossip. So please tell anyone who will listen, "Those people over there are up to something, and you need to see what it is!" 
What You Get:
     The minimum dollar goal for this campaign is $600. The funds raised will go toward research and travel expenses, publishing costs, shipping supplies, and postage to get your perks to you. 
Book Design:
     Instead of making one large, pricey hard-cover book of about 500 pages, we are spreading the same material out over three smaller, soft-cover volumes. That way each book will be more economical to produce, quicker to deliver, and more fulfilling to create. Plus, the fans of Coeburn, Virginia will have the option to support either one, two, or all three book projects.     This particular funding campaign is ONLY for the second volume, but below are descriptions for all three.
Hidden AppalachiaCoeburn, Virginia, Volume 1
     This project was fully funded, and Volume 1 has already been published. Thank you so much for your support and encouragement! It was initially expected to take about six months to complete, but actually clocked in at nearly twelve. Some of the delays were due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, which has affected us all, but others were due to an insufficient knowledge of the devil who lives in the details of book publishing!     There were the technical issues, such as: initially choosing a primary font which was hard to read, misunderstanding the cover art specifications, allowing insufficient time to receive book proofs, software quirks with an evil mind of their own, etc.     There were also project management issues, such as: spreadsheet overload, typos in mailing lists, running out of shipping supplies, forgetting to always provide timely updates to contributors, etc.     And personal quirks also came into play: excessive optimism about the production timeline, perfectionism causing endless revisions, trying to squeeze a 42" waist into 36" pants a.k.a. knowing which material must be cut but still not crying about it.     But we have certainly learned from all our trials and errors with Volume 1, and the second book should go much smoother. At least now we have met some of the enemies and recognize them by their first names.
Hidden AppalachiaCoeburn, Virginia, Volume 2
     This funding campaign is for Volume 2, which is a continuation from the first book. This will have a similar design to Volume 1, being a 6" x 9" soft-cover of 128 pages, with about 15-20% of pages having images (i.e. photos, drawings, maps, etc.) and approximately 30,000 words. There will be self-contained articles of varying lengths, so you will not need to read it from cover-to-cover to enjoy it.     We expect the second volume to take 6-9 months to deliver.
Hidden AppalachiaCoeburn, Virginia, Volume 3
     Volume 3 will be somewhat different than the first two. Though still a soft-cover 6" x 9", this book will be larger, with 200-500 pages, and a collection of biographical sketches, family stories, and photos of folks with connections to Coeburn communities. Unlike the first two, materials for this book will be provided by individuals and families who choose to participate. We will provide guidance for submitting the materials, editing of the photos and text for publication, and designing and assembling the book for the printer.     There will be a separate funding campaign for the third volume. 
Other Ways You Can Help:
     People who can't contribute to the fundraiser can still help with this project:     Please share this campaign on Facebook with your family members, friends, co-workers, and anyone else who might be interested in a book about Coeburn. You can easily do this by clicking on the Facebook icon at the top of the page.     Thanks so much to you all for your tremendous encouragement and support!Wade & Dee Kenady

story:
Conservatism needs minority voters.
Minorities need conservatism.
We must do this.

    Everyone knows a chasm exists between ethnic-minorities in America and conservative political causes/office holders/candidates/party(s). And everyone knows something must be done about it. The questions are how and who? Its going to take us black-Americans standing up in our own communities and saying,
    "It's time for some REAL change, y'all!!"

    That's exactly what we're doing. The Rocky Mountain Black Conservatives and American Conservatives of Color are a small but mighty group of men & women who have what no one else in America has--a plan. An actual, written, executable plan for minority outreach. And it works. We are a group of America-loving patriots who are passionate about restoring our nation to its constitutional roots and educating our brothers & sisters of color on the truth about conservative principles of governance.

    There's only one way to accomplish true, meaningful outreach.

    It cannot be done with slick television ads. Nor will attending conservatives-only meetings and choir preaching accomplish much. The only way to capture hearts & minds is by getting out and burning some shoe leather! Our 5-Point Plan for outreach focuses on building relationships first, asking for votes second. It cannot be done the other way around. We conservatives (of all colors) need to show up in minority neighborhoods on a consistent basis, build presence, awareness, face & name recognition which then leads to developing respect and a rapport. There's no other way. It won't happen overnight, but with effort, persistence and funding - it will happen. We're living proof.

    We're building those relationships and a presence in the community by:

    • Having booths at & participating in festivals and other cultural events put on by the local minority community such as MLK Day, Cinco de Mayo festivals, etc.
    • Putting on our own events to which we invite members of the community to come, participate and be blessed -- we don't ask for votes, we don't argue about taxes or abortion or Obama anything else. Let's just get to know one another - there will be time for those discussions later.
    • Conducting monthly on-the-ground events which local conservatives attend and may learn about our efforts, methods and techniques.
    • Traveling to other cities & states and doing the same; we reach out to the local conservative community and invite them to attend our rallies, presentations or seminars where we then show them --give the actual tools-- for real, meaningful local outreach and inclusion.

    Why help fund us?

    This organization & movement is 100% grassroots. We get no funding from the Republican (or any other) party, we have no billionaires in the back room writing checks. As minorities ourselves, we're able to go places and say things to audiences that many are not able to. We've been doing that very thing for four years - burning our own gas, running up our own credit cards and believing God will make a way.  Our reach, effectiveness and notoriety have grown substantially. Along with them so have expenses. We need help.

    Our founder (Derrick Wilburn) is fond of saying, "There are those who are called to go and those who are called to send those who are called to go." If you've often wondered, "What can I do to help reach blacks and combat the 'conservatives rae racists' narrative?", supporting this group may be your answer to that question.

    Can this really be done?

    Yes. Black & Hispanic neighborhoods across the country have been failed by 50 years of liberal representation and more & more are awakening to this fact. But. Just because there's low-hanging fruit doesn't mean it will put itself into the harvest baskets. Someone has to go into the communities and do the work.

    One street, one neighborhood, one community, one city at a time. Its the only way. Your contributions help pay the expenses associated with all of the above activities; booths at street fairs & festivals cost money. Events require a hall or room to be rented. In 2014 we put on our "TRUTH TRANSCENDS COLOR" events in Arizona, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Oklahoma, Wisconsin & Washington D.C.  In 2015 we'd like to double or triple the number of states we travel to and spread our 5-Point Plan For Ethnic-Minority Outreach. Traveling to other states and training like-minded conservatives requires airfare, lodging, and other expenses. We just can't do it ourselves.

    Why it matters.

    The demographic makeup of America is changing. Our nation is turning brown. Fast. If the demographic makeup of the conservative side of the political isle does not begin changing along with it, our future could be in very serious peril. Someone has to be willing to take up this challenge and begin doing the work of building relationships the only place it counts,...on the streets.  We are that someone.

    Thank you and please know that your seed is being sewn into fertile soil. We pray your generosity will be returned back unto you a hundred fold.

story:
A Little Boy Named Collin Bean

The goal of this book “A Little Boy Named Collin Bean” is to promote friendship and cooperation among our children. This book gives a modern touch in using magic and wishes as instrumental in realizing one’s potential strengths and weaknesses to fly over the hills, into the mountains, through the woods, and down the ocean side to realize one’s dream. And yet Collin Bean, the main character stays in touch with reality when he realizes that it’s time to go home.

This book is inspired by my grandson Collin James (we call him Collin Bean) who was born prematurely and was diagnosed with cerebral palsy when he was young. However, he grew up to be a smart, brave, and friendly 5-year old. Currently, he is using a wheel chair for his mobility. I would like to share this inspiration with children around the world and allow them to explore the warmth of making friends and the spirit of cooperation while having fun.

This book tells about how a little boy’s desire to make friends and help others led to his exciting adventures. Collin Bean is helped by a goblin named Prixstar who makes little boys’ dreams come true. Collin Bean and Prixstar flew over the hills, into the mountains, through the woods, and down the ocean side to meet new friends named Ryleegator, Clairebear, Lylabear, Quinniebee, Ardie Rabbit, Pregolama, Jetrogoat, Hansy Tortoise, and Master Ant. All the friends got busy and inspired to build their dream castle that they can call their home. However, a strong storm ruined their dream castle. Despite the unexpected disaster and problem, Collin Bean and his friends continued to flourish their friendship with love and care. Their friendship stood this test of time and they were able to build a stronger castle made of stones, rocks, wood, and sand. Love and care became the foundation of this friendship that they carry with them in their travel to far away places. Collin Bean and his friends experienced enriching journeys. This book talks about the joys of making friends and the reality of facing problems such as the storm in developing a stronger position in the community.

Innocence is a gift that we’d like to share with our children while learning is a process that we’d like to take a major role in their lives. I hope that this book can serve our children in more ways than one with significant impact in the development of their character. Everyone needs help and extending one’s self even at a tender age can enhance the very core of friendship and care in every child’s heart.

In order for me to bring this book to life, I need your support. I hope you’ll share with me the same passion to reach out to our children and spread the book’s message. For my backers and supporters, I plan to deliver to you the rewards which I have outlined. I will also send updates as to where the project is and how well it is doing.

Your contributions to this project will cover production costs, marketing costs, and packaging the special rewards. As an artist, I have developed character illustrations and have started the art work for our website. If we are lucky to raise additional funds, they will be used to produce additional titles in the series.

I would like to thank the project’s future backers in advance. I hope that this project will live up to your expectations and that it will serve its goal to reach out to our young generation and promote the spirit of friendship and cooperation. Your perks will arrive as soon as we are finished with the project including printing.

Please help us spread the word and make some noise about this campaign. I am very passionate about this project and I hope you will too. My team and I appreciate your support and generosity. This 30-page hardcover book is recommended for children 3-years old and above. It has colorful illustrations to maintain the child’s interest. Thank you very much.


Zenaida Alota Roxas
Author/Editor

Please find this Campaign on You Tube, Facebook and Twitter

Do you think this campaign contains prohibited content? Let us know. Please make this project happen.

story:
The Magazine

Table Talk is a redefined literary magazine that focuses on profound, hard-to-describe experiences. Each issue brings together contributors from far-flung perspectives, from philosophers to boxers, photojournalists to deep-sea divers, and fosters a conversation through compelling prose, poetry, and photography about an ineffable experience that connects to all our lives.


Cover of the first issue


The First Issue

The inaugural issue released this past May focused on duende, the Spanish word for a heightened state of emotion we often experience as chills up and down our skin when we are moved by a powerful song or performance. The first issue is now carried internationally in bookstores and magazine shops in Beirut, Berlin, Istanbul, London, New York, and Singapore. Online, the magazine has readers in over 45 countries, from South Africa to Japan, Brazil to Bangladesh. Within a month after launching at The Schoolhouse in Brooklyn, Table Talk was written up in both The Guardian and The Washington Post. The first issue was made possible by a successful Kickstarter campaign which raised over $8,000. 




Photography from the second issue


The Second Issue

Table Talk: Issue II, set to release this coming February, is centered on the idea of dyno: a movement in rock climbing where the climber must let go of everything, leaping through mid-air in order to surpass an otherwise insurmountable obstacle. This decision to surrender stability and risk everything for one’s goal is not restricted to rock climbing. From fishermen who venture into dangerous waters for the big catch, to poets who abandon the rules of convention and risk their reputations to create new styles of writing, this moment of dyno is a new lens for understanding perseverance, innovation, and creativity.

Contributors:

  • Author Chang-rae Lee on cooking, the immigrant experience, and taking risks in writing.
  • Turntablist and philosopher DJ Spooky in conversation with artist Stan Douglas on recreating 1948 Vancouver through video game art.
  • Journalist and artist Noah Sneider on witnessing the Malaysia Air crash and discovering what got left behind.
  • Rock climber Steph Davis on dyno, base jumping, and letting go.
  • Poet Yusef Komunyakaa on Hurricane Katrina and the blues.
  • Conceptual artist Genco Gulan on the act of falling.
  • Anthropologist Yarimar Bonilla in conversation with filmmaker and scholar Frances Negrón-Muntaner on experimental documentary film and nationalism in Puerto Rico.
  • Comic book artist Rebecca Gernes and writer James Anthofer on a little-known NASA mission to Mars
  • SCUBA diver Nuno Gomes on tragedy and diving at the notorious sinkhole "Wondergat" in South Africa
  • Film scholar Priya Jaikumar on old age, memory, and moving on.
  • Poet Charles Bernstein on poetry, falling, and failing.
  • Political philosopher Michael Hardt on the Arab Spring, risk, and revolution.
  • A final distinguished contributor to be announced on release.

Photography from the second issue


The Leap

We are currently becoming a non-for-profit, and from the third issue and on, we will be supported by subscribers and arts and humanities grants. Without this campaign, though, we will not be able to print and realize this second issue and have the track record to interest funding organizations. With your support we'll also be able to expand to other cities in the United States and abroad—Chicago, Austin, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Portland, and Paris—and restock the magazine with our current distributors. In publishing today, there are few spaces that gather an eclectic, international group of contributors to discuss the hard-to-describe experiences in life. In order to keep this space alive and make this issue possible, we need your help!


Cost Breakdown:

6,500 - Printing (500 issues)

910 - Indiegogo and processing fees (13%)

200 - Shipping

200 - Web hosting

200 - Canvas tote bags (Indiegogo rewards)

Total: $8010


What's Next

Along with developing and expanding the print and online magazine, we plan to begin producing short format films and podcasts that bring together compelling contributors to talk about our themes. We also hope after the fourth issue to compile an anthology of select pieces and publish a special edition book. We are excited for what's ahead and hope you can take part and become a reader, contributor, and fan.


Risks & Challenges

In many ways this issue is a dyno itself. We are so committed to developing the magazine but know that it is a risky endeavor. We have put in love and time away from work, school, and other projects because we are passionate and continually intrigued by exploring experiences in life that usually are not discussed. The biggest leap and challenge comes now, where we need to raise the support to actually bring the second issue into the world. It is not going to be easy to raise the funds and increase distribution internationally, but we are excited and committed to to making it happen, no matter how many times we have to leap and try again.

Other Ways You Can Help

We so appreciate any support you can give to try and make this a reality. If you can't pledge it would be amazing if you could share this link on Facebook and Twitter, or send it to friends you think would find it of interest!

story:
JEANNE,

Je m'appelle Daléna, j'ai 24 ans et suis étudiante en seconde année de Master Commerce International. 

Originaire de la République Centrafricaine (RCA), j'ai conservé des liens forts avec mon pays d’origine.

La République Centrafricaine est devenue tristement célèbre suite à une récente guerre civile. Les hostilités (entre Chrétiens et Musulmans) qui ont entraîné cette guerre ont fini par réduire à néant le peu d’infrastructures qui y existaient.

En République Centrafricaine, la mort s'empare des âmes dans le silence le plus total. Une fièvre peut tuer, une grippe peut tuer, un rhume peut tuer, une cataracte peut tuer.

Le système hospitalier est faible voir inexistant et lorsqu'un proche est malade, on prie juste le ciel pour ne pas avoir à pleurer sa dépouille.

J'ai prié et espéré que cela n'arrive pas à l'un des miens mais le 15 Février 2015, j'ai dû affronter une dure réalité.

Si je m'adresse à vous aujourd'hui sur ce site, c'est parce que je sais qu'il existe encore des hommes, des femmes à l’instar de cette jeune demoiselle qui m'a trouvée en larmes et qui m'a offert un mouchoir pour sécher mes pleures.

En vérité, cette jeune fille m'a offert bien plus qu'un mouchoir, elle m'a offert son aide, à sa façon, et ce simple geste vécu sur le moment, est bien plus beau que tout l'or du monde.

Je sais qu'il existe encore des personnes comme elle, avec beaucoup d'humanité, qui ne supportent pas que les autres souffrent et c'est pour cela que je fais appel à vous.

Certaines personnes ne prendront pas la peine de lire ce message pourtant j'aimerais vraiment qu'il touche les cœurs et que mon projet aboutisse pour renforcer le système éducatif et hospitalier en RCA et plus particulièrement à Berbérati, ma commune de naissance.

Je veux que les enfants puissent y aller à l'école dans de bonnes conditions et goûter aux joies simples de la vie comme le goûtent les enfants en Europe.

L'idée serait d'apporter des fonds pour renforcer les dispositifs éducatifs et médicaux des établissements de Berbérati. Si l'on peut initier le projet dans d'autres villes alentours ça sera parfait. Je désire du fonds du cœurs que les habitants puissent avoir accès à des services et des soins de base et ce dans de bonnes conditions.

J'aimerais participer activement à ce projet alors je suis preneuse de toute opportunité proposée par les ONG à l'instar d'UNICEF, CARITAS ou MÉDECINS SANS FRONTIÈRES.

Je n'y arriverai pas sans vous, alors je n'ai qu'une seule chose à dire pour terminer : "Seul on marche plus vite, à deux on va plus loin".
story_txt: JEANNE,Je m'appelle Daléna, j'ai 24 ans et suis étudiante en seconde année de Master Commerce International. Originaire de la République Centrafricaine (RCA), j'ai conservé des liens forts avec mon pays d’origine.La République Centrafricaine est devenue tristement célèbre suite à une récente guerre civile. Les hostilités (entre Chrétiens et Musulmans) qui ont entraîné cette guerre ont fini par réduire à néant le peu d’infrastructures qui y existaient.En République Centrafricaine, la mort s'empare des âmes dans le silence le plus total. Une fièvre peut tuer, une grippe peut tuer, un rhume peut tuer, une cataracte peut tuer.Le système hospitalier est faible voir inexistant et lorsqu'un proche est malade, on prie juste le ciel pour ne pas avoir à pleurer sa dépouille.J'ai prié et espéré que cela n'arrive pas à l'un des miens mais le 15 Février 2015, j'ai dû affronter une dure réalité.Si je m'adresse à vous aujourd'hui sur ce site, c'est parce que je sais qu'il existe encore des hommes, des femmes à l’instar de cette jeune demoiselle qui m'a trouvée en larmes et qui m'a offert un mouchoir pour sécher mes pleures.En vérité, cette jeune fille m'a offert bien plus qu'un mouchoir, elle m'a offert son aide, à sa façon, et ce simple geste vécu sur le moment, est bien plus beau que tout l'or du monde.Je sais qu'il existe encore des personnes comme elle, avec beaucoup d'humanité, qui ne supportent pas que les autres souffrent et c'est pour cela que je fais appel à vous.Certaines personnes ne prendront pas la peine de lire ce message pourtant j'aimerais vraiment qu'il touche les cœurs et que mon projet aboutisse pour renforcer le système éducatif et hospitalier en RCA et plus particulièrement à Berbérati, ma commune de naissance.Je veux que les enfants puissent y aller à l'école dans de bonnes conditions et goûter aux joies simples de la vie comme le goûtent les enfants en Europe.L'idée serait d'apporter des fonds pour renforcer les dispositifs éducatifs et médicaux des établissements de Berbérati. Si l'on peut initier le projet dans d'autres villes alentours ça sera parfait. Je désire du fonds du cœurs que les habitants puissent avoir accès à des services et des soins de base et ce dans de bonnes conditions.J'aimerais participer activement à ce projet alors je suis preneuse de toute opportunité proposée par les ONG à l'instar d'UNICEF, CARITAS ou MÉDECINS SANS FRONTIÈRES.Je n'y arriverai pas sans vous, alors je n'ai qu'une seule chose à dire pour terminer : "Seul on marche plus vite, à deux on va plus loin".

story:
I have written a novel (my first completed, though I have written several screenplays, produced one as an indie DV movie, and have a degree in English as well as years of experience teaching English and creative writing) entitled World of Wounds. It was born of my own deep concern about the crisis our planet, species and future generations face if we continue business as usual with fossil fuels and the techno-industrial civilization status quo. With three young children, this concern is urgent and personal, yet also aching and general, existential and deep. I have researched these issues over many years, and have come to a conclusion that one of the best ways to get through to people who may be hesitant to face such frightening and numbing topics directly is in the context of an interesting, well-told story.

Read opening Chapters, FREE:

http://worldofwoundsnovel.blogspot.com/

Visit and "Like" the World of Wounds Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/worldofwounds

Writing it has been a very pleasurable labor of love, for a year and a half, and it is now complete and ready to make available, to spread as widely into the world as possible. I have self-published, as a print-on-demand, great-looking 6x9" paperback and also Kindle eBook, and have developed my own publishing imprint called New Myths, which I would like to establish as a venue for other writers wanting to tell compelling stories about these issues and how we can effectively address them.

I firmly believe that we need new core stories-- that the stories of Empire and Capitalism, of Progress and Endless Growth, support the great momentum of our species and culture toward creating a greatly impoverished future, a planet of crumbling ecosystems, species extinction, rising temperatures and seas, and other horrors.

We can live into a different future-- but we need, among other things, new stories. New Myths.

Your financial support will help to engage a widespread online marketing campaign to expand this novel's visibility, as well as costs related to establishing the independent publishing enterprise and attracting other writers seeking a venue to launch similar heartfelt, quality New Myths.

I am acquainted with an online marketing firm, one of the highest-qualified Google experts in Connecticut, who can mount a targeted, effective online campaign attracting people nationwide and internationally who are interested in this sort of story and overall endeavor. With enough funding, the campaign could also include professionally-produced marketing materials, a website, sophisticated/ effective SEO-- possibly even a book tour, as well as allowing for the beginnings of establishing New Myths and attracting/ seeking other talent to represent/ publish.


I did a lot of research when writing World of Wounds.  In re-reading parts of it the other day I came across a passage in which Marine Science PhD Isabel Craine (a fictional character, of course) is fretting-- obsessing-- over her failure to make any dent in stopping the destructive momentum of our culture, despite frequent media appearances and even testimony before the U.S. Senate regarding pollution, climate change and the dangers of myriad techno-industrial activities' impacts upon the oceans.  One of her worried thoughts is that the oceans as a whole may be dying...  Re-reading that passage, I found myself doubting my own words and research.  Is it credible that a renowned expert marine scientist would actually have reason to be concerned about widespread, possibly rapid extinction within the vast, diverse oceans?

Unfortunately,

Yes:

(Headline):
"The Oceans are Dying: Oxygen is Depleting, Acidity Rising at Fastest Rate in 300,000,000 Years" (yes-- that's 300 MILLION years-- the article is linked at the bottom of this page)

In the face of such overwhelming, large-scale problems, it is easy for any individual to feel it is not possible to address this burgeoning crisis-- but it is not an advisable strategy to ignore this sort of current event in favor of measuring Kardashian's parts or Brady's inflation.

My young son Leo, like many his age, LOVES ocean creatures and dinosaurs.  He has many toy versions of these that he plays with near-constantly (he fills containers with water throughout the house for his whales, sharks, crabs and friends to live and play in:), he pores through books and seeks-out media (nature programs/ DVDs, educational programs, cartoons) which feature these...  Planet Earth, Dinosaur Train, Octonauts, others with which fellow-parents of young children will likely be familiar...  It saddens me to think that, depending on how rapidly this extinction progresses, many of his favorite ocean creatures may be in the same category as the dinosaurs in his lifetime.

But for what little it may actually accomplish, I engaged in a labor of love in writing World of Wounds, continuing in my efforts now to promote it, representing a heartfelt effort on my part to contribute what I believe to be an important part of what must happen for our culture, its priorities and worldview to shift sufficiently to begin a necessary healing, even a whisper of decreasing our culture's relentlessly-increasing destructive emissions and behaviors (behaviors such as, to name just one, clear-cutting the Amazon basin and all of the planet's other tropical rainforests, which are currently approaching a point of no return in which they, "our planet's lungs" (i.e. oxygen-source), may irreversibly (in our species' lifetime) revert away from being a forest at all).

We need new stories.  We need to shift our way of seeing the world, our way of treating it, our way of relating to it, what we now think is "normal" in life.

I'm not suggesting that I am "enlightened"-enough to write "The Book" which serves as "The Solution" and causes "The Transformation" which would be necessary for survival instead of where our culture is now rapidly-headlong taking itself.  I wish I could accomplish this, but I don't give myself that credit-- and I certainly admit that I do not consistently, sufficiently walk my own talk regarding every detail of that which I critique.  I grew up in this culture, and share in its propensities, appetites and weaknesses (and contribute with my lifestyle, habits and perceived needs to its too-destructive "strengths").

World of Wounds was not written to be a self-righteous screed, but a story, which points in a direction, a direction which I myself have been very far from perfect in always moving...  This is one of the reasons that addiction plays a conspicuous role in the unfolding and overall/ underlying themes of the novel.  We have appetites, we have comforts and habits which will not dissolve overnight even IF we want them to...  I am working as hard as I can on that IF part, attempting to contribute  a good, appealing story-- five interwoven stories in World of Wounds-- in which readers can see and embrace how appealing, fulfilling and-- well, even exciting in its way-- participating actively, individually and within communities can be in the effort to achieve a Full, Necessary Transformation in an entirely new direction.

Really, it is a new kind of frontier, of pioneering; it is a literal New World which we must create, together, to survive and for other life-forms which will otherwise certainly perish to survive...  Maybe, possibly even once again thrive.  Possibly.  

Now, we live alienated and fill the void with "busy"-ness and techno-utopian fantasy, Apple-sponsored, Disney-magic-midwifed Bread and Circuses galore.

Part of what World of Wounds represents, attempts, is an invitation to the new, true, necessary Adventure of creating The More Beautiful World Our Hearts Know is Possible (credit to one of my great current mentor/ peers, Charles Eisenstein, for that great phrase).

I know many have long-ago written-off this sort of topic as Negative, as Doomsaying, as a bunch of whining and bluster about overwhelming problems without a solution.

I offer a more positive spin , which I have attempted to embody in my novel World of Wounds:

We Are the Problem as it currently stands, BUT We in our lives and Communities are The Only Possible SOLUTION as well-- and it is a Great Adventure for us to embrace this opportunity, this responsibility, to Live Into the new world-- to Make that new world Possible.

http://m.dailykos.com/story/2013/10/04/1243700/-The-Oceans-are-Dying-Oxygen-is-Depleting-Acidity-Rising-at-Fastest-Rate-in-300-000-000-Years


Novel Summary
Five Journeys:
Carl, comfortable and ruthless atop the corporate pyramid, faces the collapse of that success and his own unsustainable addictions.
Saraya, a young woman raised in a self-sufficient intentional community in the high Sonoran Desert, has reached the age when she needs to discover and carve-out her own life-path.  She must leave the safety, support and the large extended famIly she has known.
Brett, a young Kansan farmer engaged to his high school sweetheart, has his world turned upside-down by an unanticipated, massive tornado-- in December, months away from usual tornado season.
Dr. Isabel Craine, PhD, world-renowned expert in marine sciences, has been clanging the alarm bells about the momentous, dire effects of pollution and climate chaos on the oceans and planet for years, and is reaching a breaking point of desperation and depression that nothing is changing or slowing humanity's headlong plunge toward self- and world-destruction...
Meanwhile, a young woman of college-age who has refused the call to university (though her self-education enjoys great momentum) has just completed a Vision Quest, and returns with insights and a Vision for gathering and harnessing the energies of those ready to live-into a new, necessary world and lifestyle profoundly less-destructive and more in-harmony with the miraculous privilege of existence on this only planet we know.
World of Wounds
A Novel by Zack Lehtinen 
Own the novel!
https://www.createspace.com/4283637
Read several opening chapters, free:
http://www.worldofwoundsnovel.blogspot.com/?m=1

Vision/ Tree:

New Myths Press logo-- rough sketch:

story:
Celebrate Yourself! Happy Birthday!!!

So many people ask the question "What is my purpose in life?"  Others ask "Why was I born this way?" " The Birthday Story" follows Jeffery's journey in heaven as he is given valuable information about himself from the Holy Trinity; God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit.  

Inspired by the Holy Spirit, I originally wrote this story for a friend as a Birthday present.  But through some encouragement decided to make the story into a children's book.  

As children read this story, it is my hope that they will realize that every characteristic, interest, or skill was given to them purposefully and help them build their self-esteem. 


How Will the Money will be Used

The funds raised will be used to market and produce "The Birthday Story" in addition to funding the beginning stages of "The Birthday Story" party stickers. Here is the budget in detail below.

  • Paperback and Ebook production- $500
  • Marketing Items-$900
  • Retainer for Public Relations-$2800
  • Party Stickers-$800
 As a thank you for your help, I have created some great perks in return.  Those of you who choose the perks that come with merchandise, will be the lucky ones to have these items first!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support me in other ways.  Help me get the word out about my book by asking your friends and family to pass on the campaign information using

the Indiegogo share tools!  Share on Facebook, Twitter,Instagram, and other platforms!

story:
We are all leaders in our own way. Here's why it's important, and here's why it's time we leverage the impact and influence entrusted to us.

Please help me get the word out to the countless individuals (your coworkers, friends and family) who are struggling to understand their calling in life - that it's not only possible, it's essential to live a life of IMPACT. Join me with a show of support on Indiegogo.

The Asymmetrical Leader is an invitation to individuals, an opportunity for personal development and professional growth. It’s an awakening of the human spirit and a guide to living our best lives now.

This is a book about the mythology of leadership (and success) and how leadership is for everyone. For too long, we've bought into the lie that we do not have what it takes to live a remarkable and impactful life. It's time to rethink and reimagine what our lives can and should be. To redefine what 'success' is and to rediscover our passion and calling in life.

We are all leaders in our own unique way - we can leverage our unique gifts, talents and strengths to add meaning and value in every arena of our lives...and the lives of those closest to us! 

Sink or swim - I'll need your help

If this Indiegogo campaign reaches the minimum, then I can self-publish and launch a campaign to introduce the book to readers online and in bookstores. The Indiegogo will be officially on, and if you're a backer, you will get the rewards you choose and have an opportunity to help those closest to you. 

Bonuses

Beyond The Asymmetrical Leader, there are many bonuses, that are unique to this Indiegogo campaign and never to be offered again. In this case, the two big bonuses worth seeking out are for any backers that support the campaign at the top two levels...

For Hero Supporters ($2500 and above) I will personally lead a 1 day on-site workshop for you and 10 of your closest friends, professional colleagues or clients. You will also receive personalized assessments, leadership resources and in-person coaching along with first print copies of The Asymmetrical Leader.

For Premium Supporters ($1000) I will personally provide leadership coaching for you (or someone you designate) for three months. This includes:

  • Personal and Professional Goal planning (1 year)
  • Monthly coaching calls for accountability, feedback and support
  • 360-degree assessment of key relationships
  • Personalized resources
  • Full email access (excluding Sundays)
  • Weekly reminders about current goals and feedback

What is The Asymmetrical Leader about?

It's about the heart of leadership and the value created when we understand our unique calling in life (and helping others do the same) by refining and leveraging our giftedness. The art of leadership, of making a real difference locally and of creating a better future in tangible and relevant ways.

This isn't a book about management or marketing. It's for anyone who cares a lot about influencing and impacting others in powerful and remarkable ways. I think we all have a unique gift to share with the world. And, this book is about unleashing the raw materials inside of us to help those we know and love live an extraordinary life.

Who is an Asymmetrical Leader?

Everyone we lock eyes with. 

THANK YOU for making it happen, and for spreading the word.
