Really appreciate all the support through the process.Indiegogo has a maximum time limit and a minimum target so if you're here before you'd like to pre-order the book you still can over here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/grief-by-cee...

story:
What is STEM? 

STEM is how educators and the government classify learning about Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math. 

When students are learning STEM they can be learning Coding, Bridge Building, Designing Dragsters, Performing Science Experiments, Engineering Robots and so much more. 

Help me start the genre of STEM Fiction #STEMFiction by contributing to this campaign to publish:

“Treasure Protectors Inc: Protecting the treasure of the Golden Quetzal.”

Description: 

This is a children’s adventure novel where Two middle school students are thrust into the Yucatan peninsula against their will and must protect the Treasure of the Golden Quetzal, possibly the most valuable treasure to come from the ancient Mayan Ruins, but before they can protect the treasure they must find it. Armed with an Engineering Notebook, and STEM knowledge these teens use STEM concepts on their quest of a lifetime
#GoldenQuetzal

Why is it important to teach children STEM?

 

According to the Center for Economic Development

"When we look at Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) jobs specifically, economic projections point to a need for 1 million more STEM professionals than the US will produce at the current rate over the next decade, according to the President’s Council of Advisors on Science and Technology. STEM jobs alone have grown 17 percent, which is much faster than the nearly 10 percent growth rate in all other areas. Yet the civic infrastructure is not there to support this growth.

One of the most important factors that limits the United States’ ability to stay ahead of the STEM curve is the lack of introduction to these educational areas at an early age...

The current lack of infrastructure around this educational priority is disconcerting when we recognize the individual and economic benefits of addressing these issues. The necessity for STEM to be introduced at an early age has never been more important. Action needs to be taken on behalf of parents, educators, and business leaders to make sure this comes to fruition." See the full article at: https://www.ced.org/blog/entry/the-economic-impact-of-early-exposure-to-stem-education


Who am I? 

  • I have been teaching Career and Technical Education for over 10 years. I have taught the gamut of classes including courses in Engineering, Graphic Arts, App Development, CAD, AP Computer Science Principles and many more. During Summers and on weekends I work at STEM camps and programs for students in elementary through High School.  
  • I am passionate about helping others learn how to apply STEM to their lives. I want to inspire children to enjoy learning and applying STEM concepts. We need to prepare more students for STEM careers, and I feel the best way to do that is to get children excited about engaging in STEM while they are young. 
  • I am writing a book to pioneer a new book genre, STEM Fiction. STEM Fiction is designed to engage children in STEM activities and inspire them to study it in middle and high school which will lead to them wanting to pursue STEM Careers in college. Keep reading to see how you can help Engage more children in STEM.  

Why I need Help

  • The book incorporates many STEM themed toys and projects. The projects in the book are inspired from that I had as a child that inspired me to study STEM,  and from projects that I did in middle school, high school, college and that I have taught in classes and camps over the years. I do not have all of the materials and projects available. Part of the contributions will go to purchase STEM "Toys" or learning devices that I am weaving through the pages of the book. By having the physical toy I will be able to better connect the reader to the STEM principles taught by the Toy. 
  • I began writing this book before I had identified a location for it's setting. After much research I narrowed down the best location to base this book was the Mayan ruins of Chichen Itza one of the seven new wonders of the world. Though I am a master at Google Maps' street view and have used google earth to  virtually "travel" to the locations in this book, I feel that my descriptors of the scenes of this architectural marvel will not do justice from merely looking at the interactive images and maps. I will need to smell the air, rub the soil in my fingers, allow my senses to experience the setting of this story to convey to the readers the grandeur of this location. Part of the Contributions will fund an expedition to Chichen Itza. 
  • "A picture is worth a thousand words" is one of my favorite quotes. This novel will come to life with pictures. Instead of illustrating the images, I want this to be real, I want the reader to see the STEM toys and projects that are referenced in the book (and extension activities) I want the reader to breath in the beauty of the scenes of the Yucatan Peninsula as they read the book and look at the full color pictures. Part of the contributions will go towards a DSLR camera, tripod and portable lighting. 
  • I have set my goal to receive funding for the essential items listed above, and feel with those things I can make this project successful.   But honestly I think it would be great to inspire and motivate more children to engage in STEM. After my initial goal I have included what I will do when I go beyond the goal. 
    Please note items with * will be used in my classroom after they have been used for this project. So your contributions will have a double impact. 

  • The funding goal is set to 3, 141 which will support the following: 

  • Educational STEM Toys* will be purchased to create STEM extension activities.
  • DLSR Camera*, Tripod*, and basic lighting* will be purchased to capture images of the STEM Toys and the Yucatan Peninsula.
  • An Expedition to the Mayan ruins of Chichen Itza will be made to explore the setting of the novel and take photos to support the story of the book.
  • Adobe Creative Cloud will be purchased to Layout the book in InDesign, and enhance the photos in Photoshop
  • After the goal is reached I will share details of how further contributions will be used. 
 

How can you help and how you will be rewarded

  • Supporters of this book will earn STEM related rewards like digital copies of this book. Click on the Perks to see how you can get rewarded for helping excite children to read about and apply STEM principles. 

The Impact

Your contributions will have a huge impact on the teaching children early about STEM.

  • Your contributions will have a huge impact on the children reading this book. 
     

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute but still want to inspire help please share this with your friends, colleagues, teachers via facebook, twitter, and you can even use the Indiegogo tools to help share this as well. #STEMFiction #GoldenQuetzal 

    To find out more about this project visit my website at: http://www.sterlingteaches.com/stemfiction/
story_txt:
What is STEM? 
STEM is how educators and the government classify learning about Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math. 
When students are learning STEM they can be learning Coding, Bridge Building, Designing Dragsters, Performing Science Experiments, Engineering Robots and so much more. Help me start the genre of STEM Fiction #STEMFiction by contributing to this campaign to publish:
“Treasure Protectors Inc: Protecting the treasure of the Golden Quetzal.”
Description: 
This is a children’s adventure novel where Two middle school students are thrust into the Yucatan peninsula against their will and must protect the Treasure of the Golden Quetzal, possibly the most valuable treasure to come from the ancient Mayan Ruins, but before they can protect the treasure they must find it. Armed with an Engineering Notebook, and STEM knowledge these teens use STEM concepts on their quest of a lifetime#GoldenQuetzal

Why is it important to teach children STEM? 
According to the Center for Economic Development
"When we look at Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) jobs specifically, economic projections point to a need for 1 million more STEM professionals than the US will produce at the current rate over the next decade, according to the President’s Council of Advisors on Science and Technology. STEM jobs alone have grown 17 percent, which is much faster than the nearly 10 percent growth rate in all other areas. Yet the civic infrastructure is not there to support this growth.
One of the most important factors that limits the United States’ ability to stay ahead of the STEM curve is the lack of introduction to these educational areas at an early age...
The current lack of infrastructure around this educational priority is disconcerting when we recognize the individual and economic benefits of addressing these issues. The necessity for STEM to be introduced at an early age has never been more important. Action needs to be taken on behalf of parents, educators, and business leaders to make sure this comes to fruition." See the full article at: https://www.ced.org/blog/entry/the-economic-impact-of-early-exposure-to-stem-education

Who am I? 


I have been teaching Career and Technical Education for over 10 years. I have taught the gamut of classes including courses in Engineering, Graphic Arts, App Development, CAD, AP Computer Science Principles and many more. During Summers and on weekends I work at STEM camps and programs for students in elementary through High School.  

I am passionate about helping others learn how to apply STEM to their lives. I want to inspire children to enjoy learning and applying STEM concepts. We need to prepare more students for STEM careers, and I feel the best way to do that is to get children excited about engaging in STEM while they are young. 
I am writing a book to pioneer a new book genre, STEM Fiction. STEM Fiction is designed to engage children in STEM activities and inspire them to study it in middle and high school which will lead to them wanting to pursue STEM Careers in college. Keep reading to see how you can help Engage more children in STEM.  


Why I need Help

The book incorporates many STEM themed toys and projects. The projects in the book are inspired from that I had as a child that inspired me to study STEM,  and from projects that I did in middle school, high school, college and that I have taught in classes and camps over the years. I do not have all of the materials and projects available. Part of the contributions will go to purchase STEM "Toys" or learning devices that I am weaving through the pages of the book. By having the physical toy I will be able to better connect the reader to the STEM principles taught by the Toy. 
I began writing this book before I had identified a location for it's setting. After much research I narrowed down the best location to base this book was the Mayan ruins of Chichen Itza one of the seven new wonders of the world. Though I am a master at Google Maps' street view and have used google earth to  virtually "travel" to the locations in this book, I feel that my descriptors of the scenes of this architectural marvel will not do justice from merely looking at the interactive images and maps. I will need to smell the air, rub the soil in my fingers, allow my senses to experience the setting of this story to convey to the readers the grandeur of this location. Part of the Contributions will fund an expedition to Chichen Itza. 
"A picture is worth a thousand words" is one of my favorite quotes. This novel will come to life with pictures. Instead of illustrating the images, I want this to be real, I want the reader to see the STEM toys and projects that are referenced in the book (and extension activities) I want the reader to breath in the beauty of the scenes of the Yucatan Peninsula as they read the book and look at the full color pictures. Part of the contributions will go towards a DSLR camera, tripod and portable lighting. 
I have set my goal to receive funding for the essential items listed above, and feel with those things I can make this project successful.   But honestly I think it would be great to inspire and motivate more children to engage in STEM. After my initial goal I have included what I will do when I go beyond the goal. Please note items with * will be used in my classroom after they have been used for this project. So your contributions will have a double impact. 

The funding goal is set to 3, 141 which will support the following: 
Educational STEM Toys* will be purchased to create STEM extension activities.
DLSR Camera*, Tripod*, and basic lighting* will be purchased to capture images of the STEM Toys and the Yucatan Peninsula.
An Expedition to the Mayan ruins of Chichen Itza will be made to explore the setting of the novel and take photos to support the story of the book.
Adobe Creative Cloud will be purchased to Layout the book in InDesign, and enhance the photos in Photoshop
After the goal is reached I will share details of how further contributions will be used. 
 How can you help and how you will be rewarded
Supporters of this book will earn STEM related rewards like digital copies of this book. Click on the Perks to see how you can get rewarded for helping excite children to read about and apply STEM principles. 

The Impact
Your contributions will have a huge impact on the teaching children early about STEM.
Your contributions will have a huge impact on the children reading this book.  

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute but still want to inspire help please share this with your friends, colleagues, teachers via facebook, twitter, and you can even use the Indiegogo tools to help share this as well. #STEMFiction #GoldenQuetzal To find out more about this project visit my website at: http://www.sterlingteaches.com/stemfiction/

story:
Give Young People a Voice

The children's book world has been talking about diversity and inclusion for years, and although more recently there's been some positive concrete action, in many ways we're still going round in circles about the causes, the problems and the challenges. Inclusive Minds is a not-for-profit collective and we want to see real change.

But who is going to make that change happen? 

YOU!

You can make a real difference. By supporting the Inclusive Minds crowdfunding campaign, you can help ensure that children’s books include a diverse range of characters who are truly authentic. 

The Plan

Our plan to support real change involves children and young people – the people who know most about what they want to see represented in books and how.  

Where real inclusion in books is concerned, thorough research is vital. With your support, we will develop an extensive network of ambassadors for inclusion; young people with real experience of marginalization who can share their unique expertise (covering all facets of diversity) with the book world. 

Authors, illustrators and publishers will be able to contact Inclusive Minds with questions, manuscripts or ideas that they wish to discuss with relevant young people. We will share the opportunity with our network and make connections*. Ambassadors may also be available to speak at events and in response to news stories.

As well as helping to dramatically improve authenticity and relevance, this groundbreaking project will give marginalised young people themselves a real voice in changing the face of children's books.

* For child protection, under 18s will be contacted via a parent or carer

The Added Bonus

As well as giving these young people a real voice, involvement in the network will provide insight into and experience of the writing and publishing industry, hopefully making them feel it is a place where they can belong, and in which they can play a valuable part. This in turn should help to diversify the children’s book industry of the future.

The benefits to the young people on the ambassador scheme are many and varied, as well as being valuable work experience that may lead to references and further work experience. We’ll encourage those using the network to give back to ambassadors. Some of the benefits they might receive are detailed on our website.

What We Need & What You Get

£4,000 will fund Inclusive Minds to grow the pilot project by recruiting young people (up to the age of 30) with an extremely diverse range of experience and backgrounds and cover the administration and promotion of the network for two years. The funding will enable the basic network service to be free of charge, but should relationships develop or lead to more official consultation or sensitivity reading, the network user and ambassador would be expected to introduce and agree fees.

Contributors can choose from a menu of exciting perks, including a mention on our wall of thanks, thank you messages from ambassadors, authors and illustrators, signed books, and inclusive book artwork and prints.

Backers can also take pride in the fact that they are helping to create a unique resource that will change the face of children’s books.

The Impact

We know from experience that authentic representation has a huge impact on children who have experienced marginalisation and who may be seeing themselves in a book for the first time. It's also vital for ALL children to see a diverse range of characters in books.

A successful pilot has proven the value of such a resource:

Author Robin Stevens contacted us last year as she was planning to include a British Hindu character in a forthcoming book. Although she had already done plenty of research, she wanted to consult people from a British Hindu background to ensure authenticity. We found several willing candidates in our pilot team of ambassadors – young British Hindus with very real and very relevant experience.

The result was a fully rounded character in Robin’s book, and a hugely valuable experience for several young people.  Robin tells us:

'It's important to research every aspect of your book, but sometimes research is no substitute for experience. I am so grateful to Inclusive Minds for putting me in touch with young readers from a British Hindu background, who helped me ensure that the portrayal of my detective George was not only accurate, but rang true.’

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate yourself, there are still many ways you can support us. Inclusive Minds is a collective and you can be part of it and make a difference. 

  • Spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share it on social media sites and encourage people to support us
  • Help us find ambassadors to join the network
  • Donate a perk for our crowdfunding campaign

About Us

Inclusive Minds is a not-for-profit initiative - a collective of people who are passionate about inclusion and diversity in children's books. We work with the publishing industry and the rest of the children's book world to promote and ensure authentic inclusion in children's books. We don’t currently receive any funding, and a large amount of our work and time is voluntary.

story:
"Exciting, dare-devil poetry! It's great to see so many titles by younger women poets."

"Saturnalia's texts are unique, impressive works that, together, create a coherent constellation."

"The variety of the authors represented by Saturnalia continues to surprise me."

"The books look gorgeous! There's a design sense in each volume that isn't traditionally available with a small press."

Saturnalia Books has been publishing outstanding poetry since 2002. We are proud to have discovered supremely talented poets such as Sabrina Orah Mark, Kathleen Graber, Sarah Vap, Catherine Pierce and many others.

As a small press, we rely on individual donor contributions to continue bringing you the quality of publication you have come to expect from Saturnalia Books. 

Please help us spread the word about this campaign!

Choose one of our books as a perk! It makes a great stocking stuffer!

story:
Short Summary

Greetings ladies. Greetings gentlemen. Greetings quadrupeds and cherubs. Welcome to my life.

My name is James Lawson Moore, but you will soon know me as the Wannabe Artist. I am a writer, having just finished my studies in English and literature at my local college. I've been writing for most of my life, but now that I'm nearing 30 in a couple of years I figured it was time to take the next step.

Which brings me to what I've done here. My first serious attempt at creating a publishable book-length manuscript is practically finished. The Journal of a Wannabe Artist, a collection of poems and prose poems, contains some of my most personal writing, and I think it's quite good. I have it edited and formatted, and I even have a cover done up. All that remains is to raise some funds so that I can print up copies and begin that next step in writing, from completing a book to publishing it. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to raise $1000 with this campaign. With the funds, I intend to copyright the book and print copies for sale at book conventions, indie bookshops, libraries, etc. I would also like to have some money left over to go towards a small online promotional campaign for my Facebook writing page as well as for myself as a writer. 

The main perk you will be able to get is a copy of the book itself. But that's not all. I also have copies of previous books I have privately published, books of which there is only a limited supply. Those who choose one of the higher-tier incentives will receive items such as the bound galleys or a copy of the first draft, both of which contain earlier versions of the poems.

The Impact

I am really excited about this book, and I think you will come to love it as much as I have. This book (which is the first in an intended series of books) contains some of what I believe to be the rawest and most real of confessional poetry, along with rather sobering stories in verse form. I believe that this book is a real gem, and I would be estatic to have it out into the world.

Risks & Challenges

There is no real risk those of you who give to the campaign. I am offering incentives such as books and so forth, and I will be sending them your way. 

The main challenge is raising the capital to bring this book to press and let it out into the world. With the funds you give I will be able to do that.

Other Ways You Can Help

As a struggling writer and 20-something, I know full well that money can be tight. If you are unable to give (which I fully understand, so no harm or foul), another way you can help is to share this campaign on your Facebook or twitter. Anything to get the word out would be much appreciated.

And that's all there is to it. Again, thank you so much for taking the time to help me out.

story:
Short Summary

I never expected an encounter with a homeless man to move me like Myron, aka "Glennie Strucks".  I work at a radio station in downtown Chicago.  I walk to work.  It's kind of a mindless walk to be honest.  But the last few months, I decided to engage the homeless more and try to get an understanding of who they are, what they love, and how they feel.  Myron was one of those people.  I asked him, "What do you want people to know about you?"  Without blinking an eye he said, "I'm a hell of a writer". 

Turns out, Myron writes every day.  He has multiple journals with his desires, musings, and experiences poured into each page.  In reading them, the best way to describe them would be homeless "psalms".  His writings echo the pain, the longing, despair, anger, and reality of living on the street.  Despite experiencing homelessness, Myron identifies as a writer. 

He is the reason I'm posting this campaign.  Myron is smart, charismatic, likable, and has so much potential!  He has what it takes to be a writer and motivational speaker, helping others better understand those experiencing homelessness and in so doing, lifting others off the street as well.  Your support for this project will change Myron's life.

I am asking for $4,000 for this campaign.  The funds will allow Myron's book to be printed.  The remaining funds will be used solely for finding Myron a safe place to live.  

When I first mentioned the idea of this project, Myron's eyes lit up.  Just the thought of knowing that his words could be in a physical book blew him away.  I think he felt validated in a way (as well he should!)  I know of no other book written by a homeless man.  If you contribute to this campaign, you'll be a part of the success story that IS Myron's.  

The content of his book is complete.  I have started working with Adam, another Chicagoan who knows Myron and is passionate about addressing the issue of homelessness, to help get the book edited, designed, and published.  Adam will also be creating a website (pro bono) to advertise Myron’s book and speaking engagements after the campaign is over, so your contribution now will have an impact that outlasts just this campaign.  We have already inputted Myron’s handwritten journals into a computer file and had them edited. We have identified a promising book publisher and are in process of having the book cover designed. I see no major challenges to this project, and if we run into any unforeseen issues, I’m not worried because Myron’s cause is worth it.  

Even if you're unable to support this campaign financially, you can still help Myron by getting the word out through social media, so please use the Indiegogo share tools!  Thank you so much!

story:
Darum geht es

Romana Hasenöhrl, Serienbuchautorin und Schreiberin aus Leidenschaft wagt sich an ihren ersten Roman. Ein Teil dieser Sammlung an Reisegeschichten wurde bisher auf einem privaten Blog veröffentlicht und wird nun nach unzähligen Leseranfragen in einem Buch präsentiert und erweitert. Ganz in Blogmanier dürfen die Leserinnen und Leser sich einbringen und Fragen aller Art stellen, zum Beispiel (Auszug aus Leserfragen):

  • Hast Du keine Angst, allein zu reisen?
  • Was, wenn es mal was mit dem Auto hat?
  • Kannst Du Dein Auto selbst reparieren?
  • Warum heißt Dein Auto "Carissima"?
  • Nimmst Du Carissima wirklich mit nach Amerika?
  • Wer ist der Blues eigentlich?
  • Geht der auch mal wieder oder bleibt der?

 

Was Du davon hast

In dieser Kampagne geht es um den Roman. Dieser Roman wird im Eigenverlag gedruckt und in Eigenregie vertrieben werden. Dazu braucht es ein wenig Budget. Die Reise ist ausfinanziert, mit Deinem Perk finanzierst Du keine Reise, sondern die Entstehung eines Romans!

  • Mit 10.000 Euro Kapital können das layout und der Druck für 500 Exemplare finanziert werden sowie sinnvolle Marketingaktionen geplant und umgesetzt werden.
  • Du kannst Dich auf verschiedenste Art und Weise einbringen - einfach ein Buch bestellen. Oder aber eine Frage stellen, die im Buch vorkommen soll. Oder einen Motivationsvortrag buchen, der Deine Mitarbeiter zum Träumen animiert.
  • Sollte das angegebene Finanzierungsziel nicht erreicht werden, werden alle Einnahmen in das Buchprojekt fließen und der Rest wird privat finanziert. Die Fertigstellung kann sich dadurch etwas verzögern, doch am Ende wirst Du Dein Buch in Händen halten!

 

Gibt es nicht schon genug Reisegeschichten?

Reisegeschichten gibt es wie Sand am Meer. Reiseromane auch. Und Sachbücher sowieso. Doch kaum jemand schreibt darüber, was es neben den schönsten Sehenswürdigkeiten, den spannendsten Roadtrips und den wunderbarsten Begegnungen noch gibt: Den Reiseblues, der einen erfasst, wenn man zu viel alleine ist, die Angst vor dem Versagen des Fahrzeuges, das die Reise erst möglich macht und die Herausforderungen des Alleinreisens mit Hund. Dass man trotzdem wunderbare Begegnungen hat und am Ende jeder Reise ein Herz voller Geschichten - auch das wird thematisiert. Und zusätzlich bekommst Du:

  • eine verdammt gute Reiseroute kreuz und quer durch Kanada und die USA
  • die besten Tipps zum Reisen mit Hund
  • Tipps für die schönsten Destinationen, wenn Du wirklich die Einsamkeit suchst
  • Tipps für die schönsten Destinationen, wenn Du die Einsamkeit überhaupt nicht suchst ;-)

 

Risiken und Nebenwirkungen

Was kann Dir passieren, wenn DU hier investierst?

Genaugenommen nichts. Der Roman "Vom Reisen mit dem Blues" wird auf jeden Fall entstehen. Sollte die für acht Monate geplante Reise nicht stattfinden oder früher als geplant beendet werden, wird dieses Buch trotzdem erscheinen - mit 250 Seiten Stories über all die Reisen, die der Blues bisher begleitet hat.

Nebenwirkungen: Es muss davor gewarnt werden, dass Du nach dem Lesen dieses Buches reisesüchtig werden könntest. Nichts und niemand wird Dich dann mehr aufhalten können!

 

Und wer ist dieser Blues überhaupt?

Jeder kennt ihn. Jeder ist ihm schon einmal begegnet. Und er sieht bei jedem anders aus. Mein Blues ist ein Rüpel. Er legt beim Fahren im Auto seine Füße auf dem Armaturenbrett ab, raucht und spuckt aus dem Fenster. Wann immer er Lust darauf hat, kritisiert er mein Leben. Und plötzlich ist er verschwunden, manchmal für Tage, manchmal für Monate. Doch er kommt immer wieder, soviel ist sicher.

 

Kein Geld?

Was Du sonst noch tun kannst

Egal, ob Du in mein Projekt investieren kannst und willst oder nicht - ich freue mich auch oder trotzdem darüber wenn Du

  • diese Kampagne an Freunde weiterleitest
  • diese Kampagne auf facebook und anderen sozialen Kanälen teilst
  • allen Menschen, die Du kennst, von dieser Kampagne erzählst

Und das ist es auch schon.

DANKE Euch allen!!!

story:
Short Summary

Paper Plains is a collaborative project spearheaded by The Raven Book Store, Lawrence Public Library, The Hall Center for the Humanities, The Commons, The Watkins Museum of History, The Spencer Museum of Art, Haskell Indian Nations University, Unmistakably Lawrence, the Lawrence Arts Center, and the City of Lawrence. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Paper Plains will bring 20-30 authors to Lawrence, and money raised through Indiegogo will buy those authors plane tickets and hotel rooms. 
  • Donating to this campaign here is the ONLY PLACE that lets you get the exclusive Paper Plains VIP pass. Get front row seats and first in line for all book signings!
  • A host of other exclusive perks, including valuable rarities from Lawrence's talented authors. 

The Impact

Paper Plains will provide a full weekend of cultural programming, including America's best and brightest writers, to Lawrence. It'll also show the region that Lawrence is a powerhouse of arts and culture. The Paper Plains team is a broad coalition with a strong track record of collaborative programming that thousands of Lawrencians have enjoyed. 

Risks & Challenges

A festival is an expensive and labor-intensive endeavor. It's not cheap to put this kind of thing on. This Indiegogo represents 13% of the Paper Plains budget. The rest is already spoken for due to our generous team of partners and collaborators. Even if this campaign fails, the show will go on. But this campaign will help us put on the best show possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now:

  • Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram for updates!
  • Share our good news, including this campaign and future lineup announcements!
  • Come to the festival April 23-26!

story:
desloque-se para a versão portuguesa

Project Coordinator

Hi, my name is Alison Neilson. I am an environmental educator and social scientist, and I am the coordinator of this project. For the past 11 years, I've studied the Azores fishing communities and the importance of their values, culture and knowledge for sustaining the oceans, wild fish and the future of their livelihoods. 

Collaborating with islanders and their associations, we've been gathering photos and recording interviews with people who use artisanal and small-scale fishing methods in the deep waters of the open sea. They have told us stories of their friends and families, of joys and sorrows and their hopes and dreams. 

Through vibrant words and images, these narratives interweave a contemporary portrait of fishers and the way they strive with a fierce tenacity to create a future of their own in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean. We want to ensure that these narratives are preserved, and this heritage is celebrated not lost.

Through this crowdfunding campaign we strive to create educational materials as well as a collection of images and information freely available to be used by individuals and associations in the islands.

Our dream is to create a full-colour book highlighting all nine islands, published in English and Portuguese versions, and available world-wide.

* Help make the book a reality *

Proceeds from book sales will support Azorean fishing communities

We are fishers, educators and researchers

I am honoured to lead this project which builds on multiple collaborations with fishers and their associations. Each island has their own fishing association and some groups such as the Federation of Azores Fisheries (Federação das Pescas dos Açores), and the Association for Women Fishers (Ilhas em Rede), represent people on all nine islands. Lists of all participating associations, past projects and other publications can be found here.

 

We draw from our experiences and training as storytellers, educators and social scientists, to share a contemporary portrait of artesanal fishers who strive to survive global forces in the middle of the ocean.

 

 

In-depth academic research along with hundreds of hours of volunteer time by fishers, their families and friends have build a wealth of important knowledge. This initiative will make use of this significant effort already undertaken and create a valuable database of interviews and photos, as well as other accessible materials to be used in schools, museums and other educational projects. 

 

 

Through the personal stories of those who live with the daily consequences of less fish, reduced quotas and regulations that serve large industrial-scale fishing, we learn about the economic and political realities of small fishing communities.

 

small-scale fisheries

A sustainable way of living

A proud Azorean heritage 

 

 

Every donation counts

A multistage approach to success 

You can join our team and help to increase the impact of this incredible community effort.

Specifically, your donation will be used to obtain the necessary professional editing and design for the text and the images, and the cost of producing a selection of publications including postcards, educational brochures as well as a 250+ page book.

You too can receive these stunning photo narratives!

 

 

The Impact

Around the world, more than 90% of fishing people use sustainable methods, yet their struggle to survive remains untold. Despite threatened, they are very much alive and kicking. 

This project delivers:

A Connection to the sea and our food via a spotlight into the everyday lives of people otherwise invisible against the international stories of overfishing

An introduction to people who chose to live in tune with ocean ecosystems in order to gather the last global source of wild food

A Discovery of hope amongst the common narratives of environmental destruction and crisis that there still exists working solutions

 

We have successfully produced numerous academic publications as well as locally available books. We have also trained teachers and facilitated gathering of fisher and scientists. We now seek to share this information with a broader audience. We want to increase the possibilities for a not-too-distant future where we could eat fish knowing that there are healthy populations in the ocean and where fishing communities could continue to exist in a sustainable manner with high levels of well-being.

* Help make the book a reality *

Proceeds from book sales will support Azorean fishing communities

Risks & Challenges

Design and editing expertise is important to create publications which are meaningful and effective for education. The aesthetics and how words are used are vital for respecting local knowledge and for making the narratives accessible across languages and cultures. Working in both Portuguese and English and with dialects and expressions unique to the different Azorean islands, creates challenges for translation.

We have a multi-stage plan to meet our goals. Success at each step allows us to have an impact by being able to create different types of materials and increasingly produce quantities of these publications.

up to €5000 raised - Since we already have a collection of photos and draft text for the book, donations will increasingly cover the costs of improved text and photo editing, translation, design and other preparations and allow us to share with people in the islands and to contributors of this campaign:

  • Digital versions of full colour books in English and Portuguese version
  • Printed postcards, photo prints and other small publications 

 

Campaign goal of €20,000 - This will allow us to create multiple small publications and distribute printed books to schools, libraries, fishing associations, and other relevant Azorean and Portuguese institutions as well as to the individuals who contributed to the content of the book. These publications will also be available to the contributors to this crowdfunding campaign.

Meeting the goal will allow this campaign to go into In-demand after the crowdfunding campaign closes. This will allow additional people to donate and receive perks. 

 

** News Flash: A major gift **

We have just received a donation from Canada (€4000) ahead of our crowdfunding. 
Thank you Gord and Sandra! This brings us immediately closer to our goals!

 

Join our team by sharing this campaign widely.

You can also follow us on Facebook, twitter  and our blog

 

 

Versão em português

NARRATIVAS FOTOGRÁFICAS: UM PROJETO DE EDUCAÇÃO E PUBLICAÇÃO DE LIVRO 

Contra ondas, chuva e ventos fortes, os/as pescadores/as açorianos/as agarram-se, de unhas e dentes, a um modo de vida que celebra a uma forte ligação ao mar.

Pescadores/as e cientistas -Partimos de uma colaboração estreita em diferentes projetos comunitários e de investigação para criar esta coleção de histórias e imagens que nos permitem conhecer o dia-a-dia das comunidades piscatórias vislumbrar um futuro possível para o peixe selvagem. 

Ajude a tornar o livro uma realidade.  Receitas da venda do livro apoiarão as comunidades de pesca dos Açores.

Coordenadora do projeto

Olá- O meu nome é Alison Neilson. Sou educadora ambiental, cientista social e coordenadora deste projeto. 

Nos últimos 11 anos, tenho estudado as comunidades piscatórias açorianas e a importância que os seus valores, cultura e conhecimento representam para o futuro dos oceanos, do peixe selvagem e do seu um modo de vida. 

Ao colaborarmos com açorianos/as e com as suas associações, criámos este conjunto de fotografias e entrevistas de quem recorre a métodos de pesca artesanal nas águas profundas do mar alto. São histórias de amigos/as e familiares, alegrias e tristezas, anseios, expectativas e sonhos.

Estas histórias traçam, a texto e imagem, um retrato contemporâneo de pescadores/as que, no meio do Oceano Atlântico, lutam por um futuro com uma enorme tenacidade. Queremos que estas histórias não se percam e que esta herança seja celebrada.

Com esta campanha de crowdfunding, queremos criar um conjunto de materiais educativos e uma coleção de imagens que passem a estar disponíveis, de forma livre e gratuita, às pessoas e associações das ilhas.
O nosso sonho é criar um livro a cores que retrate todas as nove ilhas do arquipélago, com versões em inglês e português, disponível em todo o mundo.

* Ajude a tornar o livro uma realidade * 

Receitas da venda do livro apoiarão as comunidades de pesca dos Açores.

 

Somos pescadores/as, educadores/as e investigadores/as

Sinto um grande orgulho em coordenar este projeto já que ele resulta de múltiplas colaborações com pescadores/as e associações que os/as representam. Cada ilha tem associações de pesca próprias e algumas organizações, como a Federação das Pescas dos Açores e a Associação de Mulheres da Pesca, que representam coletivamente as nove ilhas do arquipélago. A listagem completa de todas as associações participantes, de projetos anteriores e outras publicações pode ser encontrada aqui.

Partimos da nossa experiência e formação, enquanto contadores/as de histórias, cientistas sociais e educadores/as, para partilhar um retrato atual dos/as pescadores/as artesanais que, em pleno Oceano Atlântico, tentam resistir e sobreviver às forças da globalização.

 

 

Investigação cientifica aprofundada e centenas de horas de voluntariado, dos/as pescadores/as, das suas famílias e amigos/as, criou um corpo de conhecimento de enorme riqueza. Esta iniciativa tem como objetivo canalizar o valioso esforço já empreendido para criar um arquivo de entrevistas e fotografias, e outros materiais, para que estes se tornem disponíveis a escolas, museus e outros projetos educativos.

 

 

Através das histórias de quem vive e sente, diariamente, as consequências da falta de peixe, da redução de cotas e de legislação que favorece a industrial, podemos conhecer realidade política e econômica das pequenas comunidades piscatórias.

 

Pesca artesanal

Um modo de vida sustentável

Um património açoriano

 

Todo o apoio faz a diferença
Uma campanha por etapas


Junte-se a nós e à nossa equipa neste enorme esforço comunitário.

O seu donativo irá contribuir, especificamente, para suportar os custos necessários à aquisição de um serviço profissional de design editorial, de texto e imagem, e os custos de produção de uma seleção de publicações, incluindo postais, folhetos educativos e um livro com mais de 250 páginas.

 

Receba estas narrativas fotográficas!

 

 

O impacto

Por todo o mundo, mais de 90% dos/as pescadores/as usam métodos de captura sustentáveis, no entanto a sua história e a sua luta de sobrevivência está por contar. Apesar de ameaçado, este modo de vida, está bem vivo e recomenda-se!

 

Este projeto incita a:

Uma ligação ao mare à nossa comida, dada a atenção que é prestada à vida cotidiana de quem poderia, de outra forma, ficar invisível no contexto das grandes narrativas internacionais da sobrepesca.

Conhecer as pessoasque escolheram viver em sintonia com os ecossistemas marinhos e com a última fonte de alimento selvagem do planeta.

Uma mensagem de esperança que, face à normalização de discursos de crise e destruição ambiental, nos mostraa existência de soluções viáveis. 
 
Temos produzido inúmeras publicações científicas e livros na Região. Temos, também, organizado e facilitado diferentes encontros entre cientistas e pescadores/as e oficinas de formação para professores/as. Queremos, agora, partilhar esta informação com um público mais vasto. Queremos contribuir para a possibilidade de existir um futuro, não muito distante, onde possamos comer peixe sabendo que os stocks estão bem, de boa saúde e que as comunidades piscatórias prosperam, de forma sustentável, e com elevados níveis de bem-estar.

Riscos e Desafios


O conhecimento e o saber-fazer específico do design editorial é fundamental na criação de conteúdos educativos. O modo como palavra e imagem são mobilizados é vital para que se consiga, simultaneamente, respeitar o conhecimento local e torna-lo acessível a diferentes línguas e culturas. Trabalhar em Português e Inglês, e com especificidades linguísticas próprias de cada ilha açoriana, coloca-nos enormes desafios de tradução.

Para atingirmos o nosso objetivo traçámos um plano e diferentes metas para a campanha.

Vencer cada etapa permitir-nos-á ter diferentes impactos, isto é, permitir-nos-á criar diferentes tipos de materiais e produzi-los, de uma forma crescente, em maiores quantidades.

até € 5000 angariados –Uma vez que já temos as fotografias compiladas e um esboço do livro,o montante angariado financiaráos custos de finalização de texto e imagem, edição, tradução, design e outros preparativos para que o possamos partilhar com as pessoas das ilhas e com os apoiantes desta campanha:

  • Livros a cores com versão em inglês e português (digital)
  • Postais, fotografias e outras pequenas publicações (impresso)

 
Meta de € 20.000 –Permite-nos criar várias pequenas publicações, imprimir e distribuir livros para escolas, bibliotecas, associações de pescadores/as e outras instituições dos açores e Portugal continental, e com as pessoas que contribuíram para os conteúdos do livro. Estas publicações passarão também a estar disponíveis para os apoiantes desta campanha de crowdfunding.
 

Atingirmos o nosso objetivo permitir-nos-á passar à fase seguinte que é passar a funcionar “sob encomenda” após o encerramento da campanha. Desta forma, outras pessoas poderão continuar a fazer donativos e serem recompensadas pelo apoio dado este projeto.

* Ajude a tornar o livro uma realidade *

Receitas da venda do livro apoiarão as comunidades de pesca dos Açores.

 

** Notícia de última hora: Uma doação gigante**

Recebemos um donativo vindo do Canadá (€ 4000) antes mesmo do crowdfunding arrancar.
Obrigado Gord e Sandra! Estamos muito mais perto de alcançar o nosso objetivo!

 

Junte-se a nós partilhando esta campanha.

Siga-nos no Facebook, twitter e no nosso blog

 

Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis. Role até o topo da página e procure nolado direito do página.

O nosso projeto visa criar todos os nossos materiais de forma igualem ambos os idiomas.

Não tem cartão de crédito, mas quer doar?

Pode fazer uma transferência bancária:

Entidade: Centro de Estudos Sociais

IBANPT50 0035 0671 00000311330 75

BIC SWIFTCGDIPTPL

Descritivo:  9ilhas

Envie para alison as informações da sua transferência:

Alison Neilson - 9 Ilhas 1 Livro

Hi, my name is Alison Neilson. I am an environmental educator and social scientist, and I am the coordinator of this project. For the past 11 years, I've studied the Azores fishing communities and the importance of their values, culture and knowledge for sustaining the oceans, wild fish and the future of their livelihoods. 
Collaborating with islanders and their associations, we've been gathering photos and recording interviews with people who use artisanal and small-scale fishing methods in the deep waters of the open sea. They have told us stories of their friends and families, of joys and sorrows and their hopes and dreams. 
Through vibrant words and images, these narratives interweave a contemporary portrait of fishers and the way they strive with a fierce tenacity to create a future of their own in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean. We want to ensure that these narratives are preserved, and this heritage is celebrated not lost.
Through this crowdfunding campaign we strive to create educational materials as well as a collection of images and information freely available to be used by individuals and associations in the islands.
Our dream is to create a full-colour book highlighting all nine islands, published in English and Portuguese versions, and available world-wide.
* Help make the book a reality *
Proceeds from book sales will support Azorean fishing communities
We are fishers, educators and researchers
I am honoured to lead this project which builds on multiple collaborations with fishers and their associations. Each island has their own fishing association and some groups such as the Federation of Azores Fisheries (Federação das Pescas dos Açores), and the Association for Women Fishers (Ilhas em Rede), represent people on all nine islands. Lists of all participating associations, past projects and other publications can be found here.

 
We draw from our experiences and training as storytellers, educators and social scientists, to share a contemporary portrait of artesanal fishers who strive to survive global forces in the middle of the ocean.
 

 
In-depth academic research along with hundreds of hours of volunteer time by fishers, their families and friends have build a wealth of important knowledge. This initiative will make use of this significant effort already undertaken and create a valuable database of interviews and photos, as well as other accessible materials to be used in schools, museums and other educational projects. 
 

 
Through the personal stories of those who live with the daily consequences of less fish, reduced quotas and regulations that serve large industrial-scale fishing, we learn about the economic and political realities of small fishing communities.
 
small-scale fisheries
A sustainable way of living
A proud Azorean heritage 
 
 

Every donation counts

A multistage approach to success 
You can join our team and help to increase the impact of this incredible community effort.
Specifically, your donation will be used to obtain the necessary professional editing and design for the text and the images, and the cost of producing a selection of publications including postcards, educational brochures as well as a 250+ page book.
You too can receive these stunning photo narratives!
 

 

The Impact
Around the world, more than 90% of fishing people use sustainable methods, yet their struggle to survive remains untold. Despite threatened, they are very much alive and kicking. 
This project delivers:
A Connection to the sea and our food via a spotlight into the everyday lives of people otherwise invisible against the international stories of overfishing
An introduction to people who chose to live in tune with ocean ecosystems in order to gather the last global source of wild food
A Discovery of hope amongst the common narratives of environmental destruction and crisis that there still exists working solutions
 
We have successfully produced numerous academic publications as well as locally available books. We have also trained teachers and facilitated gathering of fisher and scientists. We now seek to share this information with a broader audience. We want to increase the possibilities for a not-too-distant future where we could eat fish knowing that there are healthy populations in the ocean and where fishing communities could continue to exist in a sustainable manner with high levels of well-being.
* Help make the book a reality *
Proceeds from book sales will support Azorean fishing communities

Risks & Challenges
Design and editing expertise is important to create publications which are meaningful and effective for education. The aesthetics and how words are used are vital for respecting local knowledge and for making the narratives accessible across languages and cultures. Working in both Portuguese and English and with dialects and expressions unique to the different Azorean islands, creates challenges for translation.
We have a multi-stage plan to meet our goals. Success at each step allows us to have an impact by being able to create different types of materials and increasingly produce quantities of these publications.
up to €5000 raised - Since we already have a collection of photos and draft text for the book, donations will increasingly cover the costs of improved text and photo editing, translation, design and other preparations and allow us to share with people in the islands and to contributors of this campaign:

Digital versions of full colour books in English and Portuguese version
Printed postcards, photo prints and other small publications 

 
Campaign goal of €20,000 - This will allow us to create multiple small publications and distribute printed books to schools, libraries, fishing associations, and other relevant Azorean and Portuguese institutions as well as to the individuals who contributed to the content of the book. These publications will also be available to the contributors to this crowdfunding campaign.
Meeting the goal will allow this campaign to go into In-demand after the crowdfunding campaign closes. This will allow additional people to donate and receive perks. 
 
** News Flash: A major gift **
We have just received a donation from Canada (€4000) ahead of our crowdfunding. Thank you Gord and Sandra! This brings us immediately closer to our goals!
 
Join our team by sharing this campaign widely.You can also follow us on Facebook, twitter  and our blog  Versão em portuguêsNARRATIVAS FOTOGRÁFICAS: UM PROJETO DE EDUCAÇÃO E PUBLICAÇÃO DE LIVRO Contra ondas, chuva e ventos fortes, os/as pescadores/as açorianos/as agarram-se, de unhas e dentes, a um modo de vida que celebra a uma forte ligação ao mar.Pescadores/as e cientistas -Partimos de uma colaboração estreita em diferentes projetos comunitários e de investigação para criar esta coleção de histórias e imagens que nos permitem conhecer o dia-a-dia das comunidades piscatórias vislumbrar um futuro possível para o peixe selvagem. Ajude a tornar o livro uma realidade.  Receitas da venda do livro apoiarão as comunidades de pesca dos Açores.Coordenadora do projetoOlá- O meu nome é Alison Neilson. Sou educadora ambiental, cientista social e coordenadora deste projeto. Nos últimos 11 anos, tenho estudado as comunidades piscatórias açorianas e a importância que os seus valores, cultura e conhecimento representam para o futuro dos oceanos, do peixe selvagem e do seu um modo de vida. Ao colaborarmos com açorianos/as e com as suas associações, criámos este conjunto de fotografias e entrevistas de quem recorre a métodos de pesca artesanal nas águas profundas do mar alto. São histórias de amigos/as e familiares, alegrias e tristezas, anseios, expectativas e sonhos.Estas histórias traçam, a texto e imagem, um retrato contemporâneo de pescadores/as que, no meio do Oceano Atlântico, lutam por um futuro com uma enorme tenacidade. Queremos que estas histórias não se percam e que esta herança seja celebrada.Com esta campanha de crowdfunding, queremos criar um conjunto de materiais educativos e uma coleção de imagens que passem a estar disponíveis, de forma livre e gratuita, às pessoas e associações das ilhas.O nosso sonho é criar um livro a cores que retrate todas as nove ilhas do arquipélago, com versões em inglês e português, disponível em todo o mundo.* Ajude a tornar o livro uma realidade *  Receitas da venda do livro apoiarão as comunidades de pesca dos Açores. Somos pescadores/as, educadores/as e investigadores/asSinto um grande orgulho em coordenar este projeto já que ele resulta de múltiplas colaborações com pescadores/as e associações que os/as representam. Cada ilha tem associações de pesca próprias e algumas organizações, como a Federação das Pescas dos Açores e a Associação de Mulheres da Pesca, que representam coletivamente as nove ilhas do arquipélago. A listagem completa de todas as associações participantes, de projetos anteriores e outras publicações pode ser encontrada aqui.Partimos da nossa experiência e formação, enquanto contadores/as de histórias, cientistas sociais e educadores/as, para partilhar um retrato atual dos/as pescadores/as artesanais que, em pleno Oceano Atlântico, tentam resistir e sobreviver às forças da globalização.  Investigação cientifica aprofundada e centenas de horas de voluntariado, dos/as pescadores/as, das suas famílias e amigos/as, criou um corpo de conhecimento de enorme riqueza. Esta iniciativa tem como objetivo canalizar o valioso esforço já empreendido para criar um arquivo de entrevistas e fotografias, e outros materiais, para que estes se tornem disponíveis a escolas, museus e outros projetos educativos.  Através das histórias de quem vive e sente, diariamente, as consequências da falta de peixe, da redução de cotas e de legislação que favorece a industrial, podemos conhecer realidade política e econômica das pequenas comunidades piscatórias. Pesca artesanalUm modo de vida sustentávelUm património açoriano Todo o apoio faz a diferençaUma campanha por etapasJunte-se a nós e à nossa equipa neste enorme esforço comunitário.O seu donativo irá contribuir, especificamente, para suportar os custos necessários à aquisição de um serviço profissional de design editorial, de texto e imagem, e os custos de produção de uma seleção de publicações, incluindo postais, folhetos educativos e um livro com mais de 250 páginas. Receba estas narrativas fotográficas!  O impactoPor todo o mundo, mais de 90% dos/as pescadores/as usam métodos de captura sustentáveis, no entanto a sua história e a sua luta de sobrevivência está por contar. Apesar de ameaçado, este modo de vida, está bem vivo e recomenda-se! Este projeto incita a:Uma ligação ao mare à nossa comida, dada a atenção que é prestada à vida cotidiana de quem poderia, de outra forma, ficar invisível no contexto das grandes narrativas internacionais da sobrepesca.Conhecer as pessoasque escolheram viver em sintonia com os ecossistemas marinhos e com a última fonte de alimento selvagem do planeta.Uma mensagem de esperança que, face à normalização de discursos de crise e destruição ambiental, nos mostraa existência de soluções viáveis.  Temos produzido inúmeras publicações científicas e livros na Região. Temos, também, organizado e facilitado diferentes encontros entre cientistas e pescadores/as e oficinas de formação para professores/as. Queremos, agora, partilhar esta informação com um público mais vasto. Queremos contribuir para a possibilidade de existir um futuro, não muito distante, onde possamos comer peixe sabendo que os stocks estão bem, de boa saúde e que as comunidades piscatórias prosperam, de forma sustentável, e com elevados níveis de bem-estar.Riscos e DesafiosO conhecimento e o saber-fazer específico do design editorial é fundamental na criação de conteúdos educativos. O modo como palavra e imagem são mobilizados é vital para que se consiga, simultaneamente, respeitar o conhecimento local e torna-lo acessível a diferentes línguas e culturas. Trabalhar em Português e Inglês, e com especificidades linguísticas próprias de cada ilha açoriana, coloca-nos enormes desafios de tradução.Para atingirmos o nosso objetivo traçámos um plano e diferentes metas para a campanha.Vencer cada etapa permitir-nos-á ter diferentes impactos, isto é, permitir-nos-á criar diferentes tipos de materiais e produzi-los, de uma forma crescente, em maiores quantidades.até € 5000 angariados –Uma vez que já temos as fotografias compiladas e um esboço do livro,o montante angariado financiaráos custos de finalização de texto e imagem, edição, tradução, design e outros preparativos para que o possamos partilhar com as pessoas das ilhas e com os apoiantes desta campanha:
Livros a cores com versão em inglês e português (digital)
Postais, fotografias e outras pequenas publicações (impresso)
 Meta de € 20.000 –Permite-nos criar várias pequenas publicações, imprimir e distribuir livros para escolas, bibliotecas, associações de pescadores/as e outras instituições dos açores e Portugal continental, e com as pessoas que contribuíram para os conteúdos do livro. Estas publicações passarão também a estar disponíveis para os apoiantes desta campanha de crowdfunding. Atingirmos o nosso objetivo permitir-nos-á passar à fase seguinte que é passar a funcionar “sob encomenda” após o encerramento da campanha. Desta forma, outras pessoas poderão continuar a fazer donativos e serem recompensadas pelo apoio dado este projeto.* Ajude a tornar o livro uma realidade *Receitas da venda do livro apoiarão as comunidades de pesca dos Açores. ** Notícia de última hora: Uma doação gigante**Recebemos um donativo vindo do Canadá (€ 4000) antes mesmo do crowdfunding arrancar.Obrigado Gord e Sandra! Estamos muito mais perto de alcançar o nosso objetivo! Junte-se a nós partilhando esta campanha.Siga-nos no Facebook, twitter e no nosso blog Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis. Role até o topo da página e procure nolado direito do página.O nosso projeto visa criar todos os nossos materiais de forma igualem ambos os idiomas.Não tem cartão de crédito, mas quer doar?Pode fazer uma transferência bancária:Entidade: Centro de Estudos SociaisIBANPT50 0035 0671 00000311330 75BIC SWIFTCGDIPTPLDescritivo:  9ilhasEnvie para alison as informações da sua transferência:montante:nome:endereço para enviar perk:Alison Neilson - 9 Ilhas 1 Livrolivrodepescas@gmail.com Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.Para doar para esta campanha em qualquer um dos níveis descritos abaixo, precisa de clicar na versão em inglês desses níveis.

story: My story began in 2015, when I was diagnosed with Stage 4 cancer. Since then, I have researched, created and followed a combined approach to fight the cancer and maintain my health. Now my goal is sharing what I’ve learned with as many others as possible, to provide both information and encouragement in our individual battles for life, beginning with this campaign on IndieGoGo. The funds raised will support me during the time it will take to write a book about what I’ve experienced and learned.

Now my goal is sharing what I’ve learned with as many others as possible, to provide both information and encouragement in our individual battles for life, beginning with this campaign on IndieGoGo. The funds raised will support me during the time it will take to write a book about what I’ve experienced and learned.

story:
For The Culture : Celebrating Black Women in Food & Wine

My name is Klancy Miller. I'm a cookbook author and writer and I'm creating a campaign to launch For the Culture, a biannual printed food magazine that celebrates Black women in food and wine. The stories in For the Culture will be about Black women throughout the diaspora, written by Black women and photographed and illustrated by Black women. It will be the first magazine of its kind.

Black women are the architects of cuisines and kitchens in the U.S. and in so many countries throughout the world and our stories about our expertise, experience and relationships to food do not get enough attention or coverage.  With your help, I want to change that. For the Culture will capture the moment and highlight what Black women are doing in food and beverages now, as well as honor the women on whose shoulders we stand.

This project is important to me because I got my first food job when I was 15 and went to culinary school in my early 20s and in all my time reading my favorite food magazines I never saw many women who look like me. Over the past several years I've met numerous Black women chefs, restaurateurs, farmers, food stylists, writers, bloggers, bakers, sommeliers, bartenders, food activists, entrepreneurs (and the list goes on) and I want to create a publication and a community that centers our stories and perspectives. 

What We Need & What You Get

The fundraising goal for For the Culture is $40,000. Funds raised through this campaign will pay for:

Content production: Paying writers, photographers, illustrators, graphic designers, a copy editor, a production assistant for their work, as well as paying for photo studios, equipment and travel.

Magazine production: Paying the printer.

Shipping: Paying for the magazine to be shipped from the printer to you, the readers.

Reward production & shipping: There are cute perks for contributing to this campaign (see the column to the right) and your support helps pay for the costs of creating and mailing rewards to you.

Indiegogo's Slice: There is a 5% platform fee that Indiegogo charges for use of this platform. There is also a 2.9% transaction fee that Indiegogo charges.

The Impact

Food is a major part of culture and Black women are historically and presently behind the scenes (and sometimes in the limelight) cooking food, growing it, serving it, writing and teaching about it. All people are welcome to support and enjoy For the Culture, however this project is especially valuable because it will be by, for and about Black women in food and wine.

Risks & Challenges

There is an enormous amount of energy and good will to make For the Culture a success. One challenge will be which stories to choose because there are so many stories and Black women are a defining force in food and wine throughout the world. With that said, For the Culture is an embryo at this stage and there are risks and obstacles in developing any new project. As a funder for this project you will be informed of any snafu that may delay the magazine's production or getting you your reward for contributing. 

If For the Culture doesn't reach its entire goal but raises enough to cover paying content contributors and printing, we will move forward with a smaller magazine and hold additional fundraisers to cover the balance. If the campaign falls extremely short of it's goal (with less than 50% of funds raised), we will refund contributions to donors. Either way, you will be informed of the outcome of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

I hope you will give what you can to launch For the Culture, but even if you can't contribute money, there are other ways to help:

  • One special way to give is to make some noise about this campaign on social media!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Talk about it with your friends or anyone you think may support this campaign!

One special way to give is to make some noise about this campaign on social media!

Talk about it with your friends or anyone you think may support this campaign!

story:
THE CAMPAIGN

Lost Souls Press is dedicated to printing books that otherwise might end up floating around in publishing Purgatory for eternity. By donating to this campaign you not only will be pre-ordering one or all of our initial three books, but will also be providing seed money to help launch this small, independent press and publish the long list of works in our hopper. 

LOST SOULS' STORY

The seed of Lost Souls Press was planted when I set out to find a publisher for my first novel, and second book, Behind the Slickrock Curtain. I’ve published hundreds of newspaper and magazine articles, had one non-fiction book published in the traditional manner, and I’m working on a second. The process for fiction, on the other hand, proved to be an agonizing, interminable, ego-crushing process. And even if I did get a contract, it would take longer for the book to be published than it did to write the damned thing. It seemed as if this book — along with all the other novels I had planned — was doomed to languish in the realm of literary lost souls. 

But I’m not one to give up so easily. Twenty years ago, my wife Wendy and I tried and failed to buy the Silverton Standard & the Miner newspaper in Silverton, Colorado. Did we surrender? Nope, we just started our own publication. Why couldn’t I do the same, but with books? 

And thus, Lost Souls Press sprouted, not only to rescue Behind the Slickrock Curtain from publishing Purgatory, but also the two novels that my father, Ian M. Thompson, wrote before he died two decades ago. Plus, I've got a bunch more books to write, myself, including a collection of essays and images, at least two more novels, and even a cookbook. Lost Souls Press will enable me to get these books out into the world of readers, where they belong. 

That’s where you come in. Publishing isn’t free. Editing, design, marketing, and the oodles of coffee required to coax the words out of one’s brain and onto the page — it all costs money. I hope to raise enough up-front through pre-orders and donations to cover the basic costs of publishing our first three books:

Behind the Slickrock Curtain: An environmental thriller starring Malcolm Brautigan, Eliza Santos, and Utah’s Canyon Country, by Jonathan P. Thompson, (Summer 2020). 

The Wingate Project: A sweeping historical novel based in the Four Corners Country, by Ian M. Thompson, (Fall 2020). 

The Feral West: Writings and images from the home place, by Jonathan P. Thompson (February 2021). 

The proceeds from the sales of those books will then go toward publishing the other volumes in the hopper, including but certainly not limited to: 

Black Snow: A former hobo reminisces about riding the rails, politics, and philosophy, by James O. Aldrich

Better Than Keks Cookbook: Healing recipes for a f#$#ed up world, by Jonathan P. Thompson 

Snow Screen: In which chem-trails, murder by avalanche, cloud-seeding, and small-town journalism collide. Starring Malcolm Brautigan, Eliza Santos, and the Woman with the СНЯГ tattoo.

Ortega, a novel by Ian M. Thompson.

Carbon Colonies: The rise and fall of the fossil fuel empires in the Southwest, non-fiction by Jonathan P. Thompson

Sonntag: The incredible true story of a German Jew who spent the War in Auschwitz and the American GI whom he befriended, by Wendy Thompson and Jonathan P. Thompson. 

Mine Pool: An Eliza Santos and Malcolm Brautigan novel, by Jonathan P. Thompson

Pinhead Chronicles: A steampunk novel based on the true story of Tesla, Telluride, the electrical grid, and Lucien L. Nunn, by Jonathan P. Thompson

WHO ARE THESE LOST SOULS?

I’m Jonathan P. Thompson, and I’m a writer — and editor, photographer, and artist. I am the author of River of Lost Souls: The Science, Politics, and Greed Behind the Gold King Mine Disaster (Torrey House, 2018), and I’m working on a second non-fiction book for Torrey House about southeastern Utah. I’ve been flinging words for a living since 1996, when I first got a job with the Silverton Standard & the Miner newspaper in Silverton, Colorado. Since then I started my own publication, owned and ran the Silverton Standard, and have worked in a variety of capacities — including editor-in-chief — at High Country News, where I'm currently a contributing editor.

THE $$ AND REWARDS

The funds raised will help cover the costs associated with publishing the first three books, including: editing, copyediting, book design, coffee, cover design, software, art acquisition, coffee, ISBN numbers and bar codes, printer setup, printing, marketing, coffee, shipping, and book tour expenses. 

This is a flexible funding goal, meaning that no matter how much is raised during the campaign, Lost Souls Press will publish these three books. If we fall short of the goal, it will just take a little more, let’s say, creativity (and coffee, albeit cheap coffee), on Jonathan’s part. If we go over the goal, it will ensure that we can publish more of the books on our list. That means that no matter how much you give, you’ll be doing your part to bring these works into the world. Plus, the perks are awesome! Here's what you get for forking out the following amounts: 

$10

  • Digital copy of Behind the Slickrock Curtain
  • Gratitude!

$20 

  • Digital copy of Behind the Slickrock Curtain
  • Digital copy of The Wingate Project

$30

  • Paperback copy of Behind the Slickrock Curtain

$75 

  • Signed paperback copy of Behind the Slickrock Curtain 
  • Paperback copy of The Wingate Project
  • Signed paperback copy of The Feral West
  • Lost Souls Press sticker

$100

  • Signed paperback copy of Behind the Slickrock Curtain
  • Paperback copy of The Wingate Project
  • Signed paperback copy of The Feral West
  • Behind the Slickrock Curtain t-shirt or tote bag
  • Invitation to the Lost Souls Press/Behind the Slickrock Curtain pre-launch party
  • Lost Souls Press sticker

$200

  • Two signed paperback copies of Behind the Slickrock Curtain (one for you, one for a friend)
  • Two paperback copies of The Wingate Project
  • Signed paperback copy of The Feral West
  • Behind the Slickrock Curtain t-shirt or tote bag
  • 8”x10” fine art print of artwork of your choice from the Lost Souls gallery: https://5-jonathan-thompson.pixels.com/
  • Invitation to the Behind the Slickrock Curtain pre-launch party
  • One dozen “Better than Keks” chocolate chip cookies 

$500

  • Three signed hardback copies of Behind the Slickrock Curtain
  • Three hardback copies of The Wingate Project
  • Two signed hardback copies of The Feral West
  • Behind the Slickrock Curtain t-shirt and tote bag

$3000 or more (Publisher's Paradiso Patron)

  • All the rewards from the $2000 bracket, plus:
  • Undying gratitude. 

Shipping and handling for the U.S. is included in all the rewards. Shipping costs may apply for other parts of the world.

Books as rewards will ship upon publication of respective title. Other rewards will ship in early summer 2020. 

Funders of $200 or more should specify which artwork you'd like by emailing me: Jonathan@RiverOfLostSouls.com

RISKS & CHALLENGES

This is not a high-risk project, either for the proponents or its funders. The biggest hazard is that the books we put out will suck. That’s always a possibility, but I ensure you that I will do all I can, both as writer and editor, to make these books as good as they can be. Besides, the cookies in some of the rewards? They will be good. I guarantee it. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

So, maybe you want to help, but don’t want to fork out any cash? I get it. And there are plenty of ways to contribute, for example: 

  • Read and review the manuscript or proofread it and get a free copy of the book! 
  • Read the book and write a “blurb” (You know, those things on book covers that say “A gripping page-turner! The best book of the year!”). 
  • You can let your friends know about this campaign. Tweet it. Facebook it. Instagram it. Or whatever. Hashtags: #BehindTheSlickrockCurtain #WingateProject #FeralWest #LostSoulsPress. Use Indiegogo’s sharing tools. 
  • Help choose covers. 
  • Help distribute or sell books when they are published.
story_txt:
THE CAMPAIGNLost Souls Press is dedicated to printing books that otherwise might end up floating around in publishing Purgatory for eternity. By donating to this campaign you not only will be pre-ordering one or all of our initial three books, but will also be providing seed money to help launch this small, independent press and publish the long list of works in our hopper. LOST SOULS' STORYThe seed of Lost Souls Press was planted when I set out to find a publisher for my first novel, and second book, Behind the Slickrock Curtain. I’ve published hundreds of newspaper and magazine articles, had one non-fiction book published in the traditional manner, and I’m working on a second. The process for fiction, on the other hand, proved to be an agonizing, interminable, ego-crushing process. And even if I did get a contract, it would take longer for the book to be published than it did to write the damned thing. It seemed as if this book — along with all the other novels I had planned — was doomed to languish in the realm of literary lost souls. But I’m not one to give up so easily. Twenty years ago, my wife Wendy and I tried and failed to buy the Silverton Standard & the Miner newspaper in Silverton, Colorado. Did we surrender? Nope, we just started our own publication. Why couldn’t I do the same, but with books? And thus, Lost Souls Press sprouted, not only to rescue Behind the Slickrock Curtain from publishing Purgatory, but also the two novels that my father, Ian M. Thompson, wrote before he died two decades ago. Plus, I've got a bunch more books to write, myself, including a collection of essays and images, at least two more novels, and even a cookbook. Lost Souls Press will enable me to get these books out into the world of readers, where they belong. That’s where you come in. Publishing isn’t free. Editing, design, marketing, and the oodles of coffee required to coax the words out of one’s brain and onto the page — it all costs money. I hope to raise enough up-front through pre-orders and donations to cover the basic costs of publishing our first three books:Behind the Slickrock Curtain: An environmental thriller starring Malcolm Brautigan, Eliza Santos, and Utah’s Canyon Country, by Jonathan P. Thompson, (Summer 2020). The Wingate Project: A sweeping historical novel based in the Four Corners Country, by Ian M. Thompson, (Fall 2020). The Feral West: Writings and images from the home place, by Jonathan P. Thompson (February 2021). The proceeds from the sales of those books will then go toward publishing the other volumes in the hopper, including but certainly not limited to: Black Snow: A former hobo reminisces about riding the rails, politics, and philosophy, by James O. AldrichBetter Than Keks Cookbook: Healing recipes for a f#$#ed up world, by Jonathan P. Thompson Snow Screen: In which chem-trails, murder by avalanche, cloud-seeding, and small-town journalism collide. Starring Malcolm Brautigan, Eliza Santos, and the Woman with the СНЯГ tattoo.Ortega, a novel by Ian M. Thompson.Carbon Colonies: The rise and fall of the fossil fuel empires in the Southwest, non-fiction by Jonathan P. ThompsonSonntag: The incredible true story of a German Jew who spent the War in Auschwitz and the American GI whom he befriended, by Wendy Thompson and Jonathan P. Thompson. Mine Pool: An Eliza Santos and Malcolm Brautigan novel, by Jonathan P. ThompsonPinhead Chronicles: A steampunk novel based on the true story of Tesla, Telluride, the electrical grid, and Lucien L. Nunn, by Jonathan P. ThompsonWHO ARE THESE LOST SOULS?I’m Jonathan P. Thompson, and I’m a writer — and editor, photographer, and artist. I am the author of River of Lost Souls: The Science, Politics, and Greed Behind the Gold King Mine Disaster (Torrey House, 2018), and I’m working on a second non-fiction book for Torrey House about southeastern Utah. I’ve been flinging words for a living since 1996, when I first got a job with the Silverton Standard & the Miner newspaper in Silverton, Colorado. Since then I started my own publication, owned and ran the Silverton Standard, and have worked in a variety of capacities — including editor-in-chief — at High Country News, where I'm currently a contributing editor.THE $$ AND REWARDSThe funds raised will help cover the costs associated with publishing the first three books, including: editing, copyediting, book design, coffee, cover design, software, art acquisition, coffee, ISBN numbers and bar codes, printer setup, printing, marketing, coffee, shipping, and book tour expenses. This is a flexible funding goal, meaning that no matter how much is raised during the campaign, Lost Souls Press will publish these three books. If we fall short of the goal, it will just take a little more, let’s say, creativity (and coffee, albeit cheap coffee), on Jonathan’s part. If we go over the goal, it will ensure that we can publish more of the books on our list. That means that no matter how much you give, you’ll be doing your part to bring these works into the world. Plus, the perks are awesome! Here's what you get for forking out the following amounts: $10
Digital copy of Behind the Slickrock Curtain
