story:
Short Summary

{ DIYdancer } magazine is an annual art journal telling stories from inside dance. Inside elegant layouts, and alongside striking photography, we share first person narratives and deep dive conversations into the creative process, from dancers and dancemakers around the world. { Dd } was co-founded by three professional dancers who were passionate about making things. As we began to meet the need for articulate and knowledgeable dance and arts coverage, we began adding dancer contributors from New York City to Los Angeles, Berlin, Atlanta, London, Minneapolis, Denver, Boston, San Francisco and more. 

What We Need & What You Get

'Issue 03 | SEEN unSEEN' is our biggest endeavor to date! Your contribution is crucial and along with it, you are guaranteed a digital and/or print copy of the magazine as well as a vote on our cover image!

With more contributors and more featured artists, telling more stories from inside the dance community, we have more beautiful pages for you to enjoy. But more of everything also means more costs:

$5k will help us offset some of our production and printing costs. If we surpass this number, it will enable us to print more and be able to make a bigger push into the wholesale marketplace! (And if we don't reach our goal, it simply means it will take longer for us to make it into the black.)

Each contribution comes with some form of 'Issue 03 | SEEN unSEEN,' whether in print or PDF. Larger contributions come with 'Issue 01 | collaboration + time' and 'Issue 02 | how to' and the possibility of shoutouts on our social media, website, and podcast. All contributions come with an opportunity to cast your vote on our cover image.

The Impact

"There is real life in these pages. Real humans, real dancers, sharing real work. The stories blew my mind and brought me to tears. Dance has been waiting for a publication like this, I've been waiting for a publication like this. A magazine that shapes moves into words for all of the movers. In a time where dance needs more voices not just faces, this journal speaks truth and connection. If you've ever felt alone in our world... read this." —Haley Kostas, choreographer

{ DIYdancer } magazine is an annual print journal committed to highlighting first person stories of how dancers and dancemakers are doing what they do. We continually offer fresh perspectives on how other artists are collaborating with, and responding to, dance. Our elevated design and aesthetic bring gravitas to our celebration of this art form and its intersections. 

With two issues already out in the world—on coffee tables and on the shelves of unique bookstores—we have a built up a track record for creating a publication that is special and timeless. 

Haley's words reflect some of the high praise we have received from readers. But what we think is more important, is the relationship that has evolved between us and our readership. For example, after she read our second issue and her deep response to it, we got to know Haley, her choreography work and her writing. Over the last year, we have been evolving with her, through all sorts of highs and lows, to help her craft a personal essay for this third issue about the tough spots that happen inevitably in a creative and collaborative process. The hours and months that went into it, have not only created a superior draft, they have solidified our respect for one another as artists and storytellers from the dance community. We can't wait to share all of these deep stories with you.

Risks & Challenges

{ DIYdancer } did not begin as a business, but rather a group of like-minded colleagues and friends who wanted to augment dance coverage with the voices and perspectives of the artists. The first issue of our print journal brought about the need to make this collective into a business. Thanks to some dedicated sponsors like MSeam Apparel, we have made it this far. But publishing in the age of free online content is a challenging market to find ourselves in. Nonetheless, we believe in the value of our contributor's voices, time spent editing and perfecting a story, and creating the most sublime form to view it in. Whether or not you are able to fund this pre-order crowdfunding campaign, we know we will rise to the occasion of publishing this issue. But with your help, we may do it with a little more ease.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow us on social media, comment here, there, and everywhere you can with words of support to help us get the word out about this magazine. And above all, please share this campaign with your friends who love art and dance and believe in the power of movement to change our lives and stories we tell about ourselves!

story:
The Blurb

"Who are we? Why are we here? And now that we are here, what are we going to do about it? ‘Tainted Canvas: The Black British Secret Guide to Success’ is the first book of its kind. It is the handbook we never knew we needed, a beacon of knowledge and information, to guide the Black British into unlocking the secret, to not only becoming successful but how to STAY successful.

The saying goes “you have to work TWICE as hard, to get half as much”, but why is that? What TRAPS are we born into? How were those traps made? And how do we get out of them? 

Success in itself is relative and comes with trials and tribulations, once you ‘make it’ out, can you stay out? And if you can, how does this impact you mentally?

It’s called ‘Tainted Canvas’ for a reason, find out why!"

 

Our Story

Hi, I'm Henley Beckford

 

I am a solo father of one. Sadly, back in 2018, my partner passed away and we still don’t know the reason why but before she died, she gifted me with a best friend, my son Pharaoh. I took on the role of solo parent when he was 11 months old and like most parents, everything I do is for him.

 

 

I am worried and I have always been worried that "if the worse were to happen to me, what message could I leave behind for him to have some form of guidance in life?". Pharaoh was born in June 2017 and before he was born I launched my first blog as a secret love letter to him, in December 2016.

The Blog: 'Hue By Design' (www.huebydesign.wordpress.com) was my inception of pouring out all my thoughts, feelings and findings for my son to see later in life. While I was writing with the foresight of ' what if the worse were to happen to me?', I couldn't imagine in a million years that it was my partner that would pass away and leave Pharaoh without a mother.

In all senses, It was poetic... But still heartbreaking nonetheless. 

 

 

In December 2018, six months after she passed away, I wanted to share the journey of being a solo father with the world, so I launched a Youtube channel 'Just Beckford' (www.youtube.com/justbeckford) setting out to document in all transparency, the ups and downs of being a solo father. My pains, my joys and most importantly us finding ourselves. 

 

 

While I enjoy all the creativity required speaking on all aspects of the narrative of the 'solo father', showcasing my vulnerabilities and hopefully adding value to anyone that could relate to similar situations, I felt and still feel compelled to do more. 

So I started to write. I poured out my soul to explain to my son the type of person his mother and I dreamed for him to be. A person of integrity, who understands who he is and has a firm identity of self.  I broke down business, finance and a wealth of knowledge that I wish I had growing up. I took a step back and realised that I was writing a book. A book that I feel would and could radiate out and add value to all our communities.

 

Who is this book for? 

 

This book is for EVERYBODY! 

This is a book for everyone, for young men and women needing inspiration and guidance in hopes to be the best versions of themselves, to the seasoned entrepreneur wanting to start more meaningful conversations.

 

While the book is 'Black British centric', it provides context for readers outside of Britain, who want to gain a better insight into how Black Britain was created; interesting historical facts and findings, as well as, a serving of practical business information for the budding entrepreneur.

 

This book is a living breathing case study of not only Black affluent people, and the 'How to's' but a call to action for social responsibility. It touches on the mental impacts of becoming financially successful and the battle with 'survivor's remorse' that many affluent people feel coming from humble beginnings. It also provides insight into meaningful ways of giving back.

 

In addition to this, the book tackles 'The Black Paradigm'. It questions in both a methodological and philosophical way of 'What is Blackness?' dispelling and unpacking a world of trauma and false rhetoric created to bubble wrap the topic of race worldwide. 

 

What drove me to write this book?

 

Subconsciously, it was my interests in history; economics; understanding my black identity and how the world works that led me to write within this point of view. I was fuelled off the back of traumatic situations that I personally faced while being raised in both a working-class; predominantly black and ethnic minority environment; attending a community college to suddenly moving to a middle class; predominantly white environment; attending an old boys’ grammar school but below are key points that have impacted my life the most:

  • Partner of seven years unexpectedly passing away – 2018.
  • Younger brother fell victim to Knife Crime in London – 2014.
  • Elder brother diagnosed with ‘Psychosis’ a mental health problem.
  • My love for the communities that raised me

 

About The Book

 

Chapters: 

The book itself is broken down into eight chapters:

  1. Generational Black Layering
  2. Decades Behind the Oppressed
  3. Building your Wealth 
  4. Becoming Well Rounded
  5. The (Money) Trap
  6. There’s No Way Home
  7. The Black Paradigm
  8. Black Women Rock (Her Power)

For in depth details about this book: www.justbeckford.com/tainted-canvas

 

Product details

Paperback: 320+ pages

Publisher: Independent

Language: English

Product Dimensions: 16.5 x 2.4 x 23.4 cm

 

How will the funds be used:

 

In all transparency, I wanted to accentuate that this book was written to add value. I want to be able to add value and give back to my community in any shape or form and in order to do this, I want to build a special amount of trust with you. And by building this trust, I am firstly required to show you what you will be giving towards.

For self-publishing this book, I have received a few quotes of the following costs, as well as this, I have put the costs I personally invested in bringing this project to life so far. 

Costs:

  • Crowd Funding Video: £3,600 (Invested)
  • Sound engineering and bespoke backing music - £1,000 (Invested)
  • Book cover design - £319 (Invested)
  • Writing the book (Priceless)
  • Hard copy printing - £4,438 (Quote to print 500 books)
  • Author audiobook recording - £4,500 (Quoted)
  • Book editing - £1,200 (Quoted)
  • Proofreading - £750 (Quoted)
  • International Standard Book Number 'ISBN' - £119 (Quoted)
  • Library registration - £65 (Quoted)
  • a % of all backing will be given as a donation to Future Men charity (www.futuremen.org)

To move to the next stage in order to self publish this book, we would look to raise a total of £11,213. Naturally, these quotes will expire over the course of the time, but I am working hard to keep transparency and trust.

 

So, where do you come in?

The more pre-orders we can achieve, the more likely we can truly bring this book to life! Once all targets are met, a % will be donated to the Future Men charity. 

 

Future Men Charity: 

 

Founded in 1988 as Working With Men, the Future Men Charity is a multi-award-winning specialist charity that supports boys and men along the path to becoming dynamic future men. Through their practice-led services, they encourage boys and men to explore, celebrate and build on the seven characteristics that they believe contribute to positive masculinity.

  1. Resilience
  2. Inclusiveness 
  3. Reflectiveness
  4. Empathy
  5. Resourcefulness
  6. Curiosity 
  7. Non-Violence

To find out more about the Future Men charity, please click the link: www.futuremen.org 

 

Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to pre-order. But you can support and contribute by sharing this campaign with friends, family, and colleagues. Posting on your social media to make this secret guide not so secret!

 

Thank you for reading, I really appreciate you and thank you for being apart of this journey!

Yours truly,

Henley Beckford

I am worried and I have always been worried that "if the worse were to happen to me, what message could I leave behind for him to have some form of guidance in life?". Pharaoh was born in June 2017 and before he was born I launched my first blog as a secret love letter to him, in December 2016.
The Blog: 'Hue By Design' (www.huebydesign.wordpress.com) was my inception of pouring out all my thoughts, feelings and findings for my son to see later in life. While I was writing with the foresight of ' what if the worse were to happen to me?', I couldn't imagine in a million years that it was my partner that would pass away and leave Pharaoh without a mother.
In all senses, It was poetic... But still heartbreaking nonetheless. 
 

 
In December 2018, six months after she passed away, I wanted to share the journey of being a solo father with the world, so I launched a Youtube channel 'Just Beckford' (www.youtube.com/justbeckford) setting out to document in all transparency, the ups and downs of being a solo father. My pains, my joys and most importantly us finding ourselves. 
 

 
While I enjoy all the creativity required speaking on all aspects of the narrative of the 'solo father', showcasing my vulnerabilities and hopefully adding value to anyone that could relate to similar situations, I felt and still feel compelled to do more. 
So I started to write. I poured out my soul to explain to my son the type of person his mother and I dreamed for him to be. A person of integrity, who understands who he is and has a firm identity of self.  I broke down business, finance and a wealth of knowledge that I wish I had growing up. I took a step back and realised that I was writing a book. A book that I feel would and could radiate out and add value to all our communities.

 
Who is this book for? 
 
This book is for EVERYBODY! 
This is a book for everyone, for young men and women needing inspiration and guidance in hopes to be the best versions of themselves, to the seasoned entrepreneur wanting to start more meaningful conversations.
 
While the book is 'Black British centric', it provides context for readers outside of Britain, who want to gain a better insight into how Black Britain was created; interesting historical facts and findings, as well as, a serving of practical business information for the budding entrepreneur.
 
This book is a living breathing case study of not only Black affluent people, and the 'How to's' but a call to action for social responsibility. It touches on the mental impacts of becoming financially successful and the battle with 'survivor's remorse' that many affluent people feel coming from humble beginnings. It also provides insight into meaningful ways of giving back.
 
In addition to this, the book tackles 'The Black Paradigm'. It questions in both a methodological and philosophical way of 'What is Blackness?' dispelling and unpacking a world of trauma and false rhetoric created to bubble wrap the topic of race worldwide. 
 
What drove me to write this book?
 
Subconsciously, it was my interests in history; economics; understanding my black identity and how the world works that led me to write within this point of view. I was fuelled off the back of traumatic situations that I personally faced while being raised in both a working-class; predominantly black and ethnic minority environment; attending a community college to suddenly moving to a middle class; predominantly white environment; attending an old boys’ grammar school but below are key points that have impacted my life the most:

Partner of seven years unexpectedly passing away – 2018.
Younger brother fell victim to Knife Crime in London – 2014.
Elder brother diagnosed with ‘Psychosis’ a mental health problem.
My love for the communities that raised me

 
About The Book
 
Chapters: 
The book itself is broken down into eight chapters:

Generational Black Layering
Decades Behind the Oppressed
Building your Wealth 
Becoming Well Rounded
The (Money) Trap
There’s No Way Home
The Black Paradigm
Black Women Rock (Her Power)

For in depth details about this book: www.justbeckford.com/tainted-canvas
 
Product details
Paperback: 320+ pages
Publisher: Independent
Language: English
Product Dimensions: 16.5 x 2.4 x 23.4 cm

 
How will the funds be used:
 
In all transparency, I wanted to accentuate that this book was written to add value. I want to be able to add value and give back to my community in any shape or form and in order to do this, I want to build a special amount of trust with you. And by building this trust, I am firstly required to show you what you will be giving towards.
For self-publishing this book, I have received a few quotes of the following costs, as well as this, I have put the costs I personally invested in bringing this project to life so far. 
Costs:

Crowd Funding Video: £3,600 (Invested)
Sound engineering and bespoke backing music - £1,000 (Invested)
Book cover design - £319 (Invested)
Writing the book (Priceless)
Hard copy printing - £4,438 (Quote to print 500 books)
Author audiobook recording - £4,500 (Quoted)
Book editing - £1,200 (Quoted)
Proofreading - £750 (Quoted)
International Standard Book Number 'ISBN' - £119 (Quoted)
Library registration - £65 (Quoted)
a % of all backing will be given as a donation to Future Men charity (www.futuremen.org)

To move to the next stage in order to self publish this book, we would look to raise a total of £11,213. Naturally, these quotes will expire over the course of the time, but I am working hard to keep transparency and trust.
 
So, where do you come in?
The more pre-orders we can achieve, the more likely we can truly bring this book to life! Once all targets are met, a % will be donated to the Future Men charity. 
 
Future Men Charity: 

 
Founded in 1988 as Working With Men, the Future Men Charity is a multi-award-winning specialist charity that supports boys and men along the path to becoming dynamic future men. Through their practice-led services, they encourage boys and men to explore, celebrate and build on the seven characteristics that they believe contribute to positive masculinity.

Resilience
Inclusiveness 
Reflectiveness
Empathy
Resourcefulness
Curiosity 
Non-Violence

To find out more about the Future Men charity, please click the link: www.futuremen.org 
 

Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone will be able to pre-order. But you can support and contribute by sharing this campaign with friends, family, and colleagues. Posting on your social media to make this secret guide not so secret!
 
Thank you for reading, I really appreciate you and thank you for being apart of this journey!
Yours truly,
Henley Beckford

story:
Bringing out your inner chef.

I’ve always loved cooking; community, for me, in synonymous with the word. Food brings people together. But most people feel intimidated in the kitchen; cooking shows and social media has glorified cooking in such a way that the average person feels unable to make a simple dishworthy of eating. 

My inner chef was born out of curiosity; imagine a young boy living in Liberia among Lebanese, Indian, and other West Africans who come together regularly to share food, drinks, and music.  Now, with 33 years of cooking experience spanning several continents, I give my readers the ability to cook either a single, simple dish, or create a few course dinner. 

My cookbook seeks to bring out the curiosity of a novice; to draw out the researcher and give them the confidence to make dishes using simple ingredients, while following basic instructions.

The timing for this project is also ripe: plant based cuisine is on the upswing. I am a very practical chef who encourages people, especially those who might be new to the concept, to try vegetarian/ vegan foods in such a way that they can understand the wholesome nature of what they are cooking and eating. The more you know... . 

Backers for this project will also have access to my knowledge of vegetable varieties, spice uses, cooking techniques, seasonal cooking, and many other skills I’ve learned along my journey. In some cases, like those who contribute substantial amounts, I will pay you a personal visit and cook with you and your family/ friends. 

I would love to see this project backed in a community style, with groups of people coming together to make it happen; community, is where I learned to cook, and community is where I want to invest in. 

As my gratitude for your backing, you’ll receive seats at my dinner tables when I’m in your area, personalized copies of my cookbook and other perks. 

I understand that some may not be able to back this project financially, so for those who can’t, please share widely with other who might be able to. 

I thank you again for your contribution, and look forward to learning, writing, cooking, and creating a community of inspired chefs. 

Kesh

story:
Click Here! For first chapter, book jacket summary, Spotify playlist and more!


The Project

Untouchable

Liz Nolan, recent college graduate, doesn’t have concrete plans for her future. On her way to what will likely become a normal, boring life, Liz faints at an airport and awakens days later in a stranger’s bed not feeling like herself.

Liz is exhausted, her senses are heightened and her internal physiology is changing. Dormant DNA has taken over, and she has begun a metamorphosis which will ultimately transform her into a Human sub-species with otherworldly abilities. Liz can read minds, move objects, even fly. Well, she would be able to, if she weren’t completely terrified of floating off into space. As if she didn’t have enough to worry about, she also finds out that her species can fall in love at first touch.

Liz is determined to improve upon both her newly acquired powers and friendships, even as she dodges multiple attempts on her life. Every relationship she has ever had—not to mention the once absolute laws of physics—is being called into question as she struggles to find her path in a world where a single touch could determine her fate.

About the Author:

A fan of patterned socks, funny t-shirts, and general nerdiness, Alexis Elena Peters is a positive realist who takes pleasure in life’s little “adventures”. Her philosophy: "Stuff happens, I may as well laugh about it." You’ll hear it when she does (even and especially when it isn’t appropriate).

I am now going to stop referring to myself in the third person.

Last year, I dusted off an incomplete idea and brought it to a writers' retreat. Not only did I improve the project, but the good people at When Words Count have asked me to participate in their Book Deal competition.

This Spring, my young adult science-fiction novel, Untouchable and I are going to be finalists in Pitch Week! (If you liked The Host, you'll love this)

Read the first chapter of Untouchable here: Chapter One


Why am I Here?

Pitch Week is an American Idol style publishing competition for aspiring and amateur authors.

As a finalist, I will be competing against seven others with my manuscript, marketing package, and personal story for the chance to win a traditional publishing contract, complete with the services of an agent and publicist.

The good news is, win or lose, I'll have the chance to work with and receive personalized advice from professionals in the industry. I will learn to polish (and pimp) my wares to perfection. So even if I don't win the competition, my finished product will be 100% ready to submit to publishers and agents, or even to self-publish.

The bad news is that, in order to be a solid competitor, I must enlist the services of professional editors, artists, and marketing strategists. And they're not free.


Why Contribute? 


Your contribution will help me achieve the dream of having a published manuscript and secure yourself a copy of what, I believe, will be an entertaining novel at the least. Whether I win this competition or not, whether I reach my funding goal or not, your money will go directly toward a dream already in progress. This probably matters to you if you happen to be my friend or relative (Which, let's face it, you probably are and, as such, you aren't even reading this).

For everyone else who stumbled in (welcome, stranger!): In addition to a new novel on your kindle (or a signed copy on your shelf), you can say that you were the first to know about bestselling author Alexis "Elena" Peters (I dream big). Come meet me if you like. I work overnights. I'm bored.

And if you're like me, you're the type of person who enjoys music while they read (or better yet, a novel playlist). Well, not only is there a customized Spotify playlist link available to everyone on my Facebook author page, but I have even written songs expressly for (and in) the book. Contributors to the musical tiers will receive a digital copy of a song written for my novel. Lyrics by Alexis Peters and music by Nick Thomas of The Spill Canvas*! (If you ask, I'll tell you how this came about.) There are two files, one a 60 second performance by Nick and the other the full song (as inspired by Nick).

If there is anything you'd like to see in exchange for your contributions--anything at all--do not hesitate to send me a message.

*Nick wrote the first 60 seconds of music to the lyrics I wrote. I have since hired others to finish what he started.

Risks to You

Win or lose, this project is going to take some time. Publishing doesn't happen overnight. Even if I win the contest in the Spring, the book may not be available until 2017. If I don't win, and I submit to publishers, it may be 2018 or later.

I will not forget you or abandon this project, not ever, but this is a labor of love and will not bring instant gratification. Believe me, I'm more upset about this than you are.

Stretch Goals and Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to my campaign, please share this with your friends. Anyone who likes to read young adult fiction or women's literature or who just likes to support new authors.

Beyond the support you are offering to me, I invite you to help me help others. Ideally, I would like a full soundtrack to my novel, including original songs written by myself and others inspired by the story. To do this I would need contributions well above the goal, as I would want to both pay the musicians and have a quality final product. If you know any starving musicians who might like to be a part of this for a nominal fee, share this project with them, and then support them by donating.

I am also looking for artists -- paint, pencil, graphic, whatever -- to commission items from specifically for this campaign. There is art for hire to be had all over the internet, but I would like to make this a community project. Let me pay you to create something in my universe and then we will both tell our friends about each other.



Update!

The song is finished! I can't really give you a preview, but here is the gentleman that made the final recording possible. Meet Jack

story:
Short Summary

A span of life can be like quicksilver and almost impossible to sum up in words. The story of heartbreakingly beautiful Abani, from Nepal is exactly that; filled with intensity and passion, taking her through unimaginable sorrow while handing her brief yet exquisite moments of joy. This woman of few words but vast reserves of endurance, wades through unchartered territory and single handedly faces hardships that come her way.

Abani is one, who has that little something that you may find in every special woman you’ve known. She could be your long lost friend, or that much-envied cousin. Perhaps she could be your cherished mother, a favorite aunt or for that matter, she could simply be you!

With my novel Ganga Jamuna, I want to walk with you and Abani, sharing simple moments, embracing imperfections, living a little, learning a little, laughing along,  hurting & healing together.  Somewhere along the lines, as you bond with the enchanting Abani, do allow yourself to breathe easy, take heed of the ones around and most importantly count your blessings!

How the story came to me

(A dummy copy of the book)

The story of Ganga Jamuna came to me through a newspaper article that I had read almost three years ago. It was about the poignant story of a family from Nepal. Days passed but key facts about their hardship kept spinning in my mind, and an idea was born!

Soon the idea took firm root and began to sprout leaves. My words started to flow in multitudes and my novel commenced. Hand in hand with the saga that was being created on paper, the thought of the unfortunate family began to take on a new meaning for me and I was now on a mission. But I knew that I had to strike a balance for my readers. I had to be mindful of the creative aspect of the novel versus the humanitarian ideals that I had set for it. So I was constantly steering my words in a way that drove home a point and yet stayed true to my heart!

When I was half way through writing the story however, disaster struck. Nepal, where the story had its core was hit by a massive earthquake leading to immense misfortune. Now I was certain that the quest that I had undertaken was meant for reasons way larger than I had anticipated. The novel Ganga Jamuna needed to be read by many to warrant some hope.

At this point, I urge you to look around with an enhanced sense of compassion. And stride forward to soothe the disappointed and the distraught.

How can you help?

Please support in crowd funding this book, as you will be making a noteworthy difference. Part of the proceeds of the book will pave a financial avenue in aiding the reconstructive surgeries required by 15 year old Jamuna Shreshtha of Nepal. 

Singapore’s leading Neurosurgeon, Dr Keith YC Goh of Mount Elizabeth Medical Centre, who conducted the pioneering surgery on Jamuna in 2001 has very kindly consented in assisting the channeling of the funds to her family.

Do take that small step… Be the bearer of goodwill. Any amount is welcome! Check out our perks to get you started!

About myelf

My name is Sunita Lad Bhamray and this novel is my third book. My first being Triumphs on the Turf; a one of a kind book on horse racing in India in the seventies. My second book, Grandma Lim’s Persimmons is a fun read for young children.

 I currently live in the multi-cultural and vibrant city of Singapore with my family. I started my professional career in the corporate world but soon moved on to becoming an educator and have been teaching for the past fifteen years. Apart from writing, I juggle my life as a homemaker and a mother.

The book Ganga Jamuna, on many levels, brings to the fore the mother in me. It is a creation of love and the time I spent writing it made for a truly magical journey for me. I grew with my story and developed a deep affection for the characters.

My writing reflects who I am and you will notice my constant references to enthralling travels and nature at its blissful and heightened goodness. I am a children's writer at heart and I believe in looking at life with those special lenses that makes the world an amazing place and every moment worth living.

story:
AWARD WINNING & SCHOLASTIC BOOKS CHILDREN'S AUTHOR 

I'm N. Joy, children's author of The Secret Olivia Told Me, which received an American Library Association Coretta Scott King Honor. Book Club rights were acquired by Scholastic Books and it has sold almost 100,000 copies to date. It's a humbling honor to be able to say that there are close to 100,000 children in the world who have a copy of something I penned on their bookshelf. But I don't want to stop there, which is why I'm making it my personal crusade to see to it that as many children as possible are blessed with the experience of creating that everlasting bedtime story memory...and have I got the perfect bedtime story.

THE BEDTIME STORY EXPERIENCE

As a mother of four--three school-aged who attend three different schools (that means I'm at three different PTO meetings a month)--and on top of that being a work from home mom and wife, no matter how hectic, draining and bananas my day has been, come bedtime, my youngest--my seven year old--still expects me to end the night by tucking  him into bed with a good old fashion bedtime story. That's our thing. It's our time. It's our moment. Shouldn't every child own such a moment? If there's no other story we can pass down to future generations, it's how wonderful bedtime was because of that favorite bedtime story we read over and over and over again (without complaint on either end ;-). It just so happens that I want to create that tradition with a bedtime story about...well...bedtime.

ABOUT THE BOOK

Just like with The Secret Olivia Told Me, When the Clock Strikes Eight is a children's book that I wrote when my now 28 year old was around six. Little one’s will think twice the next time they want to stay up past their bedtime, especially on a school night! In When the Clock Strikes Eight, the kid in this story learns the hard way that staying up past bedtime might seem like a great idea in the midst of all the fun, but there will be a price to pay indeed come morning.

The same way I waited fifteen years to dust off my Olivia manuscript and watch it become a part of so many children's lives, my prayer is for that same type of blessing to fall upon When the Clock Strikes Eight; one hundred fold! And just like with Olivia, the time is right. And, after all, timing is everything (no pun intended).

HOW YOUR DONATION CAN HELP

By donating toward this campaign, not only will I be able to get the book into production (pay an illustrator, designer for layout, editor, copyright, typesetter, printer, shipping cost, marketing, promotions, etc...), but I'll be able to personally visit children, shelters, libraries and schools all over the map to hold reading events and workshops. Can't you just see it now; kids getting to wear their pajamas to school/the library and bring their pillow-pet because author N. Joy is coming to read them a bedtime story? I do author visits and instruct workshops all over the map now with The Secret Olivia Told Me, but my heart desires to do it on a much larger scale...and much more often. My budget may not be able to accomplish such today, but my faith is certain about my achievements of tomorrow.

It's a must that I move forward, and this campaign is that vehicle to get me moving along. Things that don't move forward stagnate and die. Written words live and bring forth life, and I want to play a huge part in being the heartbeat of bringing back the family tradition of bedtime storytelling. 

GREAT BEGINNING TO A VISION WITH NO END

Fifty thousand dollars will be a great start to the beginning of a vision that has no end. Books may have a literal ending, but the experience of the words live on forever in the imagination. Books live on forever, they are a legacy. No donation is too big or too small. A donation of at least $30 will get you two autographed copies of the first printed books hot off the shelf; one to keep for yourself or your child(ren) and one to bless another child with. Donate $500 and fifty copies will be donated to the school, shelter, library, organization of your choice. For a donation of $2000 or more, I will go to the school, shelter or library of your choice in the United States or Canada as a guest author. I will donate ten copies to that school/library/shelter as well as instruct my "Kreative Kids Write!" writing workshop. You can pre-order your autographed copy for $20.

WAYS YOU CAN HELP IN ADDITION OR OTHER THAN FINANCIALLY

Please don't get discouraged if your budget doesn't allow you to donate or pre-order the book. Any amount you can offer toward the campaign will go toward the production of the book and getting it into children's hands across the map. The more books that can be printed on a print run, the less expensive it is to produce a book, which makes it more feasible for families to obtain and more books organizations/donors can donate to charities, shelters, libraries and schools.

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can contribute by word of mouth. Tell your friends, family, coworkers, neighbors, schools, libraries, churches and PTA/PTO's about the When the Clock Strikes Eight campaign. You can even use the Indiegogo sharing tools to post on social media. 

BE WHO YOU WANT YOUR CHILDREN TO BE

I'm almost certain that the full goal amount will be achieved, but if it isn't, the funds that are raised will go toward the production of the book, and my team will still work  just as hard to promote what should be everyone's favorite pastime; bedtime with a bedtime story. We say reading is fundamental and education is important, well how are our children going to believe us if we won't even pick up a book ourselves...or gift them a book? Let's be who we want our children to be. Let's be readers, and let's make them readers as well.

Thank you in advance for your donation...and happy reading!
story_txt:
AWARD WINNING & SCHOLASTIC BOOKS CHILDREN'S AUTHOR 

I'm N. Joy, children's author of The Secret Olivia Told Me, which received an American Library Association Coretta Scott King Honor. Book Club rights were acquired by Scholastic Books and it has sold almost 100,000 copies to date. It's a humbling honor to be able to say that there are close to 100,000 children in the world who have a copy of something I penned on their bookshelf. But I don't want to stop there, which is why I'm making it my personal crusade to see to it that as many children as possible are blessed with the experience of creating that everlasting bedtime story memory...and have I got the perfect bedtime story.

THE BEDTIME STORY EXPERIENCEAs a mother of four--three school-aged who attend three different schools (that means I'm at three different PTO meetings a month)--and on top of that being a work from home mom and wife, no matter how hectic, draining and bananas my day has been, come bedtime, my youngest--my seven year old--still expects me to end the night by tucking  him into bed with a good old fashion bedtime story. That's our thing. It's our time. It's our moment. Shouldn't every child own such a moment? If there's no other story we can pass down to future generations, it's how wonderful bedtime was because of that favorite bedtime story we read over and over and over again (without complaint on either end ;-). It just so happens that I want to create that tradition with a bedtime story about...well...bedtime.
ABOUT THE BOOKJust like with The Secret Olivia Told Me, When the Clock Strikes Eight is a children's book that I wrote when my now 28 year old was around six. Little one’s will think twice the next time they want to
stay up past their bedtime, especially on a school night! In When the Clock Strikes Eight, the kid in
this story learns the hard way that staying up past bedtime might seem like a
great idea in the midst of all the fun, but there will be a price to pay indeed
come morning.The same way I waited fifteen years to dust off my Olivia manuscript and watch it become a part of so many children's lives, my prayer is for that same type of blessing to fall upon When the Clock Strikes Eight; one hundred fold! And just like with Olivia, the time is right. And, after all, timing is everything (no pun intended).

story:
Sažetak

Nakon prve knjige "Dijagnoza", koja je spadala u domenu publicistike i dijagnosticiranja stvarnih ljudi i događaja, a koja je (od strane čitatelja) dobila pozitivne kritike, započeo sam rad na novoj knjizi radnog naslova "Kako smo istjerali King Konga".

"Kako smo istjerali King Konga" društvena je satira, fikcija u kojoj su sve sličnosti sa stvarnim ljudima i događajima namjerne.

Kao i "Dijagnoza", i ova knjiga trebala bi biti vrlo dostupna, lako čitljiva, a ovaj puta i zabavna. Zato mi je vrlo važna pomoć vas - budućih (a i dosadašnjih) čitatelja, jer svaka knjiga trebala bi biti izdana zbog čitatelja, a ne zbog autora.


Što ja trebam, a što vi dobivate

Za izdavanje knjige (koja će biti i vizualno privlačna) namjeravam prikupiti oko 20.000 kn.

U tih 20.000 kn uračunato je sve:

  • Grafička oprema knjige (plaćanje ilustratora i prijeloma)
  • Tiskanje knjige i doprema iz tiskare
  • Svi koji doniraju 15€ i više dobivaju primjerak knjige, s posvetom, odmah po izdavanju
  • Imena donatora bit će objavljena u posebnoj zahvali na kraju knjige

Razlozi i utjecaj pojedinaca

S obzirom na stanje u hrvatskom izdavaštvu i situaciju u kojoj je ministar kulture simpatizer fašizma, smatram da je potrebno uključenje svih pojedinaca u izdavačke projekte koji se baziraju na kritici postojećeg sistema.

Svatko od nas može na svoj način doprinijeti očuvanju mentalne higijene društva kojem pripadamo.
Svatko na način koji smatra prikladnim i sebi dostupnim.


Drugi načini na koje možete pomoći

Naravno da nisu svi u mogućnosti financijski poduprijeti ovaj projekt, ali svatko tko je na internetu može proširiti glas. 
Može proslijediti link na ovaj projekt svojim prijateljima, poznanicima, rodbini i s par riječi ih ohrabriti da se uključe u projekt.

Vrlo je lako podijeliti ovu stranicu klikom na neku od opcija.

To je to. Idemo zajedno odraditi nešto što će svima donijeti ponos i zadovoljstvo!

story:
My Book Is Being Published. Help Me Celebrate!

Hi! I'm Alex Finley, a former CIA officer who wrote Victor in the Rubble, a satire of the CIA and the War on Terror. To celebrate the publication of my book in April, I'll be hosting not one but THREE book launch parties:

Washington, DC: April 15, 6:30pm at Cloak & Dagger DC (This one is over. It was a total blast.)

New York City: May 6, 6:30pm at The Back Room (This one is also over. It was also a total blast. You missed out. Go to the Denver party so you don't miss out again!)

Denver: June 24, 6:30pm (venue TBD) 

These parties are happening no matter what, but your involvement will make them a lot more fun. We'll have all kinds of spy happenings and intrigue. I hope you'll join me!

Here's How It Works

I am aiming to raise $10,000. This will cover the costs of the super fun parties, which will have FOOD* and some DRINKS and CRAZY SPY SHIT going on. It includes the cost of getting you a copy of the book, too, and the cost of creating some very cool intrigue. It also helps cover my transportation costs and a slew of fees.

To make this a fun and interactive experience for everyone, these will all be COME-IN-DISGUISE PARTIES. That doesn't mean dress up like Spiderman or a mime. Just change your look a little, so you look like a normal human being, but not quite like you. Wear a wig or change your hairstyle. Wear glasses. Grow facial hair. Grow chest hair. Be creative!

And if you contribute $15 or more, I'll send you an alias package to use at the party, with a fake name and some brief background information about who you are supposed to be.

You can also get your copy of Victor in the Rubble signed by me. And you'll get a parole to pick it up. Or I can leave it a dead drop. I'll even sign it in code, if you want. For $250, I will personally exfiltrate you from the party when you are ready to go. Want to give more? Please do! I'll put together a whole collection of CIA memorabilia and spy gear plus five signed books for you.

I'll also do a Question and Answer session at each party. You can ask a real life spy about spy life! Ask me anything! I'll probably lie, but I'll try to make it entertaining.

As I said, these parties are happening no matter what. The amount I raise will only determine just how much fun we can have.

Please Help Spread The Word

Whether you can participate in these parties or not, I greatly appreciate your help letting people know about this book launch campaign and about the book itself. Tweet it. Facebook it. Or simply look another human being in the eyes and tell them about it. 

Remember: You can Like Me on Facebook and Follow Me on Twitter.

And keep up with my blog: A Matter of Intelligence.

Thank you for your help!

*there might not be food at the NYC party. Details to come...

story:
It's time for JAMM... issue #2 !!!

Just A Minor Malfunction... is an independent science-fiction e-zine, dedicated to publishing quality, thought-provoking, professionally-edited sci-fi.  We take submissions, and no story will receive a form letter rejection.

After the launch of JAMM... issue #1 earlier this year ( https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01G223BWS ) with stories from 12 independent authors, it's time for issue #2!


About the Editor

My name is Michael S. Alter, and I am a life-long sci-fi fan.  I grew up reading Asimov's and Analog, Heinlein and Clarke.  I love the stories, although editing errors would always throw me.

A few years back I started writing my own stories, and earlier this year I decided to try my hand at publishing.  I launched issue #1 with several key ideas in mind:

  • No form letters to authors submitting a story.  I'll always give you at least some personalized feedback.
  • Sharing the profits with the authors.  All authors receive a share of the proceeds according to a formula.
  • Authors retain the rights to their work, even after my edits.  I only keep the right to continue publishing the story as part of the issue of the magazine.
  • Low-priced, high-quality stories, about a dozen or so per issue.  I'm a strong editor, I'll work with my authors to put out only the best stories.  I have some additional reviewers/editors keeping me honest, too.

I'm not trying to make big money out of this, only enough to take my wife out for a nice dinner.


What you get

Sci-fi!  It'll make you think, and maybe open your eyes a little to the future coming at us.  There'll be about a dozen sci-fi stories (maybe 30,000 to 50,000 words total), plus an article from the editor (that's me!) about the future.


Risks & Challenges

No risks at all.  I'm getting good stories submitted, and I have a half-dozen of my own stories ready to publish, though I only expect to put one of my own in issue #2.


Submitting a Story

If you'd like to submit a story, send it (as text in the body of the email, please!) to:

michael.s.alter.author@gmail.com

Rules for submission:

  • 4,000 words of less (I'm not super-strict about that one)
  • PG-13 or tamer (a bit more strict on that account, but there is a gray area)
  • Has to be a work where you own all the rights
  • Science fiction, or maybe tales of the weird.  No swords and sorcery, please!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Post about the campaign on Twitter...
  • ...or Facebook
  • ...or any other social media platform
  • ...or just tell your friends about it!

Thanks again for checking out our campaign!

story:
Thank you for visiting our campaign! New York City Writers Network (NYCWN) is an organization that strives to connect and support the writers of New York City, on and offline. No one can relate to a writer’s journey like another writer, so NYCWN is growing a community to serve as a source of encouragement, inspiration, motivation, and information for those who share a love of the craft.

With our Writers for Readers program, we’re also rallying for literacy in a big way. We strongly believe that the ability to write well is crucial, no matter your occupation or walk of life, and that reading more means writing better. Our goal is to get books into the hands of more readers, and enrich the reading experience, especially in kids and young adults. 

NYCWritersNetwork.org will serve as our starting point and our homebase. With the proceeds of this campaign, we’ll build and maintain a bigger and better site for our members, for readers, and for our programs and initiatives that strive to support them.

For more information on NYCWN, our programs, and our goals, continue reading below.

Thank you so much for your time, your support, and your donation!

NYCWN is working to become the premier online destination for writers in New York City and beyond, a one-stop-shop for writers looking to share their work, meet and network with other writers, to give or receive advice, to stay up-to-date on all things writing and publishing related, and much more. 

Members range from writers and readers, to editors, designers, marketers, and literary agents. They are freelancers, industry professionals, published and unpublished, beginners and mavens. Some are looking to connect with other writers in their area, some are looking to exchange pages, some are looking to beta-read. Some are offering services, others are looking for services. But one thing we all share is a love of the craft, and a desire to support one another.

The website will service as a digital home base for our members. All members will be searchable by on their neighborhood, preferred genre, services, and interest in the community. Are you looking for a copyeditor? A cover designer? A beta-reader? Are you looking for someone to join your writing group? Attend your event? Maybe you’re just after another pair of eyes for the chapters you’re working on. NYCWritersNetwork.org will be the place to start!

 

NYCWN is more than a website, it’s a community. While we want our members to be able to keep in touch online, we hope to bring a lot of them together off. Through events such as write-ins, open-mic nights, and social nights, as well as workshops, seminars, and more, NYCWN will continue to provide members of our network and writers in the community with opportunities to meet, share, and support one another in person.

 

NYCWN is also a huge advocate of literacy, and reaching more children and young adults to instill the love of reading and writing into the youth is a leading priority. We’ll use all of our resources, including nycwritersnetwork.org, our connection to the publishing industry, and our connections in the educational system to get more books into the hands of more kids, as we continue to emphasize the importance of writing well. 

 

All the proceeds of this campaign will go toward NYCWritersNetwork.org, including website redesign and development, marketing and advertising, and all costs associated the growth and maintenance of the site. By helping us get our site up and running, you helping us 

 

Brielle Benton is the founder of NYCWN. She has worked in marketing and publicity in both small and large publishing houses, and has two published novels of her own. Her love for all things reading and writing, as well as her desire to connect with and help other writers like herself, inspired the creation of NYWCN and continues to motivate her on the journey toward making The Network a leading resource for writers in New York City.

They are freelancers, industry professionals, published and unpublished, beginners and mavens. Some are looking to connect with other writers in their area, some are looking to exchange pages, some are looking to beta-read. Some are offering services, others are looking for services. But one thing we all share is a love of the craft, and a desire to support one another.The website will service as a digital home base for our members. All members will be searchable by on their neighborhood, preferred genre, services, and interest in the community. Are you looking for a copyeditor? A cover designer? A beta-reader? Are you looking for someone to join your writing group? Attend your event? Maybe you’re just after another pair of eyes for the chapters you’re working on. NYCWritersNetwork.org will be the place to start! NYCWN is more than a website, it’s a community. While we want our members to be able to keep in touch online, we hope to bring a lot of them together off. Through events such as write-ins, open-mic nights, and social nights, as well as workshops, seminars, and more, NYCWN will continue to provide members of our network and writers in the community with opportunities to meet, share, and support one another in person. NYCWN is also a huge advocate of literacy, and reaching more children and young adults to instill the love of reading and writing into the youth is a leading priority. We’ll use all of our resources, including nycwritersnetwork.org, our connection to the publishing industry, and our connections in the educational system to get more books into the hands of more kids, as we continue to emphasize the importance of writing well.  All the proceeds of this campaign will go toward NYCWritersNetwork.org, including website redesign and development, marketing and advertising, and all costs associated the growth and maintenance of the site. By helping us get our site up and running, you helping us  Brielle Benton is the founder of NYCWN. She has worked in marketing and publicity in both small and large publishing houses, and has two published novels of her own. Her love for all things reading and writing, as well as her desire to connect with and help other writers like herself, inspired the creation of NYWCN and continues to motivate her on the journey toward making The Network a leading resource for writers in New York City.

story:
Hi, my name is Cezanne Taharqa (aka Cezanne Poetess), 

I wrote 'Journey of a Sister' to share everything I've discovered since asking God for 'the Truth!' in 2007.  You are invited to join the main character on her transformational quest for 'the Truth!' about sex before marriage, the creative power of her thoughts, her African ancestry, and the his-story of the religion she had been indoctrinated into! It breaks some unspoken taboos in a thought-provoking yet enlightening way that thousands of women and men have been able relate to:

” …Once I got started, it was impossible to put down.  It opened my spirit and reminded me of a feeling I experience when reading Iyanla Vanzant…It is an amazing book and I would encourage women who are open to bettering themselves to read this. It is a truly beautiful (and realistic) depiction of a woman’s journey back to herself and to her God. This book provides a foundation which will encourage you to continue learning and growing long after you have turned the last page”~ Sher, London


“Brilliant writing, Cezanne Poetess writes in a very personal way. You’ll easily be able to identify with any of the characters. From the very first chapter this book is thought provoking and inspiring. I’ll strongly recommend getting the CD of poems and spoken word to complement the book. MUST READ!!!!” ~ Brian Q,  London


“Absolutely Fantastic!!! This book had me captivated from the first few paragraphs. There was so much that I could relate to and found myself reading anxiously wondering what was going to happen next. At the same time, it was answering a few questions I had asked myself. I am looking forward to reading the next chapter and the consecutive chapters. An amazing read.” ~ Sharn, USA    


'Journey of a Sister' is the Second Edition of my previously published novel 'Single, Spiritual...AND Sexual?' (2011), which received many great reviews (read some of them at www.journeyofasister.com/books) I've revised and updated it to include two new chapters, the SEQUEL!  The First Edition was printed on demand, so my artwork was printed in black-and-white, and readers weren't able to benefit from the COLOUR THERAPY in my artwork.  

Your pre-orders will enable me to print 1,000 copies of 'Journey of a Sister' with my artwork in FULL COLOUR, so if you suffer from lack of energy, low motivation, and general SAD feelings because of a lack of natural sunlight, you'll be healing your Self in more ways than one while you read! 
 (Learn how I intuitively healed myself from the symptoms of Seasonal Affective Disorder using the COLOUR THERAPY in my paintings  at: www.journeyofasister.com/art).  Regardless of whether I reach my target you'll still get your books, the difference will be whether they are printed in colour or not!  I only need 200 people to pre-order 'Journey of a Sister' for them to be printed in colour, will you be one of them?
Journey of a Sister's sister-book 'How to Get the Ring On Your Finger'  has contributions from over 30 brothers, and takes an insightful look into how our PAST has affected the way we relate to each other TODAY.  It will help you identify any issues you have that may be preventing you from attracting True Love, and will help you PREPARE to meet your soul mate.  It will then guide you through the whole dating process  by introducing the DIY Arranged Marriage which will help you lay a solid foundation to a lasting relationship!  You can get a signed copy for only £5.00 in this campaign! (ends Thursday)
 My motto is "As I heal myself I heal others, and as I help others I help myself" - so help ME help YOU! 

Paypal, credit or debit cards accepted!

Perks of funding my campaign:

£5: Get a SIGNED paperback of 'How to Get the Ring On Your Finger'!

£10: Get the 'Seeds of Love' CD and its Book of Lyrics (all 13 poems feature in 'Journey of a Sister')

£15: Get a SIGNED paperback of 'Journey of a Sister', with the 'Seeds of Love' CD, PLUS a FREE invite to my official Book Launch on 6th November in Central London! 

£25: Get a SIGNED paperback of 'Journey of a Sister', the 'Seeds of Love' CD and its Book of Lyrics, Plus a free invite to my official Book Launch on 6th November (UK) - and I'll throw in a laminated print of one of my artworks of your choice!

£30 BONUS PACKAGE: Get 'Journey of a Sister', 'How to Get the Ring On Your Finger', the 'Seeds of Love' CD and its Book of Lyrics, a laminated  art print of your choice, PLUS a FREE invite to one of my official Book Launch on 6th November! (Central London)

£49: Get TWO signed copies of Journey of a Sister,  TWO copies of 'How to Get the Ring On Your Finger, and two copies of the 'Seeds of Love' CD (one for you and one for a friend!), PLUS two FREE invites to my official Book Launch on 6th November! (Central London)

£69: Get all 9 artworks featured in my novel as A3 Laminated Prints!

Many thanks in advance, and I look forward to you joining me on 'the journey' of Self-discovery!  

In your service,

​

Other Ways You Can Help me Reach my Goal:

Share this campaign with your friends and family and on social media, and encourage them to pre-order their books!

story:
I’m Will Powell, Founder of Prizecraft Editing. As a English-majoring college student back in ’09-’10, I toyed around with the idea of freelance writing as a part-time job and didn't expect to make any money from it...until I did. Since then, I've used my skills to the benefit for the benefit inexperienced authors with a desire to tell their life story, high school students that wanted to improve their storytelling skills, and aspiring editors who've sought real-world work experience in the difficult writing field. 

By almost anyone's admission, many of the self-published novels found amidst online self-publishing platforms such as Amazon and Smashwords are not of the same quality as traditionally published novels. This isn't because the authors don't have the heart to produce the quality work they and their audience deserve; they simply may not have the means to hire a person capable of tightening up a draft. 

Because all authors deserve to have their brilliant stories published in a flawless state, Prizecraft Editing exists to close the "quality-gap" between traditionally-published novels and self-published novels.  Regardless of an aspiring author's experience level, story idea or budget, we edit drafts to their peak potential or if need be, we will ghostwrite entire novels for our clients.

What We Need

Because Prizecraft's operational overhead is relatively low, $3,000 will go a long way towards reaching our six-month profitability goal and every little bit will help. Specifically, your contribution will:

  • Allow us to establish a small paid internship program which will employ students from high schools and English-major college programs across Southwest Florida.
  • Allow us to supply our interns with Google Chromebooks loaded with licensed copies of Microsoft Word and InDesign.
  • Allow us to market Prizecraft's services at writing club meetings and writer's association meetings across Florida.
  • Allow us to advertise Prizecraft's services online.
  • Allow us to hire qualified freelancers on a per-task basis to assist current staff with only massive editing and ghostwriting tasks.

What You Get

For your contribution, you'll have our eternal gratitude...and of course, some groovy little perks, including:
  • Free ghostwriting for any one piece of writing not exceeding 10,000 words regardless of style or genre (business writing, essays, etc.)
  • Free coaching and critiquing (FOR LIFE!)
Check the 'Perks' column for more information.

Prizecraft's Potential

Prizecraft Editing is a business, but I also see it as a means to do a lot of good for a lot of people. 
As it is, Prizecraft is proud to employ and mentor numerous young aspiring wordsmiths in an urban area and teach them how to make money as writers and editors. With greater funding, we can expand our marketing campaigns and with greater marketing campaigns, we can attract more clients. A greater number of clients will create work opportunities for Prizecraft's interns, and I can even offer to pay their way through university English/Creative Writing programs.

Also, after passing Prizecraft's six-month profitability goal, it is my hope to begin Prizecraft-sponsored full online classes to supplement our videos and blog posts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, thank you for taking the time to view our campaign and you'll help us out a great deal by simply passing this campaign along to others. 

If you're just interested in Prizecraft's services, visit http://prizecraftediting.com.

story:
A true story about one man’s search for glory.

Alex is an ordinary young guy, looking for something to make him extraordinary. Drawn in by the intrigue of adventure, he decides to join the French Foreign Legion. After being posted in French Guiana, South America he soon realises that the Legion is not what he expected it to be and going AWOL in South America plunges him into a spiraling search for elusive glory. Along the way he encounters cultures, underworlds, and the mighty Atlantic Ocean and an answer to his search in ways he would never have dreamed of.

Funding:

Our funding goal of $ 7000.00 will be used to publish the enthralling story which has taken three years to weave together. Alex and the Author have spent endless hours ironing out all the details of this story to ensure the book connects with your sense of adventure.

The funds will be used for the following:

  • Cover design;
  • Proof reading and editing;
  • Layout design;
  • Print; and 
  • Marketing.

We appreciate the support in giving us the ability to share this story with the world.

story:
I’m passionate about writing, whether it is novels, short stories or poems. I specialize in general fiction and spend hours developing the psychology of my characters, crafting the plot as I write, yet letting the story, at times, take me by surprise. I like nothing more than challenging myself with a new theme, weaving in different voices, exploring a particular theme I'm both interested in and slightly scared of, or using a different language. Crafting stories to share with others has not only given me joy, but also strength and confidence in myself. And it has sustained me through challenging times. I've written six novels, five in French, one in English, Heading for the Wall, and I’m two-thirds away through a new one, entitled Not to Hold.

My online portfolio
My blog
My FB page

MY NOVEL

It tells the story of Elspeth, a single, thirty-five-year-old freelance language teacher living in London, and Daniel, ‘Danny’, Ashbaugh, a single, forty-year-old events organiser, also living in London. Each inherit ten million pounds from the same person, a fifty-three-year-old Scottish widow named Sybil Naughty who died in a car accident. Elspeth used to travel with her and is grieving the loss of their powerful and unusual friendship. Danny, who didn't know Sybil existed until receiving a phone call from her solicitor, is increasingly uneasy, especially after discovering that Sybil knew his father. Neither of them are spending the money which, like a magnifying glass highlights their obsessive nature and inability to move forward at this particular point in their lives. While Elspeth goes on a ‘pilgrimage’ across Europe to let Sybil’s many friends know about her death, Danny focuses all of his attention on Elspeth whom, he thinks, is bound to give him the answers he needs.

Read the first chapter (15 pages – 5,396 words)

MY CAMPAIGN

What I miss the most at this point in my writing career, is being able to bounce ideas/discusses passages with and ask questions to an editor. I’ve been honing my skills for years so I am confident in how to edit and restructure my novel, but I want to keep on learning the craft. I believe that every writer needs an editor, and I would love to work with one, hence this campaign.

My aim is therefore to raise £3,500 in order to pay for professional mentoring from Gold Dust Writers’ Mentoring.

Here’s a summary of what Golf Dust Mentoring offers:

Based in the UK, Gold Dust is a unique mentoring scheme for writers, founded by novelist Jill Dawson. An invaluable resource for new and emerging novelists and authors of non-fiction, Gold Dust offers eight hours of face-to-face meetings with an established novelist, biographer or short-story writer, usually taking place over a year. In between meetings the mentor will read your work for a further eight hours, and offer feedback on the writing, as well as an insider’s advice on the publishing world and finding an agent.

The price – £3,000 – reflects the calibre of writers mentoring, and the fact that they work individually with you…. You can ask questions about publishing and agents and the business-side of being a writer or you can concentrate wholly on the writing… We don’t promise publication but we do promise to improve your writing and therefore your chance.

Why am I asking for £3,500 when the Gold Dust fees amount to £3,000?

The extra £500 cover the Paypal/Indigogo fees every time one of you is backing my campaign.

ABOUT ME

I was born in Paris, in 1972,  into a  literary family. Unsurprisingly, I wanted to be a writer from a very early age. I somehow managed to convince myself that I couldn’t – without properly trying, I should add – until I attended a creative writing weekend workshop, in 2008, and realised I had ideas worth writing about. It took several more years and novels to see myself as a fully-fledged writer and I can confidently say that I’ve been making up for lost time ever since, especially as I have also been writing in English since 2014.

I've taken part in 35 competitions and contacted about 40 agents. Despite a couple of very complimentary responses, I failed to get an agent or any useful exposure through a competition. I will spare you the details, but imagine for a second receiving on average three rejections a month for nearly two years and you get the picture. It is only because writing is the air I breathe, my passion, my vocation, that I’ve managed not to lose faith in myself and start a new novel. This campaign is therefore my new attempt to not only work with an editor, but also potentially make useful connections that might lead to the publication of my work.

Other Ways You Can Help

With any amount, big or small, you give me, you will have my eternal gratitude and will receive regular updates on my progress.

Even if you can't contribute, it doesn't mean that you cannot help. You can ask your friends to get the word out and use the Indiegogo share tools to that effect.

Thank you very much!

Caroline

story:
My next book, The Last Flight of the Phoenix was set to come out this summer.  At the last minute I got the news that I have the opportunity to launch my book at this years Phoenix Comicon. (June 2016)  I was able to cover some of the cost, but I now need to come up with about $500 to cover an inventory of books to sell.  

My first Sci-fi/Fantasy Novel premiered two years ago to great reviews and very soft sales.  I just didn't have the money to do a big marketing campaign.  Building a fan base of readers is one of the most difficult things for a writer to do.  So to have the opportunity to meet thousands of Sci-fi and Fantasy fans who are eager to find  new books is something I have to take advantage of.  

My cost is about $6 per book to print and I'll sell them for $9.99.  If I can raise $500 on this campaign I will be able to by around 100 paperback copies to sell. If I sell all of them at the event I will make up most of what I have already spent out of pocket. (event, art and publishing)

Thank you for your support.
story_txt: My next book, The Last Flight of the Phoenix was set to come out this summer.  At the last minute I got the news that I have the opportunity to launch my book at this years Phoenix Comicon. (June 2016)  I was able to cover some of the cost, but I now need to come up with about $500 to cover an inventory of books to sell.  My first Sci-fi/Fantasy Novel premiered two years ago to great reviews and very soft sales.  I just didn't have the money to do a big marketing campaign.  Building a fan base of readers is one of the most difficult things for a writer to do.  So to have the opportunity to meet thousands of Sci-fi and Fantasy fans who are eager to find  new books is something I have to take advantage of.  My cost is about $6 per book to print and I'll sell them for $9.99.  If I can raise $500 on this campaign I will be able to by around 100 paperback copies to sell. If I sell all of them at the event I will make up most of what I have already spent out of pocket. (event, art and publishing)Thank you for your support.

story:
⭑Pick a perk and help me give kids and parents the gift of loving and appreciating each other!
 

" When i was a kid, i would sometimes wish i could switch my dad for another dad. One of those normal ones that is not as crazy as my father. A daddy who wouldn't make stupid jokes, or hug me in the middle of the street. One who wouldn't like  to spend every single second of the day with me playing unpredictable games. One that wouldn’t embarrass me in front of a bunch of people. 

I wanted a different dad.

 A normal one. "

- Dad Exchange 


THE STORY

Lily is an eleven year old girl, who like most kids that age, is tired of her parents. In her case it is her dad, who is an always joking father that embarrasses her in front of her friends and in public. It is all done with a lot of love, but she doesn’t see that. When one day she passes thru town and finds a mysterious new shop where the old bakery used to be, she is curious and surprised. It's a magical shop called the ParentSwap shop, a place where kids can come with their mother or father, describe what kind of parent they've always dreamt of and get a new one straight off the shelf! After her birthday turns into a disaster, she decides it is time to exchange her father, which sets her off on an adventure to find the ‘perfect’ parent….

Dad Exchange is meant for children, but is a really fun read for any age. It teaches us that the grass is not always greener on the other side, and that you can always find flaws with what you have. You just have to learn to love them, cause once they’re gone, you will miss them more than anything and see the real value of what you had.
 

 

 

 

HOW YOUR INVESTMENT WILL BE USED

Your contribution to my book will help cover the publication costs and get my book (written when I was just turning 16) published and delivered into your home!

Publishing costs include professional editing, illustrations, typesetting, high quality printing, basic marketing and shipping. Your copy or copies of the book will go to print no matter what; even if i don't get the full funding i am hoping for. I will make sure that everyone who has contributed receives the book in the highest quality. My book is fully written and edited already by a well known children books editor and illustrations are fully finished and made by a top notch artist.  I aim to produce the finest quality books that the funding collected provides. If the funding exceeds the goal and I can go into offset printing (instead of POD) there will be more copies I will be able to donate . With funding of 9000 Euro I will donate a minimum of 50 books to children’s organisations, libraries and/or needy families. With funding at 12000 Euro, a minimum of 100 books will be donated.

Right now the book is written in English, but if i get 200 copies bought in total from one country (for example Israel, The Netherlands or Spain), I will have the book translated and i will print it so you will get it in your own language, if you wish.
 

WHY I NEED YOU

 

I feel I wrote a truly appealing children’s book from the feedbacks I got so far from all people that were exposed to it, both children and adults, It’s a book written by a teenager for other teenagers and kids, one that children and parents will have fun to read and learn from together.
But to make it happen and publish a book as I learn now, is way more complex than just writing the book. It needs high quality illustrations and a well made design. The look and feel of the book are at least as important as the story, and finally high quality print, which all are expensive and need funding, and that is something that I as a 18 year old cannot provide in advance.

Using richly detailed illustrations, the book SHOWS as much as TELLS the story of Lily and her different fathers that she exchanges in her quest to find the perfect parent, highlighting the special moments in the book.

I also need the help of professional art direction, layout and packaging, in addition to the usual costs of printing, distribution and shipping to create a finished product worthy of multiple readings.

 

Breakdown of budget:

·  9 full-color illustrations

·  Art direction and layout design

·  Cover design

·  Editor and proofreader

·  Printing

·  Book distribution

·  Shipping

·  Basic marketing

·  Indiegogo and Paypal fees
 

In order to fully realize the book as i envision, I will need to raise 9000 Euro at least. I have dedicated nearly two years and my own funds to get this far to make sure it is ready to be published, and I am 100 % determined to take this book to the finish line of publication. 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

 

  • Spread the word. The more people who know about the campaign, the sooner I’ll fulfil  my mission. Please SHARE this campaign with people you know via Facebook, twitter, email or just by picking up the phone and calling them ;)
  • Contribute money to the campaign. Money is needed! Smaller amounts will win my love and gratitude. Larger amounts will get you that, plus some pretty nice perks.
  • Leave a comment here. Please cheer me on or let me know what you think! It may sound silly, but it would really mean a lot.
     

 

 

WHO I AM

My name is Lin Kohen Ytterdal and I am 18 years old.

I was born in Jerusalem in 1998, and moved to Amsterdam when i was 3. There I grew up with quite an alternative lifestyle; we lived in alternative creative spaces, and i went to a Rudolf Steiner school. When i was 13 my parents decided that the normal education system wasn't how they wanted to raise their children, and took me and my brother out of school to fulfill their dream of traveling the world with their kids. At the time, i wasn't all too happy about it, having to leave my friends and normal life behind, but now i am forever grateful for the experience they gave me. For over 4 years i've been able to learn not from a classroom, but from real life and the people i met on the road, giving me the time and freedom to express myself and learn what attracts me with no pressure of society.
When i turned 17 i decided that i wanted to go study Photography and i was accepted as a full time student at the Royal Academy of Art in the Netherlands, and i just  finished my first year successfully. 

Writing this book has been a great journey for me, it has helped me expand my imagination and understand the world of writing and I hope all kids and parents that will be exposed to it will find it a good read, appealing and something to remember.


 

WHY IT WILL BE WONDERFUL IF YOU SUPPORT ME

  1.  I'm only 18, which is quite young for already publishing a book, and I won’t be able to fulfil my dream of publishing this book without your help.

  2.  This book is a great teaching for kids and parents alike, and anyone really, to be happy and appreciate the people around you, especially your family.

  3.  This book has already been fully written, edited by well established American editor, and even the illustrations are now fully finalised , all that is left is just printing so you and many others would be able to fully enjoy it.

  4.  With your contribution i will be able to donate as many books as i can to kids and families that can't afford it. 

Now that you know a bit about me and my book, i hope i have made you curious enough to buy a copy :)
Thank you for helping me bring my book to life and and spreading love and happiness!

And please share my campaign with your friends and FAMILY! <3

 

Much Love,

Lin
