story:
About Memories

This is for the trans women who doubt ourselves, who internalise the lies we're force-fed every day, who once in a while need a break from the fight to be reminded just how true we really are.

This is for the femmes who are chronically reduced, called superficial and shallow and traitorous and reformist and artificial and fake and less good. We run the fucking world, never forget that.

This is for the sexual queers, the gays and lesbians and bisexuals and pansexuals and kinksters and the great swathe of society who do things differently. Our sex is beautiful and powerful, respect it and use it well.

This is for the hard working women who work 5 jobs and 70 hours a week or spend every day searching and trying to answer the impossible question of how much more we can give before we collapse again.

This is for the forest, burned and murdered. For the sea and the sky and the herbs. This is for the clouds of starlings who might still return if we just let them.

This is for us.

* * * 

Imagine you had the ability to move through your own life, to revisit your own past and foresee your own future. Which events would you long to remember and which would you prefer to forget? Would you want to know what the future holds? Would you change it if you could?

This is the story of Ash, a trans woman and healer living in a corner of Europe controlled by a militarized state. Amidst the economic crash of the 2020s, this land, once a diverse centre for immigration and queerness saw the rise of a state-imposed monoculture of gender, sexuality, ability and race. Those that didn’t fit, known as the divergents, were imprisoned, expelled or worse.

Ash and her best friend and herbalist Pinar, long ago escaped the City, left behind their days of fighting State oppression, and are eking out a calmer life in the forest, ravaged by the effects of climate change. One day, Jason, a resistance fighter, arrives abruptly into their life, reigniting personal and political drives and they find themselves drawn back into the fight.

Joining trans and queer organisers, sex workers and other members of a hidden underclass, they risk everything to return to the City and face their oppressors. In this fight for dignity, self-determination and their survival, Ash’s ability to transcend time, a trait that until now she has considered her curse, turns out to be a more powerful weapon than anyone could have imagined.

Excerpt

Having no way to contact each other, their visits were always unplanned, always unexpected and yet somehow Ash and Pinar had never missed each other in the five years since they came to this land.

Ash knew that when she arrived, the kettle would already be boiling or a pot of soup would have just been taken off the fire in anticipation. It was as if somehow, when one of them left their home, the forest and the river themselves passed on the message and beckoned the other to stay at home, to leave the firewood collecting to later, to just sit and wait.

Ash disappeared into the high undergrowth as she walked along a narrow path of stomped-down plants they both maintained just by hiking back and forth every few days. Her back was wet with sweat and brambles scratched her arms, but she loved this walk and hummed quietly to herself.

It was almost completely dark when the path suddenly opened out and beyond her in the forest she could hear a kettle whistling. Not a minute too soon. As she turned the corner, she saw Pinar, sitting outside her home surrounded by candles, her green eyes glistening in the light. As gorgeous as ever, Ash noticed. Pin was only 15 years her younger, but sometimes, despite all that they had been through together, her friend seemed to radiate with youth. Her long hair cascaded over her dark, bare shoulders and she smiled.

“I had a feeling you might turn up today.”

Pinar stood up and waved at a candlelit wooden table and chairs laid out under an old oak. “I'll just get the kettle. Make yourself at home.”

She disappeared inside the little wooden cabin they had built together and soon returned with a tray full of home made snacks, a teapot and a pitcher of water.

“Here we go.” she said, bending to put the tray down on the table. She stood up and turned to hug her friend.

But Ash was gone.

-

Writing Against Invisibilisation

Memories from the Edge is an exploration of exclusion, intimacy and power with the kind of characters who are quietly doing the real work and fighting the big fights but who are chronically invisibilised or at best misrepresented in mainstream media.  The stories of sex workers, trans women, healers and community organizers are almost universally mis-told, our contributions co-opted and our narratives erased.

Having these characters take central stage in a novel is a personal reclamation for me as a person who holds these identities. I am nothing less than stubbornly steadfast in my commitment to see myself and my communities better represented. It’s also a historical amendment: so often it’s been these groups who’ve worked the hardest to bring about real change in the world and I’m excited and honoured to be in a position of letting these stories be heard.

How to be part of this:

$20 will get you an advanced copy of the novel in paperback

$15 will get you an advanced digital download

$10 will get you a copy of my upcoming #QueerEcology zine

Higher sums will get you more perks! (details on the sidebar). Any amount you can send this way will help this project see light.


The costs:

In all we are trying to raise $4000 to cover the following publication costs:

  • $1000 for the editor
  • $1000 for the campaign manager
  • $1000 for printing and postage
  • $500 for cover design
  • $200 for the proof reader
  • $300 for other basic publishing costs

Whatever amount is made at the end of the campaign will be used to pay our brilliant staff first and foremost. Any additional financial commitments made to the creative forces working on this book will be paid out of pocket.

 

Other ways to support

As proud working class femme, I am solidly aware that not everyone is able to contribute in a monetary way.

 

Endless appreciation if you are able to: 

  • spread the word about this indiegogo campaign
  • share my writings from my website
  • Like my Facebook page
  • Join my Fans of Memories from the Edge Facebook Group
  • Follow me on Tumblr

Thank you all so so much for your time!

Wishing you a summer of ease, care and uprising.

Love,

Otter Lieffe

$1000 for the campaign manager
$1000 for printing and postage
$500 for cover design
$200 for the proof reader
$300 for other basic publishing costs

As proud working class femme, I am solidly aware that not everyone is able to contribute in a monetary way. Endless appreciation if you are able to: 

spread the word about this indiegogo campaign

share my writings from my website

Like my Facebook page

Join my Fans of Memories from the Edge Facebook Group
Follow me on Tumblr


Thank you all so so much for your time!
Wishing you a summer of ease, care and uprising.
Love,

story:
LIMINAL is a safe space for women and gender non-conforming writers and creators, a hub for the mixing of budding and accomplished artists and a center for creative community. WE ARE THE ONLY FEMINIST & WOMANIST writing space in the United States.

We exist because there is a huge gap in the literary community, at the local level as well as national level. Women's stories are still not being told as often as men's are being told. Spaces are still not featuring women as frequently as they are men. Women of color, transwomen, and women with disabilities are almost completely absent from mainstream literary culture. We exist because this needs to change.

Since opening in February of 2014, without the aid of start-up funds or investments of any kind, LIMINAL was created and build bit by bit outside of full-time 9-5 jobs, family obligations and the. occasional bit of self-care. Take a look at what we do!

LIMINAL holds seasonal writing workshops with sliding scale options to keep them accessible to a variety of people with different economic backgrounds. The workshops are all taught by local authors and educators. 

We have monthly potluck brunch readings entitled "From All Points But the Center" that feature 4-6 artists.

We have bi-monthly showcases of 10-15 feminist and womanist narrative artists.

Our work-study writers-in-residence keep the space open for co-writing hours and have helped to develop a core group of supportive women writers in the space and continue to support each other in a larger community of writers outside of the space.

We have developed a performance troupe...

and an aerial troupe.

We hold 24-hour writing challenges and write-ins.

We host allied readings with groups of writers and artists that are also marginalized in our society. We showcase local feminist and womanist artists.

We have developed a grant-writing committee to research and apply for more sustainable funding. We have made partnerships in the community that have led to programming in Downtown Oakland planned for the new year. Imagine what we could do if we had some funds!!!

What your donations will help us with:

1. Small improvements to the space that mean big changes in the comfort of the people who inhabit the space

Comfy, back-supporting seating $1400

Mini fridge for milk products to go in coffee and tea (which are always available!) $100

Vacuum $500

Projector $300

Liability Insurance (to keep us safe!) $1000

Aerial Crash Pad (prevent broken selves) $500

 

2. Promotional Materials to help us get the word out to more folks $2000

Seasonal Programs, distribution materials & flyers

3. Personnel 

Work/Study Manager

10 hours a week @ $20/hr for 52 weeks = 10,400

Publicist

10 hours a week @ $20/hr for 52 weeks = 10,400

If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will be used for the above listed categories, with equal percentages of the total raised going to each.

If we exceed our goals, funds will be used to create a sponsored retreat for writers who are working class or living on or below the poverty line. 

LIMINAL needs to be a larger part of the local and national conversation. We can increase our reach, influence and visibility, outreach, and community partnership development with your help.

Oakland is an influential city. It is also a city that is being rapidly developed. As such, supporting this campaign, you are supporting gender equity being a part of the national conversation on arts, artists, business sectors, and city planning and development.

 

The Impact

There are women-owned businesses and the number of these is increasing, however, there are very few businesses that are owned and focus their services on women as a means of empowerment. This model is innovative and brave. It is placing women in the forefront as providers of entertainment, interpersonal services and as the stars of the show. The normalization of such a model would mean a very significant shift in business structure and the perception of women, on a national level.

  • This is a project that makes a difference to all people. Women are a part of everyone's life in the familial sense, the social sense and in the realm of work. There are parts of ourselves, no matter what gender we identify as, that are more "masculine" or more "feminine." By contributing to the success of a business with women at its center, you are supporting the dialogues that are necessary to create a healthier society; one that engages in discussions about gender and gender norms, and their impacts. 
  • Already, we have created a loyal local following and community. The East Oakland Space is all run by people who donate their time to keep the space open, filled with art and populated with people. 
  • LIMINAL has its sights set on other national locations as well as international. With your help, we will continue to build a model that can be replicated in other cities and towns, empowering local communities to come together around the celebration of women's art and entrepreneurship and to create an alternative model to the male-dominated spheres we don't often question or even see clearly as heavily skewed representations.

Risks & Challenges

To make a dream into a reality is a risk. To create something out of nothing is another risk. There is always the chance that a business may not be sustainable, as it may not bring in enough money.  It is a risk to label a business feminist and womanist, as these are titles that still have much stigma around them.

  • I am stubbornly passionate and driven.
  • This business model is not first and foremost about bringing in money, but about creating social change. The money earned only needs to be enough to keep it in existence for a while, while the time can be taken to build strong interpersonal practices and structures. The luxury of a labor of love is that the strength of its core is primary to the quick turn-around of profit. This creates a model for sustainability with the long term in mind. A strong alternate business model can be build and then replicated, which is where greater profits will come in.
  • My near availability (enabled by this campaign) and dedication  to the growing of this space provides me with the ability to continue to create systems that work, to participate in networking events, to create and maintain community around the space. I am already bringing in a deep connection to the local literary scenes, the women-centered groups of Oakland and have been working on securing partnerships with individuals and organizations to make sure that the space will be filled with people, the schedule will be filled with events, workshops, open work times, classes and performances. 
  • The stigma is necessary to create dialogue. Change occurs through communication, understanding and growth. I am ready to deal with stigma, am already dealing with it, and am growing both personally and professionally everyday, in the face of the current state of our society.

Community Partners

Fiscally Sponsored by 

Additional Partnerships: Photos by Joie Rey,  Lil’ Bo Peep, GloriB Buttons, Heirloom Relics, Stephen Texeira Photography, Dreaming Wakefulness Collective and Esoteric Images

Testimonials

"The first time I went to Liminal I had no idea what to expect. And I was amazed: people shared their writing on the most intimate aspects of their lives: sexuality, disability, relationships, bodies, race....And I was privileged to share some of my art there later as well. It's a space where you can be courageous. It's a space to collaborate. It's a space to find people like you, who love beauty and words. It's a space to find people unlike you, who might look talk believe differently but, just like you, are living in some kind of tension and liminal space. This is the kind of space we need!"

-Sheri Park, Artist 

"Many thanks to Gina Goldblatt, Liminal, and all of the wonderful writers I met and spoke with today. Lovely readings and thought-provoking discussions!" - Rochelle Spenser, Writer

"I blame Gina Goldblatt for making me believe I'm a writer at Liminal and not just some random coffee drinker."-Terrilynn Cantlon, Writer

"I had such an amazing time. Lots of love, light and woman power. Thank you! ❤️❤️"-Jenee Darden, Journalist

"Today is my last day as writer in residence at Liminal. It has gone by quickly but I accomplished a few things. My goal was to work on my muse project and shazam, "Be Mused" was written and produced in the space of 33 days. There was that beautiful moment in the sunset with The Heart of The Museand California Writers Club Berkeley. Liminal helped me spread the word about The Bullying Antidotegiveaway and jamming on "Zorgos. But most of all, I appreciated getting to know the feminist, activist community that connects in this low-key space through classes, art shows, and readings. Oh, and the cats..." -Kristen Caven, Writer & Cartoonist

"Liminal writers are amazing." -Margaret Murray, Writer

Liz Green-Instructor at De Anza College, Writer for The Body is Not an Apology, Spoken Word Artist

Lisa Gray-Senior Consultant with CVNL, Instructor at Mills College, Writer

Joy Elan- Writer, Spoken Word Artist and Performer, Educator in Oakland Public Schools

Indira Allegra- textile artist, writer and performer

Other Ways You Can Help

If giving right now is in not in your capacity, you can still help! Pass this along to people, to organizations, to groups that you think might want to support the endeavor. Getting the word out is invaluable and we are grateful for your support in any way you can give it!
story_txt:
LIMINAL is a safe space for women and gender non-conforming writers and creators, a hub for the mixing of budding and accomplished artists and a center for creative community. WE ARE THE ONLY FEMINIST & WOMANIST writing space in the United States.

We exist because there is a huge gap in the literary community, at the local level as well as national level. Women's stories are still not being told as often as men's are being told. Spaces are still not featuring women as frequently as they are men. Women of color, transwomen, and women with disabilities are almost completely absent from mainstream literary culture. We exist because this needs to change.

Since opening in February of 2014, without the aid of start-up funds or investments of any kind, LIMINAL was created and build bit by bit outside of full-time 9-5 jobs, family obligations and the. occasional bit of self-care. Take a look at what we do!

LIMINAL holds seasonal writing workshops with sliding scale options to keep them accessible to a variety of people with different economic backgrounds. The workshops are all taught by local authors and educators. 

We have monthly potluck brunch readings entitled "From All Points But the Center" that feature 4-6 artists.

We have bi-monthly showcases of 10-15 feminist and womanist narrative artists.

Our work-study writers-in-residence keep the space open for co-writing hours and have helped to develop a core group of supportive women writers in the space and continue to support each other in a larger community of writers outside of the space.

We have developed a performance troupe...

and an aerial troupe.

We hold 24-hour writing challenges and write-ins.

We host allied readings with groups of writers and artists that are also marginalized in our society. We showcase local feminist and womanist artists.

We have developed a grant-writing committee to research and apply for more sustainable funding. We have made partnerships in the community that have led to programming in Downtown Oakland planned for the new year. Imagine what we could do if we had some funds!!!

What your donations will help us with:
1. Small improvements to the space that mean big changes in the comfort of the people who inhabit the space

Comfy, back-supporting seating $1400
Mini fridge for milk products to go in coffee and tea (which are always available!) $100
Vacuum $500
Projector $300
Liability Insurance (to keep us safe!) $1000
Aerial Crash Pad (prevent broken selves) $500
 
2. Promotional Materials to help us get the word out to more folks $2000
Seasonal Programs, distribution materials & flyers

3. Personnel 
Work/Study Manager
10 hours a week @ $20/hr for 52 weeks = 10,400
Publicist
10 hours a week @ $20/hr for 52 weeks = 10,400
If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will be used for the above listed categories, with equal percentages of the total raised going to each.
If we exceed our goals, funds will be used to create a sponsored retreat for writers who are working class or living on or below the poverty line. 

LIMINAL needs to be a larger part of the local and national conversation. We can increase our reach, influence and visibility, outreach, and community partnership development with your help.

Oakland is an influential city. It is also a city that is being rapidly developed. As such, supporting this campaign, you are supporting gender equity being a part of the national conversation on arts, artists, business sectors, and city planning and development.
 
The Impact
There are women-owned businesses and the number of these is increasing, however, there are very few businesses that are owned and focus their services on women as a means of empowerment. This model is innovative and brave. It is placing women in the forefront as providers of entertainment, interpersonal services and as the stars of the show. The normalization of such a model would mean a very significant shift in business structure and the perception of women, on a national level.


This is a project that makes a difference to all people. Women are a part of everyone's life in the familial sense, the social sense and in the realm of work. There are parts of ourselves, no matter what gender we identify as, that are more "masculine" or more "feminine." By contributing to the success of a business with women at its center, you are supporting the dialogues that are necessary to create a healthier society; one that engages in discussions about gender and gender norms, and their impacts. 
Already, we have created a loyal local following and community. The East Oakland Space is all run by people who donate their time to keep the space open, filled with art and populated with people. 
LIMINAL has its sights set on other national locations as well as international. With your help, we will continue to build a model that can be replicated in other cities and towns, empowering local communities to come together around the celebration of women's art and entrepreneurship and to create an alternative model to the male-dominated spheres we don't often question or even see clearly as heavily skewed representations.


Risks & Challenges
To make a dream into a reality is a risk. To create something out of nothing is another risk. There is always the chance that a business may not be sustainable, as it may not bring in enough money.  It is a risk to label a business feminist and womanist, as these are titles that still have much stigma around them.

I am stubbornly passionate and driven.
This business model is not first and foremost about bringing in money, but about creating social change. The money earned only needs to be enough to keep it in existence for a while, while the time can be taken to build strong interpersonal practices and structures. The luxury of a labor of love is that the strength of its core is primary to the quick turn-around of profit. This creates a model for sustainability with the long term in mind. A strong alternate business model can be build and then replicated, which is where greater profits will come in.
My near availability (enabled by this campaign) and dedication  to the growing of this space provides me with the ability to continue to create systems that work, to participate in networking events, to create and maintain community around the space. I am already bringing in a deep connection to the local literary scenes, the women-centered groups of Oakland and have been working on securing partnerships with individuals and organizations to make sure that the space will be filled with people, the schedule will be filled with events, workshops, open work times, classes and performances. 
The stigma is necessary to create dialogue. Change occurs through communication, understanding and growth. I am ready to deal with stigma, am already dealing with it, and am growing both personally and professionally everyday, in the face of the current state of our society.

And I was amazed: people shared their writing on the most intimate aspects of their lives: sexuality, disability, relationships, bodies, race....And I was privileged to share some of my art there later as well. It's a space where you can be courageous. It's a space to collaborate. It's a space to find people like you, who love beauty and words. It's a space to find people unlike you, who might look talk believe differently but, just like you, are living in some kind of tension and liminal space. This is the kind of space we need!"

story:
The Zen of Recovery

Twenty-five years ago, The Zen of Recovery forever changed the face of 12-step recovery. The first work to incorporate Asian wisdom traditions with the 12 steps of AA, The Zen of Recovery has stayed in print for 25 years and has been used with great success by thousands seeking wellness on their own terms. Not merely another Zen book, The Zen of Recovery is a wide open self-help program that has benefited people in all sorts of recovery and with all sorts of beliefs or even none at all.

Written out of my own experience as a recovering person who was uncomfortable with the religious and patriarchal aspects of the 12-steps, The Zen of Recovery has given permission to many thousands to become who they really are, freed of dogma and limiting belief systems. My work is about a lot more than simple recovery from an addiction: the aim is nothing less than the recovery of our original, shining human nature and the attainment of our full potential.

The Zen of Recovery is also available in e-book and audio formats and at most bookstores, including Amazon.

The Sequel: Zen Mind, Recovery Heart

Twenty-five years in the making, Zen Mind, Recovery Heart is the worthy successor to The Zen of Recovery and reflects the changes we've all experienced during that time. Written in the same friendly, conversational stye as the first book, the sequel is divided into two parts. The first, Zen Mind, is similar to the first book, composed of essays and reflections on the process of recovery and awakening.

The second part, Recovery Heart, is based upon the hundreds of workshops, talks and retreats I have led throughout the country during the last decades. It contains easy directions for a do-it-yourself workshop including forms of meditation, art, writing, step work, tea ceremony and guided meditations all tailored to be effective in recovery work. The second half also includes contributions from readers of the first book and workshop attendees describing how they pursue recovery based upon The Zen of Recovery. The book is heavily illustrated with my Zen ink paintings and calligraphy.

Your contribution will make Zen Mind, Recovery Heart a reality and help continue the work of saving all beings from suffering. Plus, it's a very cool book! Take it from Mu.

The Author/Artist/Teacher

I entered recovery in 1983 and have had uninterrupted sobriety for 35 years. The same year, I undertook formal Zen training at a Korean-style Zen center and studied under the renowned Zen master Seung Sahn. In 1988, Seung Sahn ordained me as a Dharma teacher, giving me the Buddhist name Jeong Mu Poep Sa, meaning Clear Emptiness Dharma Teacher. These days, I also go by the name "Mu", always reminding me of the goal to which I aspire: to empty myself of ego and grasping and to exist in this world just as it is.

I eventually left the Zen center to become involved with the First Unitarian Universalist Church of Providence where I was mentored by Rev. Tom Ahlburn, a student of Buddhism and friend to those in recovery. The church taught no dogma except that of attaining our human nature and was composed of atheists, secular Jews, pagans, 12-steppers,liberal Christians and LGBTQ members.

It was during my time with Tom that I wrote The Zen of Recovery and changed my life forever, fulfilling the promises of the program. I also wrote and published two more books: Shaving the Inside of Your Skull: Crazy Wisdom for Becoming Who You Really Are and Beat Spirit: The Way of the Beat Writers as a Living Experience. All my previous books were published by Jeremy Tarcher, an imprint of Putnam/Penguin and can be viewed at my Amazon author page. I also contributed articles to magazines such as Yoga Journal and Magical Blend. Playboy magazine, reviewing one of my books, said,"Let Ash drive you sane."

I am also a professional artist and worked for years as an art director, graphic designer and  illustrator. Other experiences include stints as a reporter for weekly and daily newspapers and being a mental health counseler. All my work and teaching is inspired by my life as a creative person who has always sought to embrace and promote counter-cultural values in the hopes of making a better world.  Will you help with the Great Work?

I now live in Northern California where I continue to write, make art, lead study groups, perform spoken word and be available to students seeking to recover their full potential. It is my hope that with the publication of the long-awaited and requested Zen Mind, Recovery Heart, I will be able to return to teaching full-time and help contribute to the creating of the new world we all so desperately seek.

Funding

Your contribution to this project will not only get you a copy of this book, but tons of good karma, as well. Mu guarantees it! My first book has already helped uncounted people get better and in turn, make this world a better place. By helping me publish the sequel, you become my partner in this great work of life and death, self and no-self. You needn't be Buddhist or even in recovery to help out. My books transcend those categories and speak to the larger human experience. We all suffer. We all hurt and have been hurt. We all want to feel better. This is the way to wellness and peace. Will you walk it with me?

I also invite your contributions to this book in the form of a personal testimony of your own path to wholeness based upon the principles of Zen Recovery. If accepted, it will be included in a special chapter of the book. Please contact me for details.

Other ways to help include sharing the project on Facebook, telling friends in meetings and talking about it on social media. Good intentions, mantras and spells are also appreciated!

Perk Delivery

If you order a perk that includes more than just a copy of Zen Mind, Recovery Heart, you will receive the other items before the release date of the new book. In other words, if the package also includes art, The Zen of Recovery or other items, you will receive these around September of 2018, the new book to follow upon publication.

Publication Schedule and Future Plans

We hope to have Zen Mind, Recovery Heart ready to ship to you by May 2019. We plan an initial printing of 500-1000 copies based upon response to this campaign. The funds you contribute will not only pay for the printing of the new book, but also for the establishment of Mysterioso Press and the development of future projects.

Mysterioso Press

  In addition to publishing Zen Mind, Recovery Heart, I hope to publish some more of my work including The Book of Rock & Water, Mu Say!, The 80 Words Oracle Deck and Soul Survival. I'll be looking to publish the work of other writers and artists as well; work that reflects the humanistic and spiritual values of my own work and readers. We need new texts and narratives to make a new world. As in all my teaching, creativity is the main value, believing as I do that the creative force is the movement of the spirit. Any ideas? Get creative!

story:
Summary

     I grew up being a captain of corporate America and spent over a decade of my life working for fortune 500 companies and would have never considered my self a weed person.  That all changed when I was presented with an opportunity to work in the legal weed industry.  I didn't just start out as a bud tender in a shop, but as a bonafide middle and connecting growers/producers with store fronts.  I was a complete outsider and hadn't even smoked weed until I was already working in the industry.  I dropped into the weed industry at a Walter White level instead of starting like a Jesse Pinkman.  

     It was a comedy of errors.  It was a miss adventure.  I gained so much and lost so much.  I also had some inherent flaws in our own legal system, bank system, us postal system, etc revealed to me over the course of the year which were eye opening.  I was stabbed.  I was held up at gun point.  When shit hit the fan I was threatened by people who I thought were friends and almost a new family.  If marijuana was treated like the Alcohol industry or Pharmaceutical Drug industry 95% of all the things I went through might never of happened to me.  This has made me into an activist know that if change happens none of what I went through will happen again to someone else.

     I spent a year trying to find a publisher for my story.  I discovered that my story was so unique that all the literary agents who read the sample chapters told me they loved the story but had no idea how they could or if they could properly represent and sell my story.  So here I am with a completed book, tons of great feed back, and no traditional avenues to pursue to get the book traditionally published.  This is why I am turning to Indiegogo for help. 

     I could throw the book up on Amazon tomorrow and have a digital book out of sale but I want to use this book as a tool for my activism of the industry.  Being able to visit states that have Marijuana votes coming up and hand out books to senators and representatives of those states has far more gravity then giving them a redemption code for Amazon.  Having a book gives me a great tool as an activist.  Over the next 2 years there are 18 states that will have some kind of Marijuana vote.  By raising these funds and publishing this book, I will be able to take my story on the road to these states and become a part of the conversation of legalization in those states and nationwide.  Marijuana legalization means a alternative to opioids, ending harsh imprisonment of non violent offenders with drug charges, an amazing hemp market place that could trump cotton and paper, and many more reason.  I want to be a part of the conversation and this book is the first step.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to sell the first 1000 copies of my book to raise money to fund my activism of the industry and establish my book with a printing company. The book will retail for $15 once its available to the general public but by pre ordering and joining the campaign to publish this book you will get some nice perks and a chance to help support a pro-marijuana activism in this country.  So here are the levels and benefits for supporting the campaign.

$1 - Tier 1 - Keep Me Informed (Unlimited)

Follow this campaign but supporting it.  You will receive updates on this campaign and be notified when its completed and also when the book available to the public.

$15 - Tier 3 - Book Please! (Unlimited)

  • Pre-Order Your Book Today!  Ships when campaign in complete and be one of the first to read this story.
  • You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 1

$20 - Tier 4 - Let's Get Digital (Unlimited)

  • Pre-Order a physical copy of the book plus have a digital copy electronically sent to you the same day your book ships.  Get to read the story even soon and take it with you on any of your portable electronic devices.
  • You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 1

$50 - Tier 5 - Let Me Sign That For You (50 total)

  • You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 4
  • You will receive a signed copy of the book with an inscription from the Author.

$100 - Tier 6 - Nice Shirt, Who Do I Make This Out To? (25 total)

  • You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 4
  • You will receive a signed copy of the book.  You will also with a custom 25 word or less inscription from the Author.  A 5 minute phone call from the Author to help you decide on what your inscription should say.
  • You get a Legit-ish t-shirt in a size of your choosing (Size S,M,L,XL,2XL)
  • You will be thanked by Name or Organization for supporting the campaign on the page of the printed book.

$500 - Tier 7 - I AM LEGIT'ISH (5 total)

  • You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 4
  • You will receive a signed copy of the book.  You will also with a custom 25 word or less inscription from the Author.  
  • A 30 minute phone call/video chat with the Author to help you decide on what your inscription should say and to talk to the Author and discuss the book.
  • You get a Legit-ish t-shirt in a size of your choosing (Size S,M,L,XL,2XL)
  • You get a Legit-ish Hoodie in a size of your choosing (Size S,M,L,XL,2XL).  Super Soft and Limited Edition only 7 hoodies will be commissioned and 2 of them will go to the Author.  A one of a kind (five of a kind) hoodie designed by the Author.
  • You will be thanked by Name or Organization for supporting the campaign on the back cover of the Book.

$5000 - Tier 8 - I Want To Be A Part Of Everything (1 only)

  • You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 7
  • You also get 2% stake in the sale of the book for life.  You are now my business partner and own a stake in the book.  If the book becomes a movie you receive 2% of the sale of a screen play.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with everyone you know.  If you are pro marijuana for any reason spread the and help create a peoples advocate for this industry.
story_txt:
Summary
     I grew up being a captain of corporate America and spent over a decade of my life working for fortune 500 companies and would have never considered my self a weed person.  That all changed when I was presented with an opportunity to work in the legal weed industry.  I didn't just start out as a bud tender in a shop, but as a bonafide middle and connecting growers/producers with store fronts.  I was a complete outsider and hadn't even smoked weed until I was already working in the industry.  I dropped into the weed industry at a Walter White level instead of starting like a Jesse Pinkman.  
     It was a comedy of errors.  It was a miss adventure.  I gained so much and lost so much.  I also had some inherent flaws in our own legal system, bank system, us postal system, etc revealed to me over the course of the year which were eye opening.  I was stabbed.  I was held up at gun point.  When shit hit the fan I was threatened by people who I thought were friends and almost a new family.  If marijuana was treated like the Alcohol industry or Pharmaceutical Drug industry 95% of all the things I went through might never of happened to me.  This has made me into an activist know that if change happens none of what I went through will happen again to someone else.
     I spent a year trying to find a publisher for my story.  I discovered that my story was so unique that all the literary agents who read the sample chapters told me they loved the story but had no idea how they could or if they could properly represent and sell my story.  So here I am with a completed book, tons of great feed back, and no traditional avenues to pursue to get the book traditionally published.  This is why I am turning to Indiegogo for help. 
     I could throw the book up on Amazon tomorrow and have a digital book out of sale but I want to use this book as a tool for my activism of the industry.  Being able to visit states that have Marijuana votes coming up and hand out books to senators and representatives of those states has far more gravity then giving them a redemption code for Amazon.  Having a book gives me a great tool as an activist.  Over the next 2 years there are 18 states that will have some kind of Marijuana vote.  By raising these funds and publishing this book, I will be able to take my story on the road to these states and become a part of the conversation of legalization in those states and nationwide.  Marijuana legalization means a alternative to opioids, ending harsh imprisonment of non violent offenders with drug charges, an amazing hemp market place that could trump cotton and paper, and many more reason.  I want to be a part of the conversation and this book is the first step.

What We Need & What You Get
I need to sell the first 1000 copies of my book to raise money to fund my activism of the industry and establish my book with a printing company. The book will retail for $15 once its available to the general public but by pre ordering and joining the campaign to publish this book you will get some nice perks and a chance to help support a pro-marijuana activism in this country.  So here are the levels and benefits for supporting the campaign.

$15 - Tier 3 - Book Please! (Unlimited)

Pre-Order Your Book Today!  Ships when campaign in complete and be one of the first to read this story.
You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 1

$20 - Tier 4 - Let's Get Digital (Unlimited)

Pre-Order a physical copy of the book plus have a digital copy electronically sent to you the same day your book ships.  Get to read the story even soon and take it with you on any of your portable electronic devices.
You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 1

$50 - Tier 5 - Let Me Sign That For You (50 total)

You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 4
You will receive a signed copy of the book with an inscription from the Author.

$100 - Tier 6 - Nice Shirt, Who Do I Make This Out To? (25 total)

You will also get all the same benefits as Tier 4
You will receive a signed copy of the book.  You will also with a custom 25 word or less inscription from the Author.  A 5 minute phone call from the Author to help you decide on what your inscription should say.
You get a Legit-ish t-shirt in a size of your choosing (Size S,M,L,XL,2XL)
You will be thanked by Name or Organization for supporting the campaign on the page of the printed book.

$500 - Tier 7 - I AM LEGIT'ISH (5 total)

story:
What We Are Making

We're crafting a quarterly magazine, featuring artists from and connected to Oshawa and the Durham Region. Designed to be digestible, approachable and collectible, we'll print short stories, poetry, art, cartoons and export our magazine to cafes, bookstores and comic shops across Ontario. We've got businesses in Guelph, Kingston, Kitchener, Barrie, Newmarket, Peterborough and beyond already excited to provide this publication to their customers.

With the help of Slowcity.ca we aim to connect and support artists, build our community, and promote the amazing work being done in our area.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for donations of $10. For that you will receive the first issue of the magazine, shipped directly to your door. We're also throwing in some surprises. Consider it a loot bag of Durham arts goodies.

Your $10 donation will pay for the printing costs and shipping. Extra funds will be paid to the contributors of the magazine and go to support future issues.

Why

When you think of Oshawa and the Durham Region, what comes to mind? If you're outside looking in, you've heard of our GM Plant. You might know someone who attends Durham College or UOIT. We're the neighbours east of Toronto, an endless sea of suburbs, with a struggling downtown, giant shopping mall and plazas on every corner. You see us on the news when there's a fire or major crime.

But we're also an incubator for incredible art. Perhaps the monotony of cookie-cutter, new development homes breeds a certain need to express oneself. Maybe it's the border on farmlands, forests and water that keeps us connected and longing for escape. There's music here, blasting from the skeletal remains of venues still raising young musicians to support each other, to create and thrive.

And there's artists, writers and poets--a plethora, making unique works with powerful voices and rarely a platform to stand on.

Wunderlit is here to provide that platform.

Perhaps the notion of the "ol'dirty Shwa" will step aside, with readers taking notice of the creativity flourishing here. Perhaps we won't just be the auto factory and bland housing, but a thriving artistic scene that's worth visiting--worth experiencing!

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your continual support. This campaign just scratches the surface, as we're only raising funds for the first issue of Wunderlit. If you like what you read, support us again to see future issues made. We'll shower you with more goodies.

We also need more contributors. If you write, or draw, or paint, go to www.slowcity.ca and contact us. If you know an artist, point them in our direction, we want to show off their work.

story:
Hi, I am D. K. Marley!

I am a historical fiction author and blogger, a graduate of the Writer's Retreat Workshop hosted by founder Gary Provost, and an avid Shakespearean. Through many many years of research, editing, travel trips to England and Stratford-upon-Avon, my novel "Blood and Ink" finally came to fruition. This book is my passion, my heart, and tears, and after indie-publishing to maintain my own voice in the words, I sought to add an Audible production to the ebook and paperback versions.

This brings me to why this campaign is so important to me. Not for myself, but for an incredible actor who reached out to me to narrate "Blood and Ink" for an audiobook production. His name is Jonathan C. Dixon and he has brought the characters from my novel to life in a way I could never have imagined. For years, for nearly 15 years, the characters voices resounded in my own mind, but now they are coming to life in the voice of Jon Dixon.

By contributing to this campaign, you will help support a great actor and a man of outstanding character, as he completes my novel, and hopefully will find more support, gigs, and fans for his amazing skills. The total amount I am seeking here is for his studio time/promotion, I am not seeking any money for myself since, as the author, my own marketing and promotion is on my own shoulders. I want to do this for Jon, and I hope you will support me in this quest. Come on... pay it forward!!

What I Need and Where It Is Going

More detail:

  • Seeking $2000 for studio time for Mr. Dixon to complete the audiobook production.
  • You can donate what you will or you can click a PERK to receive rewards for your donation.
  • Rewards? YES! I am offering signed copies of my novel, along with the completed digital audiobook; plus some promotional swag (t-shirts, jewelry...)
  • All proceeds, (minus minor expenses to assure deliverance of perk rewards and fees to Indiegogo) whether the goal is met or not, will go to Mr. Dixon to cover his costs of studio time and promotion of the audiobook.

Let Me Tell You About Jon.... (by Mark Vine)

 I have known Jon Dixon and have been blessed to call him a good friend, for about twenty-five years.  We used to re-enact the English Civil War period together as part of the English Civil War Society. He was also a superb cricketer in his day and held several local records.  

Jon is the type of person on whom you can rely completely. When the chips are down, he is always the first to offer help as I have found out on more than one occasion. 

He is very self-effacing and really does not know just how talented he is as an actor, a skill which he dabbled in during his early days, but which I saw the potential immediately when putting together the Crabchurch Conspiracy Weekend, which we now jointly run.  

So when I saw the historical author D. K. Marley advertising for someone to narrate her excellent new novel, "Blood and Ink," based on the life of Christopher Marlowe, I knew there was only one man for the job and ‘bullied’ Jon into applying. 

As ever, full of self-doubt, he was chosen out of a field of six or seven other actors to bring the author’s words to life as an audiobook and this crowdfunding exercise is to fund the studio fees of such a project. 

Please give as much as you can and help this lovely man to achieve his considerable potential and hopefully, set him off on a new career path.  

Thank you from Mark Vine!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand, some just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for anything you can do. Show the love and share the love! Pay it forward!!

D. K. Marley, author of "Blood and Ink" and "Prince of Sorrows"

https://www.facebook.com/dkmarley.author

story:
Short Summary

A Fire to Light Our Tongues

Can we find the meaning of life in the words of a group of Texas writers striving to fend off entropy? Yes. No. Maybe. That's up to you, the reader, to decide. Enjoy the journey.

—Joe O'Connell Introduction

Editors: Elizabeth Dell, Donna Walker-Nixon

Contributors

Responses to the Pandemic

Julia Guez LiAundra Grace Naomi Shihab Nye. Octavio Quintanilla,  Robin Bradford , Kevin Prufer Jill Alexander Essbaum

Belief and Doubt

Christian Wiman Robert Okaj Ulf Kirchdorfer, Charles McGregor Octavio Quintanilla Naomi Shihab Nye Diana Lopez Angélique Jamail, Mary Helen Spechtt Tarfia Faizullah

Good and Evil

Chaitali Sen, Al Haley, Octavio Quintanilla, Rich Levy,  Steve Weathers, Leslie Jill Patterson, A.G. Mojtabai, Bruce Bond, John Blaire,  M. M. De Voe, J. Scott Brownlee, Jessica Wilbanks

Love and Hope

Rick Bass  Rich Levy, Octavio Quintanilla, Peter Hoheisel, Monica Macansantos Robin Gara Naomi Shihab Nye, Yvette R. Blaire

Known and Unknown

Owen Egerton, Noel Crook, Chris Ellery, Mark Sanders, Robert Okaji , D. G. Geis, Carol Coffee Reposa, Brian Van Reet, John Fry, Nan Cuba, Robin Davidson

Truth and Beauty

Jim LaVilla-Havelin, Laurence Musgrove, Charles Taylor, Steve Wilson, Naomi Shihab Nye, Gary T. McDonald, Heath Dollar, Robin Davidson

Joy and Gratitude

G. Geis, Greg Brownderville, Norma Elia Cantú, Loretta Diane Walker. Angélique Jamail, Robert Flynn

 

1 Campaign | 

Temple, TX

$6,000 USD

 Flexible Goal

story:
About the author

Already as a kid, Iva showed a great passion for poetry. She was writing about the world around her, and it became her way of expressing emotions that are sometimes difficult to express in any other way. Thankfully, she was encouraged to write by everyone, from school teachers to her family and friends. At the age of sixteen, for the first time, she had the idea to publish the book of poems. Fast forward to 20 years later - she lived in three different countries, worked in over 15 companies, met over 500 people and had at least 10 failures and six times more episodes of pure happiness, Iva decided now is the damn time to publish the poems. 

 

How can you support my project?

Here is the deal - to successfully publish 200 examples of my book through Blurb platform, I need 3,000 euros. Unfortunately, the full amount of the print costs is too high for me to pay it on my own. 

Here is the breakdown of the costs: 

  • Print costs: 2 800 euros
  • Additional costs (design, marketing, delivery): 200 euros

 

Perks of pre-ordering

Now, the best part! By pre-ordering a signed edition, you will receive a personally signed copy of my book with a surprise gift! 

 

Why do I want to publish my book? 

My poems often come from a very dark place, those moments when I felt lonely, sad, or anxious. By diving deeper into those difficult emotions, I realise how much strength I get from my vulnerability. This 2020 has been and still is very challenging, and I feel such an influx of negative things impacts humanity immensely.

Because of this,  now is the right time to share my writings with the world in the hope people can find a little bit of consolation and strength by reading my poems. 

 

 

If you can't donate or preorder my book, there are other ways you can help...

In case you can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help, for example, you can share my campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and community!

Follow me on IG if you want to read some of my poetry! 

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
*(Hello there, if you would like to receive the gifts that are available please make sure to use the PERK options- clicking "Back it" doesn't provide an option to send me your shipping address! Thank you so much!)*

 

My name is Norm Coleman. I was an award-winning photographer for 30 years and owned a photography business, and 3 other businesses. Then I became an actor and travelled the USA for 14 years performing a one-man show I wrote:  “The Life and Times of Ty Cobb”.

Feel free to visit my website at: www.ncoleman.info

I recently published a book about the famous Baseball player Ty (The Georgia Peach) Cobb. I am now nearing completion on my upcoming children's baseball book, “Mascots In Baseball”.

I need to raise money to publish my book. I work with many MiLB teams and intend to contact many friends on the teams in addition to many other personal friends and clients in and out of baseball in order to distribute the book.  I want to entertain the children who will  read the book, and teach them about baseball and the mascots involved.

If contributors have a child, niece, nephew or grandchild, the generous contributor’s  gift copy of the book would bring joy to the children they love. If they don't have family, they could donate the book to homes that care for children or to somebody they may know that has a love for baseball!

I need about $4,000 to publish “Mascots In Baseball”- A children's book, ages 4-24. This book is made for children, adults & baseball fans. 73 baseball teams led by Team Presidents & General Managers have sent me photos & bios of their mascots. I am licensed by MiLB in St. Petersburg, FL. If I don't reach my goal, I will borrow from my family to make up the difference.

Anyone who has a dream, be it writing a book or opening a business, runs the risk of failure or success. Success is not solely a matter of luck- you also need passion, hard work, and thoughtful design.  I opened a photography studio with no knowledge of running a studio but eventually became an award-winning photographer and a success. I never acted a day in my life but with a good director and dedication, I found lasting success on stage with my one man show, at age 67. I had never written a book but successfully published one after 3 years of writing, hard work and dedication. 

With belief in my abilities and help from the Lord, I succeeded.

For those who are unable to contribute, please tell your friends, neighbors, or relatives about the book.
story_txt: *(Hello there, if you would like to receive the gifts that are available please make sure to use the PERK options- clicking "Back it" doesn't provide an option to send me your shipping address! Thank you so much!)* My name is Norm Coleman. I was an award-winning photographer for 30 years and owned a photography business, and 3 other businesses. Then I became an actor and travelled the USA for 14 years performing a one-man show I wrote:  “The Life and Times of Ty Cobb”.Feel free to visit my website at: www.ncoleman.infoI recently published a book about the famous Baseball player Ty (The Georgia Peach) Cobb. I am now nearing completion on my upcoming children's baseball book, “Mascots In Baseball”.I need to raise money to publish my book. I work with many MiLB teams and intend to contact many friends on the teams in addition to many other personal friends and clients in and out of baseball in order to distribute the book.  I want to entertain the children who will  read the book, and teach them about baseball and the mascots involved.If contributors have a child, niece, nephew or grandchild, the generous contributor’s  gift copy of the book would bring joy to the children they love. If they don't have family, they could donate the book to homes that care for children or to somebody they may know that has a love for baseball!I need about $4,000 to publish “Mascots In Baseball”- A children's book, ages 4-24. This book is made for children, adults & baseball fans. 73 baseball teams led by Team Presidents & General Managers have sent me photos & bios of their mascots. I am licensed by MiLB in St. Petersburg, FL. If I don't reach my goal, I will borrow from my family to make up the difference.Anyone who has a dream, be it writing a book or opening a business, runs the risk of failure or success. Success is not solely a matter of luck- you also need passion, hard work, and thoughtful design.  I opened a photography studio with no knowledge of running a studio but eventually became an award-winning photographer and a success. I never acted a day in my life but with a good director and dedication, I found lasting success on stage with my one man show, at age 67. I had never written a book but successfully published one after 3 years of writing, hard work and dedication. With belief in my abilities and help from the Lord, I succeeded.For those who are unable to contribute, please tell your friends, neighbors, or relatives about the book.

story:
The Secret Indian Restaurant

Discover the secrets of super quick and fresh ‘Indian restaurant’ style food...

Overview

There’s nothing more addictive or satisfying than eating your favourite curry, but Indian food cooked at home never seems to quite reach your expectations, and there’s a good reason for this....Indian restaurants and takeaways all over the world have closely guarded secrets - that is until now!

Being able to replicate and in some cases improve on your favourite curry house classics is only a dream for most, but armed with the correct information its easier than you think.

This book aims to breakdown and simplify what initially feels like a daunting task by explaining how restaurants and takeaways can produce stunning classics in what seems like an impossibly consistent and speedy fashion.

Learn how to cook the familiar classics, some hidden menu gems and all the exciting starters, sides and treats which will blow you away. Not only that, your family and friends will think you ordered a takeaway...my challenge to you is to cook and serve a restaurant and takeaway standard meal for friends or family, and wait for the compliments before breaking the news, that you made it!

Why and why now?

Given the world situation with restaurants closing and restrictions and no end in sight, more and more people are looking to cook interesting, fresh, new foods at home.

Restaurant style curries are a hidden secret which many people would love to uncover and with home cooking on the rise - now is the time to to learn the secrets of your favourite curry...I for one have enjoyed the unexpected time I’ve had to experiment and explore in more depth the great recipes I've learnt and cooked for over 30 years.

About The Author

Brought up in Yorkshire (north of England) and living in the Midlands (the birthplace of the Balti and the location of the famous Balti triangle) for several years, as well as training as a chef and running my own restaurants around the world, I have a unique insight into the passionate world of Indian restaurant cooking (know as BIR in the UK - British Indian Restaurant).

Living in Leeds, Bradford and Birmingham for over 25 years, I was naturally introduced to a plethora of different Indian restaurants from a young age. Bradford and Birmingham in particular has a large Asian community and naturally a vibrant Indian Restaurant scene to accompany...I’ve been in them all; Michelin starred curry house, 5 star hotel Indian restaurants, right down to the rough and ready places where I’ve eaten with the staff after hours at 3am.

As a trained chef you often get addicted to finding out everything you can about certain types of food, and also trying to get as close to the original as possible....for me this happened with curry, but unsurprisingly I first gravitated to old authentic Indian cookbooks, and whilst these are great and you feel like you may be understanding the traditional cooking techniques and flavors, this simply wasn’t the type of curry I was experiencing in any of the curry houses around the world - these are something else...and it's this that now has my undivided attention, and is my current fanatical obsession...the Indian Restaurant Curry.

I want to share this amazing food with all of you right now...

What sets this book apart?

In short; simplicity, layout, nutritional information, and the recipes are crafted by a restaurant chef. All this means important factors regrading layers of flavour are as important as the look of the dish.

Each dish has been developed over a long period of time and tested by cooks of all levels, from novices, students, all the way upto Indian Restaurant chefs which means I have been able to write and present each recipe in such a way that all levels can cook each dish easily and quickly.

Simplicity

The recipe directions (method) are short and to the point (actually bullet points) and the ingredients are grouped together (i.e. dry spices, wet ingredients, etc) in such a way that as much as possible ingredients can be pre mixed or prepared so they are added to the cooking method in one step. For example, a dish which uses 12-15 dry spices in varying quantities, can be pre-measured and readied (Mise en place) in a container, ready to be added at the correct time, in one addition.

Layout

All ingredients are in bold in the short method steps which means they can be navigated quickly and easily, even during the short cooking period. Each dish will also have a quick reference for heat, and a QR code if a video is available to accompany it. Also, to make it even easier for the reader, each recipe will have the quantities for 1, 2 and 4 people (many ingredients do not factor up so it’s important to show how to cook for more people) - this is also unique to this BIR style book.

Nutritional

Each recipe has diet and nutritional information, so people following a Keto, Vegan or vegetarian diet can see immediately which ones are suitable or how to adapt the recipe to suit them. No other BIR style Indian cookbook has this information.

Crafted

Each recipe is developed from a base recipe, which generally comes from traditional cookbooks (to gain knowledge of the original origins of each dish and the methods used), and then research follows the modernisation and adaptation of the dishes in the current restaurant setting. Once the ingredients and basic tastes are established, each recipe is remodelled using a chef’s knowledge to maximise the subtleties and layers of the sauce, and then placed in the framework of the style of cooking. Next step is to simplify the dish to a point that makes cooking it, quick, easy, and enjoyable without compromising the taste and presentation of the final product. 

Book feel

The book will have beautiful full colour pictures for each dish, as well as using photos in the cooking steps to reassure the reader they are achieving the right results. The feel will be modern and premium. The best food photographers and cookbook designers will work their magic to form a beautiful feeling book.

Chapter Description/Outline

As the techniques for cooking restaurant style food will be new to most people (although actually very simple), the first 25% of the book will be dedicated to explaining about how to use the book, techniques and equipment - all of which will focus on simplicity so as not to confuse or overwhelm the reader and be accompanied by lots of beautiful instructional photos.

Foreword

Introduction

Why this style of cooking is fantastic, how its cheaper, fresher, and healthier than you think. A look inside a professional kitchen and what we can learn from it and use at home. History of Indian Restaurant style cooking and its history in the UK and around the world.

Health & Safety

How to safely cook, store and use the methods and ingredients. How to quickly chop and prepare different ingredients safely using things like graters or food processors rather than knives, just like the restaurants.

Equipment

What is needed, how to use it, what to buy (i.e. what is essential). From basic home oven to how to build and use a Tandoor oven in your own garden. Techniques for BBQ use and stove top cooking to achieve the restaurant quality and feel you crave.

Ingredients

What to buy, where from and how to store and use. What ingredients go in each curry (to highlight how few ingredients are needed) for quick reference, plus restaurant hacks and shortcuts used in the industry.

Using this book

How to use ‘mis en place’, how to use each recipe, how and when to use the techniques, and explanation of the overall method used in all the recipes. The recipes will not have more than 10 steps (often less), all written in a short, to the point, easy to read (even during cooking) style.

Pre-prepared Ingredients

Your house Garam Masala, base gravies, pastes, precooked meats and sauces

Starters

10-15 popular starters you would expect to find in Indian restaurants all around the world, made from scratch

eg. Chicken Pakora, Onion Bhaji, Samosa, Prawn Puri, seekh kebab,

Curries

40+ recipes tested and ready to print

e.g. Chicken Tikka Masala, Korma, Madras, Biriani, Lamb Pasanda, Goat staff curry, Chicken 65, Butter Chicken, Vindaloo, Ceylon, Mango Chicken Chutney, etc.

Side Dishes

All the favorites including breads, rice, and Dal

e.g. Naan (3 different techniques to achieve restaurant style Naan at home), perfect Pilar rice, Roti, Paratha, Poppadom, Tadka Dal, Bombay Potatoes, etc.

Dips, Chutneys and Drinks

Raita, Onion Tomato salsa, Mango Chutney, Brinjal, Blooming Indian Onion, Madras Coffee, Lassi, Masala Tea, Bombay mix, etc.

Fusion dishes

Kolkata Fried Chicken (Indian KFC), Tikka Hog Roast, Indian Christmas/Thanksgiving Turkey, Whole Tandoori fish, Keema Pie, Mumbai Pork Pie, Indian dry-roasted peanuts, Indian Pork Scratching’s, etc.

Risks and challenges

The risks are low - publishers, book design and photography is all in place and recipes are written....if we achieve the funding the book will happen in the middle of 2021.

story:
In 80 Tagen um das Reich: Eine europäische Reise

 

„Gruß aus Nimmersatt und Immersatt, wo das Deutsche Reich ein Ende hat“, hieß es um 1900 auf einer Grußpostkarte aus dem nördlichsten Ort des Deutschen Kaiserreichs. Der Flecken Nemerzatė liegt heute in Litauen. Von Nimmersatt im einstigen Memelland (oder Klein-Litauen) führt die Reise im Uhrzeigersinn entlang der Grenze und durch die grenznahen Räume des ehemaligen Deutschen Kaiserreiches. Gut 5.000 Kilometer legt der Autor per Rad zurück. In 80 Tagen umrundet er den ersten deutschen Nationalstaat von 1871. Diese europäische Deutschlandreise führt durch ehemalige Grenzlande, heute Teile Litauens, Russlands, Polens, Frankreichs, Belgiens und Dänemarks. Gestreift und überquert werden die noch aktuellen Grenzen zu Österreich, Tschechien, zur Schweiz, zu Luxemburg und zu den Niederlanden. Spurensuche auf einer Reise durch Gegenwart und Geschichte. Orte der Erinnerung, Landmarken des Historischen und persönliche Begegnungen erzählen von der längst vergangenen Zeit, der Gegenwart und den Spiegelungen des Vergangenen in der Gegenwart. Die historische road and bike „novel“ wirft in „dichter Beschreibung“ einen Blick von den Rä(n)dern her auf den einst machtvollen Staat und seine Gesellschaft. Säume und Zwischenräume werden ausgeleuchtet, in denen sich im Kleinen immer wieder das Typische des Großen zeigt. Auf der – nicht direkten, sondern gegenläufigen – Strecke von Nimmersatt nach Nidden, dem Zielort auf der Kurischen Nehrung, findet sich Bedeutendes neben Alltäglichem, oft Merkwürdiges, immer jedoch Besonderes. So entsteht das Mosaik einer - nicht nur deutschen - Grenz- und Gesamtgeschichte, die unvermittelt und beiläufig zu einem europäischen Porträt des Hier und Jetzt wird.

 

Reiseroute und Themenstopps (erste Etappe)

Die erste Etappe, die Teststrecke, führte im Oktober 2020 von Nemerzatė/Nimmersatt in Litauen nach  Ełk/Lyck im polnischen Masuren. Außerdem noch entlang der Teilstrecke Toruń/Thorn - Poznań/Posen. Die Grenze zwischen Litauen bzw. Polen und der Oblast Kaliningrad war aufgrund der Corona-Pandemie und den damit verbundenen Grenzschließungen leider nicht auf legalem Weg passierbar. Einige Orte auf jener Seite der Grenze werden daher im Frühsommer angesteuert, wenn die Tour wiederum in dieser Gegend Europas endet.

Die weiteren vier bis fünf Etappen (ca. 4.400 Kilometer) werden im Frühjahr und Frühsommer 2021 absolviert, vermutlich von Mitte/Ende März an.

 

Erzählerischer Zugang

Tour und Erzählungen werden nicht rein historisch sein, auch wenn die historische Grenze des Deutschen Kaiserreichs den Routenverlauf vorgibt. Die Reise und die Reiseerzählungen leben von den Bildern sowie den Gesprächen und Interviews am Rande des Weges, seien sie zufällig, spontan oder vorbereitet. Ein erzählerischer Ausgangspunkt sind mögliche Erinnerungsorte von Geschichte und Gegenwart. Die Ortsbeschreibungen und -erkundungen folgen einer jeweils ähnlichen Dramaturgie. Der erzählerische Dreh- und Angelpunkt ist die Frage nach Kontinuitäten und Wandel. Was ist von der Geschichte des Deutschen Kaiserreichs an dessen ehemaligen Grenzen noch sicht- und vernehmbar? Was ist verschwunden und vergessen? Was wurde wie überschrieben? Wie sehen - im doppelten Sinn - geteilte Blicke und Erinnerungen auf die durchaus umstrittene Epoche aus. Was kennzeichnet das Hier und Heute?

 

Was motiviert mich zu der Reise und dem Vorhaben?

Ja, am 18. Januar 2021 jährt sich die Gründung des Deutschen Kaiserreichs zum 150. Mal. Das ist ein schöner und gefälliger äußerer Anlass, nicht mehr, nicht weniger. Das „ritualisierte Abarbeiten von runden Zahlen“ (Gustav Seibt) langt nicht als Motivation, auch und gerade nicht, wenn man Historiker ist. Es muss etwas anderes, etwas Tieferes geben, solch ein Vorhaben umsetzen zu wollen. Mir fallen mindestens sieben Gründe ein, die teils biographischer, teils politischer Natur sind. Fangen wir mit den politischen an:

1. Es lohnt sich, kritisch über Nation, Nationalstaat und Nationalismus nachzudenken. Die Nation ist - Europäisierung hin, Globalisierung her - nach wie vor die zentrale Ordnungsstruktur, nach der sich der politische Raum gliedert. Man mag anderes wünschen, die reale Welt ist so.

2. Seit der Neugründung eines deutschen Nationalstaats 1990 hat ein neues Nachdenken über die deutsche Nation und die internationale Verantwortung Deutschlands eingesetzt, auch mit dem Blick in den historischen Spiegel. Zu diesem Spiegelblick gehören die Auseinandersetzung mit dem Nationalsozialismus, dem Holocaust, aber auch der Gründung und dem Scheitern des ersten deutschen Nationalstaats. Um es sinngemäß mit Helmut Schmidt zu sagen: Um die Gegenwart politisch zu verstehen und politisch verantwortlich zu handeln, braucht es eine vertiefte Kenntnis der deutschen und europäischen Geschichte. 

3. Nachdenken über die nationalen Grenzen, heißt auch Nachdenken über die Grenzen des Nationalen sowie über Minderheiten und deren gleichberechtigte Anerkennung. Die Zeit des Dt. Kaiserreichs und die damaligen Grenzen liefern dafür reiches, meist negatives  Anschauungsmaterial.

 

Die persönlichen Gründe sind teils mit den politischen verwoben:

4. Ich bin familiär und biographisch ein Kind der Grenze: aufgewachsen im äußersten Nordwesten der Bundesrepublik, nicht allzu weit von der niederländischen Grenze entfernt, die väterliche Familie mit Wurzeln in Ostpreußen, einer Grenzegion. Zivildienst und Studium in Freiburg. Von dort sind es weniger als 30 km bis man in Frankreich ist.

5. Von Studentenzeiten an bis heute haben mich Fragen ethnischer und Migrationsminderheiten in Europa (und darüber hinaus) beschäftigt. Dazu gibt es eine Reihe von Publikationen aus eigener Feder...

6. Ich bin quasi mit dem Fahrradsattel unter dem Hintern auf die Welt gekommen. In der Region, in der ich aufwuchs, dem Ammerland in Niedersachsen, war und ist das Rad kein Sportgerät, sondern in erster Linie ein Fortbewegungs- und Transportmittel. Dieser regionalen Prägung bin ich auch als Wahl-Berliner treu geblieben.

7. Ich habe, seit ich 17 war, zahlreiche nationale und internationale Radtouren unternommen, allein wie auch mit Freundinnen und Freunden. Die Initiation erfolgte im Sommer 1984 mit einer Tour durch Südengland. Es folgten Marokko, Polen, Schweden, Rumänien, Frankreich, die Niederlande, Luxemburg usw.

 

Ein Buch als Ergebnis

Die Radtour entlang historischer Strecke bildet die Basis für ein Buch, das 2021/22 erscheinen soll. Auf dem Weg dahin wird auf der Reise ein elektronisches Reisetagebuch geführt: ein Blog mit der Route und den Themen bzw. Titeln der Reiseberichte (ohne Texte oder Bilder) sowie einem Instagram-Account mit Fotos und kurzen Texten. Für Unterstützer/innen der Kampagne gibt es darüber hinaus im privaten Mailing für jeden Reisetag exklusiv ein bis zwei längere Text-Bild-Kollagen, die nicht öffentlich zugänglich sind.

 

Fundraising durch Crowdfunding

Eingebunden ist das Projekt in eine begleitende Fundraising-Kampagne. Ziel der Spendenkampagne ist es, für jeden gefahrenen Kilometer einen Euro einzuwerben, also insgesamt 5.000 Euro. Unterstützer/innen bekommen folgende Gegenleistung geboten:

 

1. € 5-Unterstützung: Teilhabe an den Tagesberichten (digitales Reisetagebuch als Text-Bild-Kollage).

2. € 50-Unterstützung: zusätzlich ein vom Autor signiertes Buch.

3. € 100-Unterstützung: zusätzlich Einladung zu Vortrag und Lesung mit dem Autor bei Essen und Trinken.

 

P.S.: Auf dem Standbild des Filmes springt mir quasi aus dem Kopf ein Foto, das nicht mich zeigt. Hier sieht man meinen Freund Boris Moshkovits, dem ich die Idee zu der Crowdfunding-Kampagne verdanke und auf dessen Youtube-Kanal der Film installiert ist. Boris hatte  wesentlichen Anteil an der inhaltlich-technischen Umsetzung dieser Seite und der Kampagne. Dankeschön noch einmal dafür!
