Die erste Etappe, die Teststrecke, führte im Oktober 2020 von Nemerzatė/Nimmersatt in Litauen nach  Ełk/Lyck im polnischen Masuren. Außerdem noch entlang der Teilstrecke Toruń/Thorn - Poznań/Posen. Die Grenze zwischen Litauen bzw. Polen und der Oblast Kaliningrad war aufgrund der Corona-Pandemie und den damit verbundenen Grenzschließungen leider nicht auf legalem Weg passierbar. Einige Orte auf jener Seite der Grenze werden daher im Frühsommer angesteuert, wenn die Tour wiederum in dieser Gegend Europas endet.
Die weiteren vier bis fünf Etappen (ca. 4.400 Kilometer) werden im Frühjahr und Frühsommer 2021 absolviert, vermutlich von Mitte/Ende März an.
 
Erzählerischer Zugang
Tour und Erzählungen werden nicht rein historisch sein, auch wenn die historische Grenze des Deutschen Kaiserreichs den Routenverlauf vorgibt. Die Reise und die Reiseerzählungen leben von den Bildern sowie den Gesprächen und Interviews am Rande des Weges, seien sie zufällig, spontan oder vorbereitet. Ein erzählerischer Ausgangspunkt sind mögliche Erinnerungsorte von Geschichte und Gegenwart. Die Ortsbeschreibungen und -erkundungen folgen einer jeweils ähnlichen Dramaturgie. Der erzählerische Dreh- und Angelpunkt ist die Frage nach Kontinuitäten und Wandel. Was ist von der Geschichte des Deutschen Kaiserreichs an dessen ehemaligen Grenzen noch sicht- und vernehmbar? Was ist verschwunden und vergessen? Was wurde wie überschrieben? Wie sehen - im doppelten Sinn - geteilte Blicke und Erinnerungen auf die durchaus umstrittene Epoche aus. Was kennzeichnet das Hier und Heute?
 
Was motiviert mich zu der Reise und dem Vorhaben?
Ja, am 18. Januar 2021 jährt sich die Gründung des Deutschen Kaiserreichs zum 150. Mal. Das ist ein schöner und gefälliger äußerer Anlass, nicht mehr, nicht weniger. Das „ritualisierte Abarbeiten von runden Zahlen“ (Gustav Seibt) langt nicht als Motivation, auch und gerade nicht, wenn man Historiker ist. Es muss etwas anderes, etwas Tieferes geben, solch ein Vorhaben umsetzen zu wollen. Mir fallen mindestens sieben Gründe ein, die teils biographischer, teils politischer Natur sind. Fangen wir mit den politischen an:
1. Es lohnt sich, kritisch über Nation, Nationalstaat und Nationalismus nachzudenken. Die Nation ist - Europäisierung hin, Globalisierung her - nach wie vor die zentrale Ordnungsstruktur, nach der sich der politische Raum gliedert. Man mag anderes wünschen, die reale Welt ist so.
2. Seit der Neugründung eines deutschen Nationalstaats 1990 hat ein neues Nachdenken über die deutsche Nation und die internationale Verantwortung Deutschlands eingesetzt, auch mit dem Blick in den historischen Spiegel. Zu diesem Spiegelblick gehören die Auseinandersetzung mit dem Nationalsozialismus, dem Holocaust, aber auch der Gründung und dem Scheitern des ersten deutschen Nationalstaats. Um es sinngemäß mit Helmut Schmidt zu sagen: Um die Gegenwart politisch zu verstehen und politisch verantwortlich zu handeln, braucht es eine vertiefte Kenntnis der deutschen und europäischen Geschichte. 
3. Nachdenken über die nationalen Grenzen, heißt auch Nachdenken über die Grenzen des Nationalen sowie über Minderheiten und deren gleichberechtigte Anerkennung. Die Zeit des Dt. Kaiserreichs und die damaligen Grenzen liefern dafür reiches, meist negatives  Anschauungsmaterial.
 
Die persönlichen Gründe sind teils mit den politischen verwoben:
4. Ich bin familiär und biographisch ein Kind der Grenze: aufgewachsen im äußersten Nordwesten der Bundesrepublik, nicht allzu weit von der niederländischen Grenze entfernt, die väterliche Familie mit Wurzeln in Ostpreußen, einer Grenzegion. Zivildienst und Studium in Freiburg. Von dort sind es weniger als 30 km bis man in Frankreich ist.
5. Von Studentenzeiten an bis heute haben mich Fragen ethnischer und Migrationsminderheiten in Europa (und darüber hinaus) beschäftigt. Dazu gibt es eine Reihe von Publikationen aus eigener Feder...
6. Ich bin quasi mit dem Fahrradsattel unter dem Hintern auf die Welt gekommen. In der Region, in der ich aufwuchs, dem Ammerland in Niedersachsen, war und ist das Rad kein Sportgerät, sondern in erster Linie ein Fortbewegungs- und Transportmittel. Dieser regionalen Prägung bin ich auch als Wahl-Berliner treu geblieben.
7. Ich habe, seit ich 17 war, zahlreiche nationale und internationale Radtouren unternommen, allein wie auch mit Freundinnen und Freunden. Die Initiation erfolgte im Sommer 1984 mit einer Tour durch Südengland. Es folgten Marokko, Polen, Schweden, Rumänien, Frankreich, die Niederlande, Luxemburg usw.
 
Ein Buch als Ergebnis
Die Radtour entlang historischer Strecke bildet die Basis für ein Buch, das 2021/22 erscheinen soll. Auf dem Weg dahin wird auf der Reise ein elektronisches Reisetagebuch geführt: ein Blog mit der Route und den Themen bzw. Titeln der Reiseberichte (ohne Texte oder Bilder) sowie einem Instagram-Account mit Fotos und kurzen Texten. Für Unterstützer/innen der Kampagne gibt es darüber hinaus im privaten Mailing für jeden Reisetag exklusiv ein bis zwei längere Text-Bild-Kollagen, die nicht öffentlich zugänglich sind.
 
Fundraising durch Crowdfunding
Eingebunden ist das Projekt in eine begleitende Fundraising-Kampagne. Ziel der Spendenkampagne ist es, für jeden gefahrenen Kilometer einen Euro einzuwerben, also insgesamt 5.000 Euro. Unterstützer/innen bekommen folgende Gegenleistung geboten:
 
1. € 5-Unterstützung: Teilhabe an den Tagesberichten (digitales Reisetagebuch als Text-Bild-Kollage).
2. € 50-Unterstützung: zusätzlich ein vom Autor signiertes Buch.
3. € 100-Unterstützung: zusätzlich Einladung zu Vortrag und Lesung mit dem Autor bei Essen und Trinken.
 
P.S.: Auf dem Standbild des Filmes springt mir quasi aus dem Kopf ein Foto, das nicht mich zeigt. Hier sieht man meinen Freund Boris Moshkovits, dem ich die Idee zu der Crowdfunding-Kampagne verdanke und auf dessen Youtube-Kanal der Film installiert ist. Boris hatte  wesentlichen Anteil an der inhaltlich-technischen Umsetzung dieser Seite und der Kampagne. Dankeschön noch einmal dafür!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi. My name is Dr. Emily Stammitti-Campbell, and I'm working toward publishing the first of a series of children's educational books, centered around underwater archaeology and a set of lovable animal friends. 

This story and the need for this type of children's book emerged as a result of work that I did as the resident scientist at natural history museum. I realised the extent to which most people I spoke with had no idea what an underwater archaeologist did, why I would do it, or how they could get their kids involved... Otter & Red was born!

On addition to being a niche subject that I hope to make accessible to kids everywhere, regardless of access to the shore or the money to scuba dive, our oceans are under increasing threats from overfishing and global warming to the dredging activities that threaten archaeological heritage.  If we don't start getting our young people to think critically about all aspects of our oceans and waterways, there won't be much left in them by the time I'm reading stories to my grandchildren. 

Bringing Otter & Red to life will be the culmination of a life of art, design, history, diving, volunteer work, educational programme development... so many things! But ultimately, it's about bringing a great subject to kids everywhere in a way that's entertaining, accessible and educational.  Otter & Red will be the first children's book focused on underwater archaeology, and I think that for a lot of kids, it will be a real eye opener into a world they never knew existed. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

£ 2046 is the total amount I'm trying to raise to get Otter & Red published in hard form (soft cover, not hard back).

Here is the approximate breakdown of the where the funds are going, with discrepancies for the amount of tax and fees deducted by IndieGoGo. 

Hard copies: £250

Book posters: £170

Shipping costs: £225

Marketing: £400 

Book festival fees: £200 

Postcard production: £30 

Mailing tubes: £35 

Licensing costs: £150 

Digital production: £200 

Labour & processing (ink, paper, etc): £200 

IndieGoGo Fees (approximate): £186  

If the entirety of funds is not raised, any funds raised will go toward fulfilling the costs associated with the rewards first, along with those basic costs required to bring the story to life (i.e. paper, ink, etc). 

In return for you generosity, I have a host of awesome perks** (or rewards) set up so that you get something of great value.  Some of these items will be available post-publication and some won't.  Perks range from digital pre-release copies of the story, right through to being turned into a character in this story (or subsequent, if you prefer).  They're all set out to be that big thank you that I want to give each contributor, in person, but for geographical reasons, might not be able to just now. However, even on their own, they're great value for money, with discounts ranging from 25% off to 66% off! So please be assured that when you contribute, you're not only helping bring Otter & Red to life, but you're also getting a product well worth your investment. 

**If you contribute at any level before December 23rd, you'll receive a free Otter & Red colouring book, delivered to you on December 24th with plenty of time for download or home printing. A great stocking stuffer for any lover of animals, history archaeology or colouring, you'll have to act fast if you want a copy, because this colouring book will be heading back up to Santa's vaults on Christmas Eve.

 

The Impact

 

I won't turn this campaign pitch into a personal CV, but on a personal/professional level, I have had success with all of my past projects, whether personal pursuits or professional goals.  The educational programme I started several years ago saw a 33% drop in feelings of relative deprivation within only 2-years of operation, and over that same 2-year period, I managed to raise almost £5,000 to cover the costs of the programme and a festival to accompany it.  I understand event management, and am a great belief in good time management.  When I make a commitment, I get through it on target every time, and Otter & Red will be no different.

I've made it through so much in my life...  My dream as a child and teenager was to be a Disney animator, but when my dad's sickness made artschool a sideshelfed dream, I didn't let not going to art school stop me from exploring creative pursuits.  I minored in art alongside my BA in history, cobbled together a degree while begging for permission to write a thesis for my masters, and then moved to Edinburgh Scotland where a second masters dovetailed into a PhD and charitable educational programme. I'm a professional scuba diver, work with kids and individuals with disabilities (to get them all involved in archaeology, history and/or the water), and absolutely love illustrating.  I've been busy and motivated, and I feel confident that I can make this book like none other on the market. 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

This is my first fictional story being readied for publication.  Although I have written many academic pieces, from dissertations to policy memos and article publications in between, this fictional piece is a big step forward for me.  It not only represents a little piece of all of the things I have done and that I am, but also all of the things I have always wanted to be, so if I fail in this project, I fail massively. 

However, Otter & Red also has the potential to be my leaping off point... I already have first draft manuscripts for the creation of a series of Otter & Red adventure stories, along with nearly a dozen other educational children's book hanging in the backdrop, all based in a type of history or heritage, and all hoping to inspire kids and rouse their imaginations, curiosities, and innate talents. 

Foreseeable problems...?  A lack of interest in the story and this campaign.  Should the campaign fail to raise even the minimal funds required to publish in physical form, I'll focus on digitally publishing and target a smaller readership.  Sadly, that scenario largely means kids without access to digital devices will not have access to Otter & Red. 

 

Otter Ways You Can Help (pun intended...)

 

If you simply can't contribute, but you're still here with me, thanks.  There are plenty of ways you can help out that won't cost you a dime!  Please go ahead and share this campaign.  Maybe you can share it on Facebook or Twitter, or maybe you're part of an email group.  Perhaps you don't love social media or don't know how to share things to it... That's ok!  Give a hand-written copy of the link to your friends, take it with you to your local book club or library, or pass it on to your coworkers.  Every share is one more possibility to get Otter & Red on a shelf, and so every share is deeply appreciated.

story:
FACED WITH DEATH, I ASKED MYSELF, "WAS IT WORTH IT?"

As with many people, after graduating from college, practicality won out over passion and idealism. I took a job as an intellectual property paralegal and forced myself to choke down my sadness and frustration in a job where I was never happy.

On the day of September 11, 2001, when something I never imagined could happen DID happen, I realized, "I'm no different from the people who went to work this morning and died. They will never again get to see the precious people they love." I asked myself, if I had only a few moments to live, how would I answer this question: "Was it worth it?" The only answer that came to me was, "NO. It's just not worth it." 

Why was I torturing myself if it wasn't even worth it? I knew on that day that life was too short and too precious. I had to find another way to live... a way that would truly allow me to live.

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY PARALEGAL ESCAPES HER GILDED CAGE!

It was one of the most courageous things I've ever done. I left behind a "cushy" job, earning the most money I've ever earned, because I desperately wanted to live my life before I died. I didn't even know what I was going to do; I just knew it had to come from my heart. 

I wanted the energy I put into the world to come from LOVE and JOY instead of fear and misery.

I wanted to be of service in the world."

I wanted to find my unique way of contributing in the world. I found it through writing and teaching.

COURAGEOUS WOMAN GIVES UP GOLDEN HANDCUFFS TO FOLLOW HER HEART AND WRITE A BOOK!

I have long believed that helping every human being fulfill his or her fullest potential -- and reaching our own fullest potential -- is the greatest thing we can do in life. I long to do that for myself and I long to help others do the same. That is why I teach. That is why I coach. That is why I write books. I want to share everything I have to share. I want to give everything I have to give.

But in the world we live in, often it requires certain "credentials" like a Master's Degree. I found that to be true of myself. I taught creative writing at Colorado Free University for 10 years, but I couldn't support myself.

I made tweaks to my life here and there, but it wasn't enough. Finally, I packed up everything I owned, stuffed my car to the gills with as much as it could hold, and said goodbye to Denver. 

I drove to Los Angeles to attend the MFA program in screenwriting at UCLA. I wanted to make my dreams of being a writer come true. I wanted to tell compelling stories like those that have impacted me, like The Hunger Games and Arrival. If you've never seen Arrival, check it out!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mU93Z6N8QeA
 

I found that L.A. was no easier than Denver, and I missed everyone and everything I loved, so I applied for a master's degree in creative writing at Western State Colorado University in Gunnison, Colorado.

MY GIFTS TO YOU -- THE PERKS YOU CAN RECEIVE

The perks I'm offering are related to the work I've been doing over the past 12 years to support myself, the work that I love.

I'm offering workshops in tarot-astrology, creative writing, nonviolent communication, The Artist's Way, and Digital Marketing for Entrepreneurs. I'm also offering copies of my books, The Power of Manifestation and In the Magic Flow, plus tarot-astrology readings, and much more!

MY TRACK RECORD

I have a successful track record when it comes to academic endeavors. When I graduated from high school, I was awarded a two-year scholarship to Red Rocks Community College. I graduated cum laude from the University of Denver with a double major and a double minor, and honors in economics, Since beginning the master's degree at Western State, I have received straight A's. My education is important to me, and I take it seriously.

Also, I have been teaching creative writing since 2006 when I began facilitating my first creative writing workshop at Colorado Free University.

One of my flash fiction stories, "How Temperance Made a Decision" was published in the Fast Forward Press 2012 Flash Fiction Anthology. 

https://fastforwardflash.wordpress.com/author-b...

WHAT I'M DOING NOW

Over the years, I've written six novels and several non-fiction books, some of which I self-published, and some of which I hope to find a home for in traditional publishing. After decades of teaching and writing, I decided to go on for a master's degree in order to open up opportunities for teaching at the university level or work in publishing.

The purpose of my campaign is to raise funds to help pay for the summer semester on campus at Western State Colorado University in Gunnison, Colorado this July. Although the summer semester is still six months away, I have to plan and prepare now to make sure I have the funds to cover the costs.

I'm in a two-year program. By this summer, I will be half-way through the program. I don't want to interrupt the process when I'm already half-way to the finish line. Unfortunately, the graduate program does not have financial aid to cover the summer semester, so I must raise the funds myself.

Achieving this educational goal will make a huge difference in terms of the professional opportunities that will open up to me, such as teaching in a university or working in publishing. I long to fulfill my potential, give what I have inside me to give to the world, and earn an income that allows me to pay forward all the help that my community, friends, and family have given to me over the years.

I'm reaching out to my community, the people I've known for years, people I've met through Colorado Free University and Rocky Mountain Compassionate Communication Network, my writing community, my NVC community, my creative community, and my spiritual community, and of course, all of my friends and family.

What I Need

Tuition, books, and supplies will be approximately $3000, but being on campus for an intensive two-week session means that I won't be able to work for two weeks, which will be a loss of income that I need to pay my normal bills & expenses, so I am also requesting help with that, which would be approximately $1000.

The Challenges

The most significant challenges I've found since I began the master's program in July 2017 is the amount of work that is required. During the fall and spring semesters, we have two classes online. Each one has a significant amount of reading and writing involved. It's like a full-time job.

Since I also work full-time, I have to be extremely disciplined and focused. It's important for me to manage my time and resources as wisely as possible.

Along with the Master's Degree and my full-time temp work at a law firm in DTC, I also teach the NVC Fundamentals workshop at JUC in Golden: http://evondavis.com/blog1/2018/01/12/the-art-o...

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

If you have any suggestions about how I might better promote my products and services, I would love to hear them.

If you have any suggestions about how I can improve my campaign, I would also love to hear those suggestions.

I welcome any and all gifts of money, suggestions, knowledge, connections, blessings and well-wishes. If you have any questions, feel free to get in touch with me. I'd love to hear from you!

After decades of teaching and writing, I decided to go on for a master's degree in order to open up opportunities for teaching at the university level or work in publishing.The purpose of my campaign is to raise funds to help pay for the summer semester on campus at Western State Colorado University in Gunnison, Colorado this July. Although the summer semester is still six months away, I have to plan and prepare now to make sure I have the funds to cover the costs.I'm in a two-year program. By this summer, I will be half-way through the program. I don't want to interrupt the process when I'm already half-way to the finish line. Unfortunately, the graduate program does not have financial aid to cover the summer semester, so I must raise the funds myself.Achieving this educational goal will make a huge difference in terms of the professional opportunities that will open up to me, such as teaching in a university or working in publishing. I long to fulfill my potential, give what I have inside me to give to the world, and earn an income that allows me to pay forward all the help that my community, friends, and family have given to me over the years.I'm reaching out to my community, the people I've known for years, people I've met through Colorado Free University and Rocky Mountain Compassionate Communication Network, my writing community, my NVC community, my creative community, and my spiritual community, and of course, all of my friends and family.What I NeedTuition, books, and supplies will be approximately $3000, but being on campus for an intensive two-week session means that I won't be able to work for two weeks, which will be a loss of income that I need to pay my normal bills & expenses, so I am also requesting help with that, which would be approximately $1000.The ChallengesThe most significant challenges I've found since I began the master's program in July 2017 is the amount of work that is required. During the fall and spring semesters, we have two classes online. Each one has a significant amount of reading and writing involved. It's like a full-time job.Since I also work full-time, I have to be extremely disciplined and focused. It's important for me to manage my time and resources as wisely as possible.Along with the Master's Degree and my full-time temp work at a law firm in DTC, I also teach the NVC Fundamentals workshop at JUC in Golden: http://evondavis.com/blog1/2018/01/12/the-art-o...Other Ways You Can HelpPlease help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.You can use the Indiegogo share tools!If you have any suggestions about how I might better promote my products and services, I would love to hear them.If you have any suggestions about how I can improve my campaign, I would also love to hear those suggestions.I welcome any and all gifts of money, suggestions, knowledge, connections, blessings and well-wishes. If you have any questions, feel free to get in touch with me. I'd love to hear from you!

story:
The morning After is a zine project dedicated to providing self-care resources to survivors of sexual violence.  This zine hopes to provide stories, art, self-care suggestions, and more to become a resource through which survivors can reflect and take steps to move forward. I noticed a real lack of useful resources available - everything I could find focussed on legal, medical and clinical action. Though these are valid and necessary steps for some people, they do not represent a complete picture of what we need. Instead, I found solace in the friends and other survivors, in listening to their stories, hearing their advice, and getting their resources. I created the Morning After Zine to extend that community, compile those stories, advice, etc and make it all more accessible for other survivors.

 

The Morning After Zine is a publication that combines self-care tips with creative writing and visual art. My hope is that this combination of mediums will provide the emotional connection of a creative zine with the information and healing of a DIY self-care zine. Our zine will not be sold for profit, but donated to shelters and other organizations that work with survivors. That's why your support is so important to help us make these resources accessible for as many survivors as possible! 

 

I want the zine to not only be a publication, but a community. We also host a series of writing and self-care workshops and activities. These workshops aim to take the idea of radical inclusivity that inspired the zine movement and extend it to self-care and mental health by creating a space for everyone to heal together.

 

What we Need

We are raising money to print the first issue of the Morning After Zine. The zines will then be donated to organizations that help survivors so that they can give them to survivors who might need/want them. Any extra funds raised will be used to put on self care workshops and the rest will be donated to organizations that work with survivors.

Here's a more detailed budget of our costs for the next six months:

  • Printing Zines for Donation : $1200
  • Marketing: $500 
  • Workshop Materials: $300 
  • Indiegogo Perks: $500

 

 

The Impact

The Morning After Zine is a platform to share your story and hear it reflected back. It is a community of people who have been where you are and can give you advice. It is a vehicle to channel and hold your trauma. It is a resource to learn about how to take care of yourself.

I know it has been all of this for me and for our writers. I believe it can have the same impact on survivors reading it, which is why we are trying to raise money to donate as many copies as possible so survivors can access it for free.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, please consider sharing this campaign or checking out our website morningafterzine.tumblr.com to join our community!


You can also email us at themorningafterzine@gmail.com to submit art or writing or if you are an organization, request donations and copies of the zine.

story:
Hello, I'm Z.W. Mohr, author of the award winning fairy tale series Desdemona's Dreams. I want to start by thanking everyone that contributed to our last campaign for The Land of Mar, you made it possible. And now I want to thank everyone looking at my new campaign to raise money for my next book, A Song of Dreams. Everyone is busy, and I appreciate you taking the time to peruse my ask for help in furthering these tales about the importance of friendship, the value of imagination, and the empowerment of young minds to create a better world. I built a small publishing house to put a roof over this series head while it grows, and it's growing up beautifully. 

A little bit about me: My home is in the magical city of New Orleans, a place where stories grow like jasmine vines, and houses whisper secrets when you walk past them. You just have to learn how to listen. I've spent over nine years in this city, and I'm still learning it's beautiful language. It's the place where my series, Desdemona's Dreams, really found its feet, learned how to walk, and can even move to a beat. I'm thankful to have such a place to call home, and hope to share the inspiration it gives me through the stories and poems I write for you.

"What is the campaign all about?" You so graciously ask.

Let me tell you. I started publishing this series 2 years ago, with the help of my incredible friend/amazing artist Aaron Damon Porter, and the talented layout/design stylings of Dare Porter at Real Time Design, along with the help of a patient partner, a number of friends, and countless eagle-eyed editors. It's been a fascinating road of learning how to publish, write, and market, at the same time. Our first two books, To Dream of Dancing, and The Land of Mar, both won Outstanding Children's Book of the Year from the Independent Author Network. This was a beautiful boost of confidence, coupled with the fan videos, letters, and pictures, sent to us by adults and children alike. To give back even more to our fans, I started including free digital download read-along audiobooks that I recorded at the fantastical LeStrange Fantastique Recording Studios in Atlanta, Georgia. With every book I've sold personally I've been able to give the codes for downloading, and soon every book will come directly from me since my goal is to become the wholesale distributor for all of Desdemona's Dreams. I want to cut out the middle-man, so I can give the best price to you, schools, libraries, and independent bookstores. 

Beyond just the logistics of pricing, I want to perform more outreach to kids themselves. Desdemona's Dreams is about how powerful our imaginations are, and the kind of world we can create by exercising them. Young people are some of the greatest fountains of wonder, sometimes they just need to be given the space to express it, or the encouragement. For this upcoming book I made a Create A Dream Creature Contest, and then I contacted all of the K-8th schools in New Orleans to offer it up to their students. It was free, and required only the spark of imagination, and a little bit of time. I appreciate every teacher that got back to me, and offered it to their students (I know how busy you are, my mom was a teacher). Aaron Porter and I went over all of the thoughtful, fun, and mischievous creatures that were sent to us, and we settled on a creature called Muffin, created by former Arise Academy student Archanna Byrd. Her character is now written into a pinnacle moment of the story, and is being redrawn and colored by the artist of the series, Aaron Damon Porter. Archanna added the perfect element to this book, so she's getting her picture in the back with a bio alongside Aaron's and mine. Behold the power of Muffin!

Our Funding 

I want to be completely transparent with all of you about the funding you're providing, because the contributions you're giving makes all of it possible. 

The amount I'm trying to raise is $12,000. This is how it breaks down:

● $3,000 to the artist 

● $2,000 to the layout/designer/photographer

● $5,000 for the first run of books

● $2,000 for the marketing 

With the funding from our last campaign I was able to pay my creative team, and cover some of the costs of the first run of The Land of Mar. With every extra bit of funding I'm able to push the series a little farther, reach out more to kids, schools, libraries, and independent book shops. I'm working on becoming the wholesale distributor of the series as well, so that I can offer better prices to everyone out there. I believe in the power of stories, and I haven't let any hurdles stop me from putting them out into the world.  

Why is this project so important?

Because it's not just about fantastical adventures, though those are important for growth. It's about empowering kids to believe in themselves, even when no one else does. It's about how important the choices we make are, and that our imaginations are what can help us build a better world, and figure our who we're really meant to be. And last, but not least, it's about the strength that comes from friends when we believe in them too. 

I know everyone out there doesn't have the money to contribute. I really get it since I'm an artist trying to run a small business myself. If you just don't have the extra funds to contribute, I'd appreciate you telling others about this campaign. Even if you do have the funds to contribute, please tell everyone about this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools already set up on the site. Share this on Facebook. Tweet us on Twitter. Take a picture and Instagram it to all of your followers. Every little bit you do gets this series that much closer to someone else that needs a good story to help them believe in themselves. The world is what you make it!

Thank you!

All the unicorns,

Z.W. Mohr

story:
#StopTheCrap

World…We have a problem!

Dributts is an Atlanta based non-profit with the mission to help control fecal-related diseases among children in developing countries. Simply stated, we save lives with our unique reusable diaper in developing countries. 

Did you know that 2,195 children die everyday from diarrhea? In 2013, 1.6 million children died from simple fecal-related diseases in developing countries and 2.4 billion people live without access to proper sanitation. That means more people have access to cell phones than toilets and diapers!

Even if all those real-life stats from the CDC didn’t get your skin crawling or make you extremely frustrated, then take "The Dributts Challenge."  Allow your baby or a friend's baby to run around your house for a day with no diaper (or cleaning supplies), and see how safe you feel from fecal-related diseases in your own home!

              


Will You Help Us #StopTheCrap?

DriButts is launching the #StopTheCrap Movement to raise awareness and funds to help reduce the number of children who die from fecal-related diseases.  Our goal is to raise $45,000 in just 60 days which will allow us to give away 3,000 Dributts diapers and help over 1,500 families. 

This will also allow us to move our manufacturing to Haiti! The #StopTheCrap Movement will create jobs and a new industry that could open new doors. Please consider joining the movement and help us change lives!



    

Why do babies need Dributts Diapers?

Dributts was an idea that came to Michael Wahl, founder, while leading a mission trip in Haiti. He was working in a local village repairing wells and building latrines when he noticed that the babies were naked. He saw babies defecating in their homes, on their caretakers, by the food source, and by the water source. He had just built latrines for the adults and older children, but the babies could not use the latrines. Knowing the leading cause of sickness, disease, and death in third world countries is fecal matter, he knew he had to do something. 

Michael returned from Haiti with the idea to take diapers back with him.  He did some research on diapers and learned that regular cloth diapers would not work because they were made of heavy materials such as fleece, cotton, and hemp. They would be too hot, hold onto bacteria, and in the Haitian heat, would cause diaper rash and chaffing which could lead to infection and cause another problem. Disposable diapers would not work because of the expense, and they create a sanitation issue since they have no place to properly dispose of the diapers. Michael knew of some Haitians washing and reusing disposable diapers until they fell apart.



Not just any diaper will work in developing countries. A unique diaper was needed to work in the worst conditions around the world, so Michael talked with his wife and asked her for some ideas. After some brainstorming, they came up with the idea to try a dri-fit moisture-wicking material that is breathable. Michael then asked his wife, who did not know how to sew, to make some diapers. She referred him to a friend who has a home sewing business making cloth diapers. The friend was happy to help and developed a pattern for Dributts. She also made the first sets of diapers. When she became too busy with her business to continue, she taught Starla, Michael’s wife, how to sew the diapers. Then Starla recruited some volunteers who did not know how to sew, and they learned to make the diapers. Together they made over 700 diapers! Finally, Dributts found a manufacturer which has been a great help.

Simple sanitation, hygiene, and education will significantly reduce the risk of fecal- related deaths and overall help the health of the communities in developing countries around the world.



The DriButts Diaper showing off!

Our diaper was created to work in extreme environments with hot climates and where there is no running water or electricity. The diaper is breathable and lightweight which allows airflow. It not only absorbs urine, but also wicks away the moisture if the diaper is not changed right away.

The bamboo insert has natural antibacterial and antimicrobial properties so it helps prevent infection. It is adjustable and designed to fit a newborn through age two, and it may fit a small three year old. The diaper can be washed in a bucket with soap and water and should be hung up to dry. The outer shell dries in about twenty minutes, and the insert dries in about forty-five minutes. The diaper is reusable and lasts the baby through three years of age, and it can be used for multiple babies. 

How can you get involved?

Donate: 

Join the #StopTheCrap Movement and help us reach our goal of 3,000 diapers. This will change 1,500 families lives and help them control disease in their communities. DriButts is a 501(c)3 Non-Profit and all financial gifts are tax deductible.

Get Social: 

Share our campaign on social media and tell your community about what we are doing. The power of influence is your greatest super power. Please help us by telling everyone you know.

DriButts Gathering: 

We are launching the #StopTheCrap tour beginning April 2, and we will be stopping in different locations until June 2. Check out the schedule and invite people to personally meet our DriButts team and hear our story. All locations will be listed on the #StopTheCrap Movement tour schedule.

More Info At Dributts.com

story:
A Broken Road Leads the Way!

     Maggie Hundshamer, a mother of two, uses her own personal experiences with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder to help other veterans connect with their children after returning home from war. The book will be available in both mother and father veteran and non veteran versions! Kindle will be available as well!

Cause and Effect:

     Active duty service members are sent overseas every single day equipped with the knowledge and training they need to effectively carry out missions. What they are not equipped for is coming home. When a service member returns home from a war torn environment and is placed in the "real world," coping can be harder than combat. Many veterans struggle to find ways to effectively communicate and spend time with their children. They struggle to find the right words to tell them why they came back different. This book has the power to effect the masses by helping veterans from all walks of life reconnect with their loved ones after returning home from war.

     My goal is to raise $6000.00 to self publish and put my story in the hands of thousands of people. Every donation or purchase will go directly towards the illustration completion, format completion, and lastly the printing and binding of the final product. You will have the ability to purchase a single copy, a signed copy, or have the option to donate a book to help a veteran who may not have the funds to purchase one on their own.  There are other perks as well! You may have an arranged phone meeting with me or an in person speaking experience for your business, event, or classroom! If for some reason our goal is not met, the campaign will be extended until EVERY order is fulfilled!

Dust Yourself Off!

      With every adventure there are risks. The risk I foresee is time. If for some reason there is a delay in production, you will be notified of the updated timeline and delivery of your purchase! I will make sure to keep everyone as informed as possible! I am a Marine, and Marines don't give up! I will finish this product and make it the best version I possibly can!

Just a Little Love!

     If for some reason you choose not to purchase your copy or a copy for someone else, that is okay! Just show a little love! Please use one of Indiegogo's many share features and please pass it on to someone who may have an interest! Thank you all for your love and support, I cant wait for you to hold my book!
story_txt: A Broken Road Leads the Way!     Maggie Hundshamer, a mother of two, uses her own personal experiences with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder to help other veterans connect with their children after returning home from war. The book will be available in both mother and father veteran and non veteran versions! Kindle will be available as well!Cause and Effect:     Active duty service members are sent overseas every single day equipped with the knowledge and training they need to effectively carry out missions. What they are not equipped for is coming home. When a service member returns home from a war torn environment and is placed in the "real world," coping can be harder than combat. Many veterans struggle to find ways to effectively communicate and spend time with their children. They struggle to find the right words to tell them why they came back different. This book has the power to effect the masses by helping veterans from all walks of life reconnect with their loved ones after returning home from war.      My goal is to raise $6000.00 to self publish and put my story in the hands of thousands of people. Every donation or purchase will go directly towards the illustration completion, format completion, and lastly the printing and binding of the final product. You will have the ability to purchase a single copy, a signed copy, or have the option to donate a book to help a veteran who may not have the funds to purchase one on their own.  There are other perks as well! You may have an arranged phone meeting with me or an in person speaking experience for your business, event, or classroom! If for some reason our goal is not met, the campaign will be extended until EVERY order is fulfilled!Dust Yourself Off!      With every adventure there are risks. The risk I foresee is time. If for some reason there is a delay in production, you will be notified of the updated timeline and delivery of your purchase! I will make sure to keep everyone as informed as possible! I am a Marine, and Marines don't give up! I will finish this product and make it the best version I possibly can!Just a Little Love!     If for some reason you choose not to purchase your copy or a copy for someone else, that is okay! Just show a little love! Please use one of Indiegogo's many share features and please pass it on to someone who may have an interest! Thank you all for your love and support, I cant wait for you to hold my book!

story:
Short Summary

Here is some brief information about the campaign and myself
  • My name is Juelle Cadette and I am writer from the island of Saint Lucia. It is my dream to become an established author and it can become a reality with your help. I love writing Historical Fiction and adventure stories but decided to try my hand at writing thrillers. 
  • Dark Spaces, is a collection of thrilling, short stories which takes a peek into the lives of 8 persons, whose decisions ultimately changes the course of the lives of the people around them. 
  • This is will be my first publication and I've decided to take the self-publishing route through Amazon's Createspace. With your help, this book will be made available to millions across the world.


What We Need & What You Get

Here's what your money will put towards:

  • USD 249- custom book cover 
  • USD 919- 2 rounds of professional editing (Chicago Manual of Style, 16th edition)
  • USD 19/ 89- Ebook & Print book formatting
  • The rest of money will be put towards book marketing/advertising through online, print, radio, merchandise & book shows.
  • The more you donate, the more free gifts you get; from books, tours and t-shirts!
  • If I don't reach my goal, the amount will be put towards one of the objectives, if less than 50 USD, it will be donated to WWF.

story:
Nibnook is a patent pending system for writers of every genre and experience level. The tool provides your storyline as well as the perspective of every character in your writing project.  It offers in-depth information about your story, characters and worlds.  Nibnook does not take the place of your creativity, imagination or skill as a writer; it simply provides you with deeper insight into every aspect of your story.

What is nibnook?

For the writer, nibnook is simple.  

Nibnook has created a series of archetypal questions to help you think about your story in meaningful ways. Your answers are plugged into the nibnook algorithm and your story, world, and characters come to life. With this revolutionary system, you can freely develop your unique ideas with multiple versions of your stories, characters, and worlds. You can then start writing in nibnook’s custom writing space and use its guided story creation process.




                                 

How Does it Work?



What We Need & What You Get

Developing nibnook has been a bootstrap endeavor. We have successfully tested nibnook on a one-on-one basis with new writers and published authors. Now we are seeking assistance from you to make nibnook accessible to the public. Your donation will allow us to continue to fund the development of the software, beta test it and launch the platform.

Stretch Goals

$30,000 or more: Development of front and back end, beta testing and soft launch.

$50,000 or more: Nibnook expansion for character development and world building.

$70,000 or more: Development of additional features that enhance and build-out the platform.

  • The creation of real-time triggering events. These moments add layers and depth to each section or chapter. The nibnook software already provides incredible detail about your characters, stories and worlds. But just like our daily lives, the lives of your characters change and flow based on their daily interactions. Reaching this goal will allow us to create the additional software needed for writers to access to this invaluable information.

  • The development of the Quarterly Section. This is where you can acquire minute-by-minute information about your stories. In this section, you can input a random question about your story, and nibnook will comb through your customized algorithm to find the answer.

  • Creation of a character relationship analysis. This aspect of nibnook will enable you to see how your characters trigger each other throughout each section of your story.

The Impact

Nibnook has done what was once thought impossible. This platform generates your story outline, develops your characters and builds your worlds by you answering just a few short questions.

Nibnook has created a streamlined process that has drastically cut down on the time you need to develop a character. With nibnook, what would normally take you weeks to develop can be generated in a few minutes.

The software created by nibnook is the first of its kind and making it available to the public will give those with the passion and desire to write the tools and space needed to realize their goals and dreams.


Risks & Challenges

There are a few challenges that we face in the development of the software:

1.  The software is a complex system on the back end, but it must remain simple and intuitive to the user.

Although the algorithm is a complex, we have paid careful attention to ensure the development of an intuitive and simple user interface. The creator and developers are writers, so we understand the basic needs of a writer. The goal is to ease the amount of work the user has to do before they acquire their storybooks and story map.


2.  Nibnook’s back end contains an enormous amount of data that must be carefully expanded and modified on a continuous basis as we learn from our users and their behaviors.

We are creating a platform that provides an incredible amount data and information to the user. Our goal is to tailor the data to match the needs of our users in a constructive way. Because of the potential for diverse perspectives, the hard work of modifying the data will come from writers giving us information about their needs as they navigate through the nibnook platform.


3.  The tool is a new concept. Nibnook’s crown jewel is its intuitive algorithm that will change the way the public interfaces with an online platform. This provides the challenge of a built-in learning curve for the user.

We are overcoming these challenges in the following ways.:

  • Creating a user experience that is organic in its process.

  • Marketing the platform in a way that details the ease in usability.

  • Providing short tutorials that help users navigate the platform.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute to our campaign. You can donate, and/or share this campaign with your friends, family, contacts and networks.


Thank you. We will see you when the nibnook website launches.

story:
Short Summary

The "WHO and WHY"

  • M.D. (Michael Dirk) Thalmann is a novelist and freelance journalist specializing in satire and science fiction, who lives in Phoenix, Arizona with his wife, children, and ornery cats. He reads too much and sleeps too little. M.D. has been doing journalism and writing fiction and so on since he was ten years old or so and has gotten at least 20% better in that time. Today M.D. writes a column for North Valley Magazine and publishes Sci-fi novels through Space Dock Ltd., a subsidiary of Tickety Boo Press in London. When he isn't consumed with that, he is with the family and cursing his cats.

  • With the money raised, we will be supporting three artists. 1. Vince Griffin is a commercial artist and professional designer. He will be completing the cover design (you have seen the rough draft of the front cover only). 2. Nick Ralph is a musician and professional Voice actor who has done multiple audio books and cartoons. He and M.D. established a working relationship relatively early in both of their respective careers while working on 13 Lives, and M.D. insists on using him for his new novel. 3. M.D. will be able to maintain creative control over the book. His work on 13 Lives was enough to land him a publisher, every artist's dream, and the publisher will get Static, but if they get it now, they control cover design and audio rights (which they have confirmed must be done in-house). In order to use M.D.s team, this project must reach its funding goal. Space Dock will run the designs/audio funded by this campaign on their platform, once it is complete.
  • Your contributions and sharing on social media will be a boon to the local arts community in three cities, as well as an inspiration to other skilled artists who struggle each day to find time to use their gifts and pay bills at the same time.
  •  

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Do or die goal: $1,500.00. $300 for the cover design. this has been paid out of the author's wife's vacation fund and must be repaid first thing or he will be sleeping alone with those ornery cats. Negotiated rate per finished hour of audio, multiplied by ACX's algorithm's estimated finished hours based on word count, equals $1,200.00 for audiobook production.
  • For each contribution you will get either an ebook, paperback, hardcover, audiobook, or some combination of those perks. Additional perks will be in the form of being immortalized in the book's dedications as a key contributor.
  • Should we fail to meet the goal: The first three hundred will go to pay back MD.s wife, because he is not stupid. Everything over that will either a) be offered to the audio production team to take the job with royalty share to cover the gap or b) be used to create book trailers and fund ads on Facebook, Amazon, Goodreads, etc. 

The Impact

  • Supporting local artists is pertinent to having a worthwhile culture. Allowing for creators to present work to large audiences without compromising on the content gives way to TRUE art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • no matter if you are in a place to help out financially, or not, please share this link to your Facebook, Twitter, blog, etc. There are share tools provided by IndieGoGo to make it easy and fast.

    Everything is greatly appreciated, thank you for your time.

And that's all I have to say about that.

story:
Aloha!

My name is Heather Jacks, and I am a college educated, Award Winning Writer. I am also a Disco Loving Wine Ninja, Die Hard San Francisco Giants Fan--(#55Forever) and overall Seinfeld Trivia Geek--(try me!) 

I am creating a Limited Edition art style-coffee-table book celebrating the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence.

(Photo Credit: Fred Gebhardt)

My first project of this nature was The Noise Beneath the Apple®.

 It received a 4.5 Star Review from the San Francisco Book Review, won a Book of the Year Award and a Shelf Unbound Award for Outstanding Art Book. 

THE STORY:

Two years ago, I did not know who the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence were.  I was invited to work on Project Nunway, here in San Francisco. Project Nunway is a fashion show, put on by the Sisters, (who are a 21st century order of queer Drag Nuns). All proceeds raised go to charity. I had an amazing time designing for Sister Agnes dei Afta Tamara and was inspired by the Sisters; who they are and the work they are doing in the community. 

 I volunteered for a few other things and then attended their grant giving event, which was held at Oasis Nightclub. They granted money to all sorts of organizations and projects, including Prison Re-Entry Programs, historical preservation, fringe art projects, school music programs, homeless shelters and the list went on.

(Here is a 5 minute short film by Fred Gebhardt, telling a little about who the Sisters are. Fred will be collaborating with us on the final photos and book cover. He also created our 'pitch' video. Boys got some talent!)

What I realized was, that this was a group of people, of men, and women, young and old; straight and gay and everything in between—who were like you and me in many ways. They had jobs and families; they had husbands and wives; they love, they are loved; they took the bus, drank beer and walked their dogs. But along the way, they had made a commitment, like Nuns do, of service o their communities.  They have a timeless message of hope and unity; of empathy; of community and of joy. It is a message that the world needs to hear.

I wanted to share that message and commonality of spirit. The way I chose to do that was to create a Limited Edition art-style, coffee table book celebrating the Sisters… in their own words. What that means, is that I am sharing personal and intimate stories from some of the San Francisco Sisters themselves, coupled with photos and notes from the community.

This project, is my ‘love letter’ to San Francisco specifically, and to the world at large; because although the Sisters began in San Francisco in 1979, today they have become an international activist and charity organization, which extends to over 50 cities in our own country and more than 10 countries worldwide; and The Sisters continue to grow every day. Above all; this gives me hope for the future.

WHAT WE HAVE DONE SO FAR:

Two years ago, I began creating this book project, with Benjamin Benoit, a fantastic L.A. based photographer---who I met while enjoying cocktails in Santa Monica....(because no good story every started with, I was eating a salad.)

In that time, we have interviewed the remaining founders, some original Sisters and some current San Francisco Sisters. In August 2016, we went to Nashville--(aka: the surface of the sun); to connect with the first Fully Professed African-American Sister; Sr. Freida Peoples.

And Sister Soami deLux, one of the Co-Founders of the Sisters.

We have over 7000 photos and 30 hours of audio so far!

(Here are some outtakes from the Ben's photo shoots. They are looking good!)

WHAT ARE WE DOING NOW?

Now, we are at the Cover Shoot of the book and here is we need you to play and create with us.

In April, we will shoot the cover of the book.  The cover of a book can make or break the project. A good cover can make the book jump off the shelves; a ‘not so good’ cover, can make the book a doorstop. That being said; here is our vision:

We will be renting a San Francisco cable car for FOUR hours on Saturday, April 15th. During that FOUR hour ride, we will be trekking through the amazing City by the Bay, visiting iconic locales and creating our book cover. There will be music, an open bar and Sisters from across the globe; including two of the founders! Additionally, we have some special 'Sister' activities planned along the way.

I chose April 15th, because it is the weekend of Conclave and Easter; which happens to be the Sisters Birthday Party!! Sisters come from around the globe to participate in this weekend; and we want to capture as many Sisters and aspiring Sisters, as we can on film. Additionally, I am bringing Sister Hysterectoria, one of the Co-Founders, from New Orleans to San Francisco to participate in the shoot--and YOU can join us too!

SOME OF OUR MAIN EXPENSES ARE:

Travel:

Airfare for Sister Hysterectoria to and from New Orleans.

Airfare for Benjamin Benoit to and from L.A.  

Cable Car Rental:

This includes the cable car itself, a conductor, special permits, licenses and insurance.

Lyft Rides for Crew.

Photographer.

Photographers Assistant.

Cameras, Lenses, Microphones, Lighting, Special Equipment.

Photo Editing.

Craft Services.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP OUT:

We need you to help us make some noise about this campaign. Please--(pretty please)-- share this project with any friends or family, who might dig it. Spread the word on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and any other social outlets that you can think of.

Thank you so much for being here and participating. Can't wait to share the results with you!

story:
#DiscordianProblems

Fnord University proudly presents the 'comic book-within-a-novel' #DiscordianProblems, a trippy tale about an intrepid, falsely-accused whistle-blower named Noam D. Bloom.  This post-911 meta-fiction lures readers into a bizarre matrix of superheroes, psychedelics, quantum physics, paranoia, surveillance, and the Occult. 

Presented as Bloom's military dossier detailing the surveillance of a mysterious group of occultists known only as 'The Discord Magi', #DiscordianProblems documents Bloom's slow decent into madness (or his ascension into Illumination. I mean, who the hell are we to tell you how to interpret what happens to the poor guy...)

#DiscordianProblems is broken down into 5 discrete sections; ESPionage, the MindFrick comic book, Discord Magick, No One Expects the American Inquisition, and The Celebrity Discordian Menace.

Who Are We and Why The Hell Are We Bugging You?

  • We are just humble MindFrick Missionaries proselytizing on behalf of the "joke" religion Discordianism. Do you have a moment to talk about our Goddess and Muse Eris?
  • We believe there is a strong market for satirical science fiction that explores Discordian and civil-libertarian themes. Please fund this. Don't let them immanentize the Eschaton again!

What We Need & What You'll Get

Ok, here's the bottom-line:

  • We need generous patrons of the language arts to help us cover the expense of graphic design, editing, typesetting, and marketing.
  • Patronage comes with perks! Depending on your level of patronage we are giving free memberships to FnordU.com, Discordian swag, e-books, signed hard copies, and more!

Risks & Challenges

  • Not many. The final draft is complete. The MindFrick comic book is drawn, inked, and lettered too. We are just waiting on professional editing, formatting, and the book cover!
  • We just need is to pay these people (editors, graphic designers, etc)! That's where YOU come in!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Please get the word out and make some noise about #DiscordianProblems (use the hashtag liberally in your social media feeds)!

Much gratitude to those that support starving writers & artists.

Hail Eris!

story:
Short Summary

Click on a perk to pre-order!

 

This is the story of how you create love. 

You may believe love is something that just happens. You think romantic love is like a four-leaf clover - something some people get lucky and find. You may believe some people were meant to have love and others are not or that some people are "good" at love while others are "bad" at it.

Perhaps you think certain conditions need to exist before you can have love. You must be good-looking enough, fun enough, smart enough, rich enough, or healed enough to be lovable.

I was exceptionally bad at finding love. If I wasn't being completely romantically ignored in a bar or at a party, I was probably dating someone I wasn't that into, or who only wanted to sleep with me until they found someone better. I dated men who wouldn't contact me on the weekends. My “first love” play wrestled with my best friend in front of me (we were not children). I was taken on a date to a swingers club for Gang Bang Night as a very unsolicited surprise. I was non-consensually taken to dinner and bowling by my hotel receptionist after I asked him where I could find food nearby (yes, I will reveal all these stories in the book). :)

After years of heartbreak and suffering, I was fairly resigned to being unlovable and incapable of falling in real, fulfilling love. But, I decided I could fix myself. I read books by Marriage and Family Therapists like Esther Perel and John Gottman. I watched every TedTalk with the words “love” or “heartbreak” in the title. I researched tantra and connection techniques. I spent hours consuming articles and YouTube videos by relationship therapists and coaches. I even took a dive into reality TV dating shows. 

And I found answers about why I struggled in love, but they didn’t require that I fix or change myself. 

(I was, in fact, a bit put off by Robert Greene's The Art of Seduction, because I read it as suggesting you need to embody a seductive caricature in order to be desirable and effective at creating love.) I believe you can and do create the best love when you are authentically yourself.

From what I learned, I turned my own love life around 180 degrees. Now several years and plenty of dating success later, I formed a simple system that you can also use to make dating anyone (including current committed partners) fun, empowering, and gratifying:

1. Create Attraction

2. Create Sexual Tension

3. Create Emotional Connection

Each of these steps have energetic, psychological, biological, and hormonal components that can be learned and practiced, by anyone, to create love.

Feminine Seduction is the name of my process for creating love, which I now teach to others in a course of the same name (more info below). 

Feminine in this case is an archetypal energy, rather than a way of being female. It is part of all people, though it usually shows up more strongly in estrogen-predominant people. I like talking in energetic terms because it allows for more flexibility and nuance of gender, sex, and sexuality, whereas the science is still quite new, and studies were done almost exclusively on straight male-female couples. I speak to the feminine energy side because it is the space I personally occupy!

I must acknowledge that I wrote with the filter of being a white, cisgender, heterosexual woman, and these facts informed my experience and parts of how I express my system. I do, however, wholeheartedly believe that everyone has the power to create the love of their dreams using the basics of what I teach.

If the words feminine and seduction make you uncomfortable, you are likely afraid of or uncomfortable with your feminine power and/or your seductive power (how you get what you want and need in life). Consider that you are already seductive, but you may not have examined HOW you use this power.

No matter who you are and what your story has been so far, you can create love.

I hope you will read my book and allow it to enrich your life, or that your curiosity about my atrocious dates will get the best of you ;)

The first draft of this book is written, but I'd love to have your support in making it an incredible published reality!

What I Need & What You Get

$10,000 is how much I need to make this book a reality this year (rather than one that takes me a couple years to complete on my own). Here's what I'm looking at:

  • $2,500 for professional editing
  • $1,000 for professional book cover design and printing layout
  • $5,000 for professional writing support, promotion planning, endorsement guidance - getting a relevant bigger name to recommend my book), book coaching, and self-publishing support (set-up and SEO) to get my book thriving on Amazon and selling to Barnes & Nobles and small bookshops.
  • $1,500 for initial advertising
  • $1,000 for fees and taxes

You get a copy or copies of the final book, some awesome perks, and my undying love and gratitude! <3

The Impact

My intention is to change thousands (and maybe one day millions) of lives through empowerment in love. When people are empowered in love they create more fulfilling relationships with partners AND everyone around them.

This book teaches about the chemical (biological and neurological) and alchemical (energetic and magical) processes involved in creating attraction and connection with a date. You'll find precise how-tos and exercises to help you along the way to becoming an expert creator of love. The techniques are illustrated by the story of my own journey from deeply dysfunctional to deeply fulfilled in love.

Right now I teach the educational content in this book as an online course - which has been called "a vital shift in consciousness," a "MUST have, if you are struggling with embracing dating and/or your sexual/romantic aspects of self," and "love-changing" by graduates. If you or a friend of yours is unhappily single and ready to change that, please reach out to me at avessel4love@gmail.com for more info.

Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach the full $10,000, I am still committed to publishing this book. It will just take me a little longer and the final product won't be as gorgeous as if I had professional help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you just can't contribute $$, that doesn't mean you can't help!!

Please share this with your single friends who want to find love! Indiegogo has easy "Share" tools <3

And that's all there is to it. May you love and be loved.

story:
Who are we, really?

That’s the question I explore in Amazing Mostly True Adventures of Horace Martin. It’s a collection of short stories that detail two things at once: a life being shaped, and a boy exerting the only will he knows—to shape a life all his own. 

The response to my first self-published book (Lesson, Boys' Homes/Prisons/Lunatic Asylums) last year was overwhelming. The encouragement gave me the drive to jump on this book. 

The stories begin in 1953 with my birth in Ireland and change their setting a few years later, with my family’s move to England. Throughout the book, seemingly random personal experiences in both countries create a portrait of my past. The stories, and the memories they recall, ebb and flow, as memories do. Recollections of holiday gatherings, family loyalty and happy times with caring grownups are offset by the harsh realities of prejudice, reform schools, drugs and abuse at the hands of others.

Here’s a sampling:

In “The Road to Notorious,” things aren’t looking so good for me in Britain’s Swinging Sixties. I’ve already forged a life of crime at the age of thirteen. From shoplifting notions to stealing cars, taking drugs, and carving my own path from courtrooms to correctional houses, I’m a seemingly hopeless delinquent who can only disappoint my parents and indulge my worst judgment.

Yet the sum of this book’s stories is to prove that no one person is any one thing. Saints and sinners reside in all of us, something our most honest selves recognize as true. Readers will find moments of true beauty shining in some of the book’s darkest passages. And while these adventures share one leg of my journey (from Ireland to England; for the next book, I plan to share my experience moving from England to America), their existence offers hope.

My words represent my survival. Their life on the page shares the triumph of accountability over self-will. I look forward to sharing them with you.

Who's Horace?

That's me, Horace Martin, the author. I did not conform. I did not have a formal education. I have been a bricklayer, a sailor, a boxer, an actor, a felon, a regular at boys' homes, detention centers, lunatic asylums, and prisons. I am very fortunate to be alive. Hopefully my last job will be this one. I am a poet and an author. Dodgy Bell is the name of my production company (of one author & one book thus far).

Testimonial from my first book, "Lessons":

"The writing, to my ear, runs loyal to the writer: rough, raw, honest to a fault, its sense of humor raucous—and surprisingly tender."

Where's my contribution going?

First, I should tell you that this book campaign was scheduled to launch at the start of 2020. Then the pandemic hit so we thought best to wait. Now, the state in which I live is on fire — California. The gift of the delay is that I have all of the book written. It's ready for the next phase... the editor. The following list is where the contributions will be placed.

  • Book designer
  • Book Cover Artist
  • Editor
  • Printing of the books
  • Shipping of the books + shipping cost + shipping supplies
  • Promo video & graphics for this campaign
  • Social Media marketing for this campaign
  • Perks for the contributors (bookmarks, stickers, tote bags)
  • LIVE Zoom Book Launch Party
  • Campaign processing fees 

What are my perks, Horace?

  • Every contributor will be invited to my LIVE ZOOM Book Launch Party!
  • Plus, you will receive a personal thank you in print, in the book. 
  • Signed book - Amazing Mostly True Adventures of Horace Martin.
  • Dodgy Bell Bookmark
  • Dodgy Bell Sticker
  • Dodgy Bell Tote Bag

I'm truly humbled to share this journey with all of you. You are making dreams come true—my story in print. 

Other Ways I Can Help?

Share my Indiegogo page with your friends and family, and the people of St. Albans. SHARE. SPREAD THE WORD. Visit my facebook page & subscribe to my youtube channel. I will be posting short videos of me sharing a few of the adventures.

story:
Thank you everyone for helping me reach my goal! Anything more than this just means I can print more books, support local printers that are a bit more expensive than the big companies, and make sure the quality is even better! 

Short Summary

This is the story of a little girl with big dreams. With this book I hope to inspire little girls to be whatever they want to be. You will face challenges, get scared, and people will hold you back, but if you set your mind to it you can do anything. 

I travelled for a few years and spent a lot of time sleeping under the stars looking up at the moon. The story was always going through my head while I laid in my sleeping bag at night and I finally decided it was time to write it down. I forgot about it and it sat written for a long time while I continued to travel until I settled down in Australia where I met Anna, from Germany, who offered to do the illustrations. The book finally came to life and I hope that it can inspire children, and adults, to follow their dreams no matter how big or small they are. 

With your contribution I hope to not only inspire children who read this book, but to give children access to books who wouldn't otherwise have that opportunity. With each purchase buyers will have the option to donate a book to a child who can't afford one or donate a percentage to a charity that helps children gain access to books.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $1500 for printing costs. This will allow me to print 200 books in the US and 200 in Australia so I am able to get started and get the book out there. The book is already complete and ready to go so all I need now is to get it printed so kids can read it!

Even if I do not reach my entire goal, any amount of funding helps and I can print a smaller amount of books to start. 

The Impact

I am passionate about this project because I am a female who has often been told that I can't do something because I am too small or it's too dangerous or difficult for a girl. I travelled by myself, built houses, fixed cars, had jobs where I am one of only a couple females, and so many more things that are "just for boys" and I have had many amazing female teachers along the way. I want little girls to know that if there is anything they want to do, they can. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand if you cannot contribute monetarily, but getting the word out is just as important! I would definitely appreciate if you could share my campaign and help children follow their dreams!
